title: Vernal and Nevada Falls via the Mist Trail
short_description: Vernal Fall is only 317 ft (96 m) tall but it is among the most powerful waterfalls in Yosemite. Unlike Yosemite Fall or Bridalveil Fall, Vernal cannot be viewed from the valley floor by car.
long_description: The easiest path is along a well-marked path that begins near the Happy Isles Nature Center. You can a free shuttle bus to Happy Isles Nature Center or walk there from Half Dome Village. From there follow the trailhead to Vernal Fall footbridge (about 1 mile) or continue on to the top of the waterfall. This is a great option if you want to wander through the mist of this very powerful waterfall.

images.caption: hiking trail in California: Vernal and Nevada Falls via the Mist Trail

title: Feldberg
short_description: Short hike through the Bannwald to the summit of the Feldberg

title: Mountain run on the Wank via Daxkapelle middle station, Eckenhütte and Tannenhütte
short_description: Technically easy run on the Wank in Garmisch-Partenkirchen with refreshment stop at the Tannenhütte.
long_description:
This route is one of many ways to let off steam on the Wank. At just under 11 kilometres and less than 600 metres in altitude, this route tends to follow forest paths with a few trail interludes. With the highest point at the Wank middle station, this trail is suitable for running almost all year round.
This trail run takes you from the Wankbahn car park via the Daxkapelle chapel to the middle station and from there via the wonderful view from the unmanaged Eckenhütte hut to the Tannenhütte hut for a potential refreshment stop and back to the Wankbahn car park.

images.caption: Eckenhütte on the Wank in Garmisch-Partenkirchen in summer
View from the Eckenhütte on the Wank in Garmisch-Partenkirchen in winter

title: Winter Round Walk Leiterberg
short_description: This leisurely circular walk just outside Kempten is the perfect way to clear your head for a moment.
long_description: You should plan about one and a half hours for the winter walk around Leiterberg. You also have a beautiful view of the town of Kempten and, in good weather, a great mountain panorama;

title: South Tyrol Ultra Skyrace - Percorso ultra
short_description: Every year at the end of July during the Südtirol Ultra Skyrace event lots of extreme athletes run on this demanding trailrunning route in South Tyrol. But of course, you can face this challenge also in the rest of the year.
long_description: 121 kilometres, 7554 m altitude differential: These hard facts of the Südtirol Ultra Skyrace alone instil a great amount of respect in all extreme athletes. An absence of vertigo and surefootedness are absolute prerequisites to meet this challenge because on this tour you run in the high Alpine terrain of the Sarntal Alps.

title: Tourenplanung am 2024-11-21

title: La Parata Tower
short_description: A few minutes from Ajaccio town centre, the exceptional site of the sanguinary îles « I Sanguinari » qualified as a « Grand Site » by the Ministry of the Environment;This area is being developed in such a way as to allow the peninsula and its tower to be covered in complete safety, while respecting the environment.
long_description: Located at the entrance to the Gulf of Ajaccio, the site offers an exceptional panorama and marine atmosphere in the heart of the coastal maquis.

title: From Vevčani to the mystical mountain village of Gorna Belica
short_description: A beautiful hike from the charming town of Vevčani to the hidden mountain village of Gorna Belica on the slopes of majestic Jablanica in North Macedonia.
long_description: The hike from Vevčani to Gorna Belica is a beautiful and scenic route that takes you through wild beech forests on the foothills of the Jablanica mountain range. Starting in the mountain town of Vevčani, which is known for its traditional architecture and picturesque setting, the hike passes the famous Vevčani springs and the Jankov Kamen Mountain Hut. The trail is well-marked for most parts and takes you to Gorna Belica, a small mountain village sitting at an altitude of over 1,400 meters above sea level and overlooking the plains north of Lake Ohrid. You can explore cultural landmarks such as the old church and the new mosque in the village and take in the scenery of the majestic Jablanica mountains. Overall, the hike from Vevcani to Gorna Belica is a challenging but rewarding experience that offers stunning views of the Macedonian countryside and a chance to immerse yourself in the local culture.

images.caption: Winter in the forest above Vevcani
Overlooking the plains north of Ohrid
The mountain hut on the way
Church of Saint Petka in Gorna Belica, North Macedonia

title: Sassolungo and Salei Hut
short_description: Very scenic half-day hike with a nice stop for refreshments at the Baita Salei.
long_description: In the middle of the Val Gardena Dolomites lies the Sassolungo group, whose highest peak rises almost 3200 m into the sky. To explore the surroundings of these fascinating mountain peaks, however, you don't have to undertake a strenuous tour: This hike leads from the top station of the Ciampinoi cable car on a panoramic and not too difficult loop to the Salei Hut and back again in a curve.

images.caption: In the "Stone City" at the Sella Pass

title: A unique observation of the Grand Prismatic Spring
short_description: A route leading to a stunning and unique view of the "Grand Prismatic" hot thermal spring, which is considered the largest and most impressive in Yellowstone National Park and in the United States in general
long_description:
A beautiful and interesting hiking route throughout - already in the parking lot, the first thermal springs that you will see on the right and on the left will be waiting for you with a light blue shade, after crossing the bright blue river into which several small waterfalls pour on top of a black rock, another small hot thermal spring with a deep turquoise color will be waiting for you. At a walking distance of about a kilometer from there, next to the river, you will reach the highlight and culmination of the route, which is the unique observation point of the "Grand Prismatic" hot thermal spring. This is the best view from the ground of the impressive spring and actually the best way to enjoy the peak of its beauty. Admittedly, there is also a walking trail next to the lake, but it cannot be viewed as well as from this point, in fact, when you walk along the trail next to the spring, you cannot see its full shape and the entire rainbow of colors especially, and that is why it is recommended to visit this point of view before visiting the trail that passes right by the spring .
The visit to this viewpoint includes a short ascent with a negligible gradient (cumulative ascent of about 40 meters), but it is one of the most beautiful and significant viewpoints in Yellowstone Park. In principle, it is possible to walk part of the route with strollers, but it is not particularly adapted for this, the visit to the observation deck involves a short ascent with a relatively negligible gradient. This is a relatively short trip and highly recommended for travelers of all ages.
Those who want to extend the route a little can continue a few more kilometers to Fairy Falls .
Since this is a one-way route, the estimated walking times as well as the distance shown on this page are for one direction only.

images.caption: Here you can decide whether to go to the observation after or before the falls

title: Spiritual island of Pamos (Altai)
short_description: One in Greece, one in Altai, Russia – the spiritual island of Pamos. The island of Pamos fits in the middle of the shimmering Katun River, as if in the palm of a miracle, washed by the mountain waters.
long_description: Pamos Island – one of the main attractions of Cheman village. A suspension bridge serves as a guide to the island. The highlight of the island — is the church located there, which is associated with the name of the Apostle John the Evangelist, who prayed on the Greek island of the same name. The place is quite popular with tourists, who come to the temple with tales of their own business and troubles. Near the temple, an image of the Virgin Mary is carved on a splinter – sculpted by Phelophea, a nun from Barnaul's Znamenski Monastery. So that's the way it is! And there are also rumours about this place filled with legends, retold stories and that it is a holy place of Altai.

images.caption: Мост на остров Памос, река Катунь

title: AUSANGATE TREK 5D/4N
short_description:
The Ausangate snow-capped mountain is one of the highest snow-capped mountains in Peru; located in the Vilcanota mountain range 130 kilometres from Cusco and reaches an altitude of 6,372 m. It has several lagoons of a luminous green/blue colour and presents a natural landscape of great beauty
.
long_description:
Hike done in 5 days. The most suitable option is to do it counter-clockwise starting from Tinki and finishing in Pacchanta.
For more information and bookings please go to https://caminoincamachupicchu.org/caminata-ausangate-5-dias/  
.
 Guides and signposts will show you the way as you can download this route and navigate it with Outdooractive.

title: Journey to the Arkhangelskoye Estate Museum
short_description: The country estate «Arkhangelskoe» — is not simply a museum-estate, but a striking palace-and-park ensemble located on the banks of the old river Moscow in 2 km to the south-west of the town of Krasnogorsk.
long_description:
The estate «Arkhangelskoye» has been known since the year of Ivan the Great's death, mentions of the estate can be observed since 1584. At that time the estate was owned by a family with the surname Uplotsky together with his groom Osip Matveev. In the 17th century the owner was F.I. Sheremetev. Later the estate was owned by Prince Golitsyn and before it was nationalised in the 20th century it was in the hands of Prince Yusupov.
  The Museum Park is an excellent place for getting into history, for a cultural trip and for an active hike, suitable for all lovers of the outdoors.
The museum park is an excellent place for getting into history.

title: Cultural Trail Appenzellerland, Stage 1
short_description: The hiking paradise of Appenzellerland, nestled between Lake Constance in the north and the all-surmounting Säntis in the south, offers you a new hiking and cultural highlight.

images.caption: Wissenbach Gorge between Degersheim and Herisau
Old wheelhouse in the hamlet of Schwänberg near Herisau
Landsgemeinde bridge between Herisau and Hundwil

title: Moro Rock Trail
short_description: On this walk, we hike up to the huge rock "Moro Rock," which offers a magnificent view of one of the valleys in California's Sequoia National Park.
long_description: A beautiful and unique hiking trail with a climb of about 400 relatively small steps leading to a viewpoint with breathtaking views of one of the Sequoia National Park's forested valleys. The route involves a total ascent of about 100 m and takes about 10 minutes one way (depending on the hiker's pace). As the ascent leads over stairs, the route is not accessible for prams or wheelchairs.

images.caption: Walking together is much more fun!

title: Easy hiking on the "300 stairs" trail
short_description: A popular route above Slănic Moldova, and even a necessary route if you have an active holiday. Especially as anyone can walk it, whatever the season.
long_description:
The name of the trail comes from the 300 concrete or stone steps that start the circuit. When these end, they give way to wide paths through the forests at the foot of the Nemira Mountains. The few steeper ascents and descents remind you that you're in a mountain area.
Along the way, you have a few points where the view opens up to other deserts, but not panoramic.
The last section descends into the resort and passes mineral springs - a good opportunity to refill your water bottle.

title: Hünenberg
long_description:
Hünen-berg! But don't worry the «Berg» (mountain) isn't that high! And the tours round about this dynamic village are very attractive. Not to be missed!

From the car park in St. Wolfgang walk to Allmendhof, on to Cham, along the side of the railway track to Zythus, past Chämleten to Hünenberg, Erlenweg, Dorfstrasse, Weinreben, St. Wolfgangstrasse and back to the starting point.

Places of interest:

- Church of St. Wolfgang
- Restaurant Wart / Wartstein
- Restaurant Degen
- Restaurant Zythuus

Note(s)
Watch out when crossing the busy roads in Cham!

images.caption: The idyllic little lake in Steinhausen woods

title: FEB-NAFV Immenstadt-Gunzesrieder Säge station via Sennalpe Gerstenbrändle (near finish) 4:20h
short_description: View-rich hike über the Immenstädter Hausberg, the "Mittag", and über the Nagelfluhkette down into the Gunzesrieder Tal with detour to the Alpe Gerstenbrändle.

images.caption: Gentian blossoms on the Steineberg high above Immenstadt
Landscape in the valley of Gunzesried

title: Bohusleden - Stage 3 - Maderna to Angered
short_description: The third stage of the Bohusleden trail leads from Lake Maderna through longer forest tracks to Jonsered, and from there on to Angered.
long_description: The Bohusleden trail leads from Lake Maderna northwards, alternating between airy mixed forest and denser coniferous forest. In the village of Jonsered you can clearly see Scottish influence. The entrepreneur William Gibson began in the mid-19th century to build a settlement of stone cottages for the workers of his company Jonsereds Fabriker. The factory was established as a spinning and weaving mill, but the range of goods was soon expanded to include carpentry and forts. 1954 saw the launch of the first motor, which is still the company's best-known product. Through the adjacent Bokedalen nature reserve we come to Jonsered Manor. From here the trail heads northwards over a bridge between two lakes to the village of Angered.

title: The Imberger Horn Circuit in Bad Hindelang
short_description: The hike leads through flowering alpine meadows via Café Horn and the Horn Chapel to just below the mountain station of the Hornbahn cable car. Those who wish can take the Hornbahn downhill.
long_description: This circular tour actually has everything a hiker's heart desires: First, we walk along a field path next to the leisurely flowing Ostrach before we start climbing on a tarred road to Café Horn. Throughout the tour, there are always great views of Bad Oberdorf, Bad Hindelang and the Hirschberg. After Café Horn, we pass the Horn Chapel,  which was built in 1789. Some of the climbs are in the blazing sun, which makes for a few extra drops of sweat in high summer. The best time for this circular tour is therefore in spring or autumn. By the way, there is also a short version: if you prefer to just walk downhill, you can take the Hornbahn cable car to the mountain station and descend via Café Horn.

title: Panorama-Trail Calanca Valley
short_description: Beautiful family hike along the left terrace high above the Calanca Valley through intact settlements and with breathtaking views.

title: Three Sisters Springs Hike
short_description: Hiking the world famous Three Sisters Spring refuge and dscover the sanctuary for the West Indian Manatee
long_description:
Three Sisters Springs - a 57 acre refuge around, there is  a quarter mile boardwalk with viewing platforms to observe the springs and native wildlife. There are also at least 1.5 miles of nature trails that you can explore to see views of Kings Bay, Magnolia Springs, Lake Crystal and wetlands.
Three Sisters Springs is a world-renowned sanctuary for the West Indian Manatee during the winter; however, at the refuge you can see many native and migratory species year-round.
The Crystal River National Wildlife Refuge (CRNWR) is mostly accessible to visitors by water; only the Three Sisters Springs property provides land access to see the springs. CRNWR does not provide water access to visitors at this site, but there are many boat ramps/launches in Crystal River
Part of the Crystal River National Wildlife Refuge, City of Crystal River Parks & Southwest Florida Water Management District

title: Hiking up to Falkenstein on the Rottachberg in winter
short_description: While this is always a cracking little walk during the summer, it also makes for a pleasant winter wander.
long_description:
If you're looking for an easy and predictable hike on winter's day in this part of the Allgäu, then this route's a pretty good option and one that I always enjoy doing when I want a bit of exercise. 
Snow conditions on the day will dictate whether you'll want to put on pair of trail spikes, snowshoes, or just your boots. In any case, the hike will generally take longer when there is snow on the ground. That being said, the prettiness of the surroundings more than compensates for any extra effort with lovely views assured on both sides of the hill.

images.caption: The view from Falkenstein towards Immenstadt
The Gebhardshöhe-Pavillion and beyond towards Oberstdorf

title: Niederhorn Panorama Trail
short_description: Panoramic hike in the face of the Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau.
long_description:
First section über the Güggisgrat with spectacular deep views into the Justistal. Then through heaths and Föhrenwälder towards Chüematte. The last part über Alpweiden in die Waldegg.

Alone the ascent to the starting point of the hike, from the Niederhorn, is an experience: Below, Lake Thun glistens and the snow-covered four-thousand-metre peaks in the south are within reach. The first part of the hike leads along the Güggisgrat. In the face of the Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau, you cross heath and moor landscapes with alpine roses and blueberries. If you have binoculars, don't leave them at home. Rock beetles, chamois and marmots are often seen here.

Through sparse forest and spruce woods, the trail now heads gently downhill towards Chüematte. The last section to Waldegg leads through an attractive cultivated landscape with flower-filled alpine meadows and gnarled mountain maples.

Out of 22 competitors, the Panorama Trail from the Niederhorn to Waldegg was voted the most beautiful hiking trail in Switzerland on an Internet platform in 2008. In addition to the phenomenal view, the well-maintained hiking trail was also a decisive factor in the victory.

title: Kösseine circular route
short_description: An impressive hike from the Luisenburg to the Kösseine, which is considered the mountain with the most views in the Fichtelgebirge.
long_description: At the beginning of our tour we can visit the worth seeing ruins of the Luxburg with viewing platform on the Luisenburg. Afterwards, our hike leads through the impressive granite block sea, in which an open-air theatre is also embedded. Theatre plays take place there from May to August, the amphitheatre-like auditorium is covered with a tent roof. We then climb the stone steps and wooden stairs to the viewing platform on the Burgstein rock sea before we reach the actual destination of our hike, the summit of the Kösseine, via an elevated path. Here, in good weather, we can enjoy views as far as the Zugspitze.

title: Bohusleden - Stage 11 - Metsjö to Kaserna
short_description: The eleventh stage of Bohusleden leads from Lake Metsjön over many hills and along Lake Viksjön to Kaserna.
long_description: Today's stage leads through a region that was hard-fought over until the 18th century, in the borderland between Sweden and Norway. The numerous hills make the path somewhat difficult, but the beautiful view of the surrounding landscape makes up for all the effort. Along the way there are also many testimonies to past times, such as Iron Age burial sites and the ruins of a manor house.

images.caption: View over the Swedish lake landscape

title: Via Burgberg to Sonthofen
short_description: We enjoy a very varied tour along small lakes, through lush meadows, past beautiful moss fields, through pretty little villages, over lonely forest passages, along rushing mountain streams, past castle ruins and finally explore the Alpine town of Sonthofen.
long_description:
The Grünten, also called the Wächter of the Allgäus, is constantly in our field of vision as we cross the plain between Rauhenzell and Agathazell. At the top is the transmitter of the Bavarian Broadcasting Corporation, which supplies the region with digital television programmes (DVB-T) and VHF antenna radio.
The vineyard at Burgberg is rightly named because wine was grown here for a few years from 1855 onwards.
After Burgberg was elevated to the status of a parish in 1804, the first burial ground of the villagers was located on the site of today's historic cemetery until it became too small. Today the site has been transformed into a green area. Individual crosses continue to remind us of its former use.
The castle of Burgberg was first mentioned in 1140. From the 13th century onwards, the castle changed hands several times. When it burnt down during the 30-year war, it was subsequently abandoned to decay.
The castle of Burgberg is still in use today.

images.caption: View from Rauhenzell to the Immenstädter Horn.
New stairs make the ascent to the vineyard easier.
Mighty oak tree at the vineyard.
Small wooden chapel by the wayside.
The Burgberger Horn towers above Burgberg.

title: Visiting Skazka, The 'Fairy Tale Canyon' of Tosor, Kyrgyzstan
short_description: A great point of interest on the way to or from Karakol, a wander around the shapeshifting, desert-like landscape of the fairy tale canyon is a sidetrip that shouldn't be missed and is worth plenty of photos.
long_description:
In a spot set not too far back from the shores of the mighty lake Issyk Kul, stands the complete anomaly that is Skazka.
A monument to the passage of time and the result of countless years of erosion from wind and rain, this gorge is home to some pretty wild rock formations that come in a dizzying variety of shapes and sizes and an array of (mostly red) colours. The mood and appearance of these clay rocks change with the movement of the sun over the course of the day and though I cannot say when the best time to go is,  I visited mid-afternoon and was not disappointed. In fact, I would have liked to have stayed longer, but we had a date with a farmer and his family in the mountains to get to. 
The arid setting makes a sharp contrast to the greenery you encounter in much of the rest of the country and as it hardly ever snows in this area, visiting the canyon is possible all year round, though I believe there is now a charge of something like Лв 50 to enter during the summer, which is less than a US Dollar.  
While I have provided a general route to follow, you're best off just exploring on your own. That being said, you might want to consider downloading the map before your visit for the sake of general reference. You're very unlikely to get lost, in my view, but you never know ; )
You might like to also check out my other route not too far away: Hiking to the Maiden Braids Waterfall from Seven Bulls Rock, Kyrgyzstan

title: Border Hike | Hoher Götschen and Köppelschneid
short_description: Scenic hike over the Götschen and the Köppelschneid along the German-Austrian border.
long_description: The pleasant circular tour starts at the car park of Café s'Bamstoa and leads over the Hoher Götschen (930m) and the Köppelschneid to the small hamlets of Stadler and Eßbach and then back again. Along the way there are always beautiful vantage points with views towards Niederalm and the Wiestal reservoir. The trail itself leads over hilly meadows to Köppelschneid, a wooded rocky ridge that largely follows the border. Some old boundary stones from 1818 line the path and attest to its long history.

images.caption: Schöne Aussicht auf die umliegenden Wiesen von Marktschellenberg

title: Nidwaldner Höhenweg: Stage 4
long_description:
The Nidwaldner Höhenweg offers varied hiking on mountain trails with magnificent views. Two monastery villages invite you to visit. The many connections to mountain railways make it possible to split the five-day hike.

The Nidwaldner Höhenweg is understood to be the circuit of the Engelberg valley at an altitude of 1600 to 2000 metres, with detours to Melchsee-Frutt and Niderbauen. The trail begins at the mountain station of the Mettlen-Rugisbalm-Eggen cable car and leads around the canton of Nidwalden in five daily stages on marked mountain trails. At the transition between the Pre-Alps and the Alps, the route offers magnificent views into the valley, to the surrounding mountains and to the glaciated four-thousand-metre peaks.

We pass alpine pastures, rugged rocks and quiet mountain lakes, as well as various pass crossings and can enjoy the magnificent flora and fauna. Mountain inns and mountain taverns invite you to refresh yourself and spend the night. In Engelberg and Niederrickenbach we can knock on monastery doors and find friendly welcome. The destination of the Nidwaldner Höhenweg is the mountain station of the Niderbauen cable car on the flank of the mountain of the same name.

The high-altitude hike in the land of cable cars can also be hiked in one or two-day stages, as each stage location is in the vicinity of a railway or cable car station.

Stage 4: On the Benediktusweg to Niederrickenbach, where you can buy home-grown Alpine herbal tea in the shop of the convent women. Continue along beautiful sycamore maple stands to the Brisenhaus SAC hut at the foot of Brisen.

title: Short winter hike in Trieblings at the Großer Alpsee lake
short_description: A beautiful short hike with a great view of the Großer Alpsee.

images.caption: Short winter hike in Trieblings at the Großer Alpsee lake

title: Walking route Herikhuizerveld
short_description: This route shows you a part of the heath and forests of the Veluwe
long_description: The Veluwe is a beautiful nature reserve without a real border. You walk along the Herikhuizeveld and the Posbank, a beautiful heathland area. The Veluwe also has a large number of fens. You will come across a few of them.

title: Draft from 19 November 2021
long_description:
Author
Dominic Heale 
Update: November 19, 2021

title: Trail running from Breiten to the Spieser and Hirschegg, Bad Hindelang
short_description: Stretch those muscles, crank up the tunes, and go with the flow on this trail run that has its literal ups and downs, lots of forests, and some pretty lush panoramas.
long_description:
Perfect for a weekend morning and definitely one to get the ol' cardiovascular system working, this route runs along the ridgeline parallel to the Hindelang-Sonthofen road and is a new favourite of mine.
Starting in the Wanderparkplatz Breiten (car park), the initial part of the run follows a meandering stretch of asphalt that pretty quickly gives way to a steep, forested ascent up to the Tiefenbacher Eck. From there, things start to open up before you drop down to cross over and then climb the grassy slopes of the Spieser (1,651 m). If you're still feeling the love at his point, you can then cross back down to ascend the Hirschberg (1,500 m) before rejoining the ridge by the Baoleskopf - or just head back the way you came. 
If running isn't your thing, this route works just as well as a hike.

images.caption: The asphalted section at the beginning of the route
Looking towards Oberjoch and the Iseler

title: Circular hiking trail - Hiking in Finstersee
short_description: Hiking in Finstersee. A short and pleasant round tour for the whole family.
long_description: From Finstersee, follow the road to the edge of the forest. On a small path, families with children reach the Mülibachfall, which is around 10 m high. This place of strength and contemplation invites you to stay with a barbecue snack and play with water and stones. In summer, the shady adventure retreat is popular with families with children. You leave the Mülibach-Tobel on the steep footpath opposite to the road back to Finstersee. Along the road you reach the Mülibach, which you follow along the forest road branching off to the right. On the ascent to Sternenweidli you will cross terrain that represents an impressive section of local historical background. In the woods to the left of your path, there were numerous mining tunnels for brown coal. The coal was used to power the first steamships on Lake Zurich. The excavations also brought to light numerous well-preserved witnesses to 30 million years of history. Fossils of exotic animals and more than 160 plant species tell of the tropical climate with lush flora and dense primeval forest that prevailed before the glaciation during various ice ages. Finally, the road leads back to the village square of Finstersee.

images.caption: Weg zum idyllischen Rastplatz am beschaulichen Wasserfall

title: Hiking circuit: Gleize pass, Gleize peak
short_description: Recommended in late spring when the alpine flora is in full bloom.

images.caption: randonnée - Hautes-Alpes: Circuit rando : col de Gleize, pic de Gleize

title: A trip to the Siedelalpe hut and a panoramic view of the Alps
short_description: A lovely circular hiking route leading to an authentic alpine cabin as well as a unique panoramic view of the Alps as well as the two lakes of the town of Immenstadt
long_description: This itinerary is fantastic for those who love powerful landscapes and on the way also want to enjoy a light meal and a local atmosphere in an Alpine cabin (the name of the cabin in German: Siedelalpe). In a relatively short walking distance you can reach a powerful panoramic view of the area from a great height. The walk along the route is relatively easy, but still includes a moderate ascent. Since it is a circular route, you can choose which direction to walk on the route (straight or right at the crossroads). The road that continues straight at the crossroads leads to a slightly steeper but shorter ascent, while the road that continues to the right offers a more moderate but longer ascent (this road can also be walked with prams from experience, but it must be taken into account that it is not paved and that it includes an ascent on the way up and a descent on the way back) . You can decide whether to walk the route in a circular way or go and return the same way. You can experience the peak of the view a few meters after the cabin, either on the path that continues beside it or on the path that goes up behind it. A great experience for those who want to experience a powerful landscape with not much effort.

title: NSG Kendlmühl-Felt
short_description: Moor, museum, waterfall - easy tour through the Kendlmühl-Filz nature reserve, the largest moor area in south-east Bavaria with almost 800 ha.
long_description:
Some paths lead almost dead straight through the moor, no wonder, as a genuine peat railway once ran here. Near Grießenbach, a detour to the Klaushäusl is a must. In the museum, the history of the brine and the moor is impressively explained. Finally, a waterfall - what more could a hiker's heart desire.

(Source: Chiemgau-Tourismus.de)

title: Von der Rotlechsäge über die Gipfel der Aserlegruppe: Aserlekopf, Gamplesspitzen, Aserlespitze und Karkekopf
short_description:
Die Bergtour führt uns auf die Gipfel der wenig besuchten Aserlegruppe.
Translate to English
long_description:
Obgleich in der Nähe des Fernpasses werden die Gipfel der Aserlegruppe eher selten besucht. Unverständlich, bieten die Gipfel doch eine herrliche Aussicht auf die Lechtaler Alpen, Wetterstein, Mieminger und viele Gipfel der Stubaier und Ötztaler.
Translate to English

title: Zulg Valley – Emmental
short_description: Mellow valleys, secluded moorland and a meandering river; this trail is your guarantee of interesting natural diversity. The route leading from the Bernese Oberland into the Emmental is set in a magical winterscape. Visitors will return home having seen an extremely diverse range of landscapes.
long_description:
Having alighted at the Innereriz-Säge bus stop and in view of the Sieben Hengste, the route immediately heads uphill towards the Alp Trüschhübel. In the pass area of the Zulg’s and Emme’s catchment terrains we reach the Rotmoos: a beautiful, rugged and legend-steeped moorland which, even in winter, gives the appearance of a fairytale setting. After having passed through the Schwarzbach valley we reach the Obere Gemmi which brings us to a steep descent. Passing by impressive farms where water buffaloes and other animals live, the path leads to the river Emme, which we cross. The village of Schangnau lies close by, but your gaze is drawn repeatedly to the commanding Hohgant’s north face. We have arrived in the Emmental.
  Please take note
After the Ober Gemmi there is a steep descent towards Mühlebrücke. Although the route passes along roads, sturdy shoes are essential!

images.caption: The path leads through the fairytale landscape of Rootmoos
The seven stallions and the sickle
I wonder if the moor witches are at home here?
Nutrient-poor soil makes trees grow slowly.
Long shadows and the Hohgant in sight

title: Morava circuit from Korça
short_description: Panoramic circular trail through the beautiful nature of the Morava Mountains directly from Korça.
long_description: Just behind the pretty old town of Korça begins the mountain range of Malet i Moravës („Morava Mountains”), one of the most beautiful low mountain ranges in Albania. On mule tracks and old shepherds' paths, this long but easy circular hike leads through wild brooks, dense beech forests and over the panoramic ridge of Maja Cardhakut. Fantastic views over the Korça plateau, the Drenova National Park and the surrounding mountains are guaranteed. On the way down, we even take in the Morava Cross and the small pilgrimage church – two of the best-known landmarks of the region.

images.caption: Die kleine orthodoxe Kirche von Mborje
Der wildromantische Bergbach Qytetit entspringt im Hügelland von Morava
Felsklippe am Gipfelplateau des Maja Cardhakut
Felsband unter dem Gipfelaufbau des Maja Cardhakut
Das Morava-Kreuz, eines der bekanntesten Wahrzeichen der Region.
Märtiererfriedhof über den Dächern der Stadt Korça

title: Meuse-Rhine Route South Route
short_description: On the Maas-Rhine Trail, we walk past all the major maars of the Eifel in the Rhineland-Palatinate part of the route.
long_description:
We start our hike in Roder in Luxembourg. The path leads us to the border river Our between Germany and Luxembourg. Here our path branches into two variations.
The southern variant of the Meuse-Rhine Trail runs in a southerly direction along the Our to the Vianden reservoir. It then continues via Neuerburg, Bitburg and Kyllburg to Mürlenbach, where the two paths join up again.
From here, our route leads right across the varied, enchanting landscape of the Eifel. Via Gerolstein, Daun, Ulmen and Mayen, we reach the Weinfelder Maar near Daun, which invites us to take an extensive break. Passing the Meersfelder Maar near Manderscheid, we hike on to the Pulvermaar near Gillenfeld and the largest volcanic lake in the Eifel, the Laacher See.
At Andernach we finally meet the Rhine and have reached the destination of our hike.

images.caption: The Geysir Andernach (formerly Namedyer Sprudel) is the largest cold-water geyser in the world.

title: Hiking trail along crosses and chapels
Through the green spaces in the northwest of Bielefeld
short_description: We walk on easy paths through Bielefeld's green spaces.
long_description: The green spaces in Bielefeld are mostly very well connected. They are very suitable for a walk on bad weather days or when there is little time available. From the main station we walk to the Oetker-Halle at the Bürgerpark. From there we walk to the university. From here we follow the Grenzbach to the Birkenhain. At the Bultkamp facilities we reach our northernmost point. We follow the Bultkamp südwärts to the children's traffic school. Behind it we quickly reach the industrial area around Miele. After a residential area we are back at the station.

images.caption: Spielplatz nahe der Wertherstraße in Bielefeld
Fahrräder an der Haltestelle Bültmannshof in Bielefeld
Straßenbahn an der Haltestelle Bültmannshof in Bielefeld
Buntes Hochhaus in der Kopernikusstraße In Bielefeld
Lucky Luke Zeichnung an einer Hauswand in Bielefeld

title: Cycle route 87 (V87) - Major cycle route
short_description: The V87 motorway (unofficially called the "Trans-Massif Central") is today the only real route through central France from north to south.
long_description:
Here we present the sections that have been completed today, from Montluçon in the Allier and Beaulieu-sur-Dordogne in Corrèze, passing through the Creuse, i.e. about 300 km. The remaining 100 km will soon enable the route to cross the Lot and Tarn-et-Garonne to reach Montauban.
The route will also take you through the Tarn-et-Garonne region.
So be the first to explore this charming itinerary, off the beaten track, which crisscrosses the network of small, quiet roads of the Massif Central, covering wild territories such as the Combrailles, the Millevaches plateau or the Dordogne gorges...
The Massif Central is a hilly route, so beware of the less athletic and/or those who are not equipped with an ebike some sections are not easy to ride, both in terms of level and length.

title: Hiking to the Maiden Braids Waterfall from Seven Bulls Rock,  Kyrgyzstan
short_description: A pleasant stroll up a lush alpine valley with rivers, waterfalls, yurt encampments, and for those in need of a pick-me-up, fermented mare's milk.
long_description:
The Kok Jayik valley lies not too far from Karakol on the easternmost point of Issyk Kul and is a great option for anyone circumnavigating the lake who might fancy a gentle hike.  
Starting at the Jeti Ögüz Rocks, home of gorgeously red 'Seven Bulls' and 'Broken Heart' Rocks, which - this being the mystical country of Kyrgyzstan - carry their own unique legends, we made our way along the river to where the valley widens into a spectacularly open and green area of grassland, forest, and huge mountains.  From there, it was a short walk up into the forest to the waterfall. I cannot say the waterfall itself was especially mind-blowing, but the area and general setting certainly are.  
Is it worth a look? My answer would be a firm yes.  For anyone familiar with the European Alps, the similarity of the landscape is pretty uncanny, but the presence of the occasional yurt or mosque will quickly remind you that you're not actually in Austria. 
You might like to also check out my other route not too far away: Visiting Skazka, The 'Fairy Tale Canyon' of Tosor, Kyrgyzstan

images.caption: Kok Jayik valley in all its glory
Fermented mare's milk. Can't see this catching on in my local

title: Fichtelberglauf - Salomon Trailrunning Cup
short_description: The Fichtelberg Run takes place in Neudorf in the Ore Mountains.
long_description: First the starting signal goes off for all participants of the 9.1 km mountain run. A little later, all mountain bikers start the 6.8 km mountain time trial. There are often around 250 starters on site and every year the organisers SV Neudorf e.V. and RSV Sehmatal e.V. expect a constant number of participants.

title: Peterstal Black Forest Trail
short_description: The premium hiking trail leads through shady forests along some magnificent vantage points to the Peterstaler mineral water station in Holdersgrund.
long_description: Circular hike on comfortable forest paths and trails

title: Kust till Kustleden - from Knösen to Torekov
short_description: The sixteenth stage of the Kust till Kustledens leads from the campsite Knösen along a long coastal path with great views to the campsite Torekov just before the village of the same name.
long_description: Our path leads along the coast over beach meadows. Where the Hallandsåsen mountain range disappears into the sea, scree fields predominate, but we also find good pastureland. Several wrecks stranded along the coast were dismantled by the inhabitants and sold at auction. We are particularly struck by a small cemetery consisting of eight stone towers arranged in a row.

images.caption: You can fortify yourself in the Berghaus Chäserstatt
Sea of fog over the Rhone valley
Snow as far as the eye can see

title: Champfrémont hike - Étang de Sainte-Anne
short_description: Normandie-Maine Regional Nature Park - Étang de Sainte-Anne - Bellevue - Sainte-Anne - L'Écoubière - Bel Event - La Sourdière - Le Moulin de la Sourdière - Le Terrançon - Monument aux fusillés de Courtemiche - La Tuilerie - Vignerette - La Cottemandière - Le Vieux Moulin - Les Fossés - Les Émondés - Les Émondes Est - Champfrémont
long_description: On this hike, you'll discover the Normandie-Maine Regional Nature Park, the pretty 17th-century chapel of Sainte-Anne, the Sainte-Anne spring, the house of the World War II rescusistants de la 2nde Mondiale cachée dans la forêt (non visiterable), the monument to the Courtemiche shootings, the conservatory orchard with many varieties of local apple trees.

title: The Velodyssey
short_description: The French section of EuroVelo 1 (a route running from northern Norway to southern Portugal), the Vélodyssée is quite simply the longest cycle route in France.
long_description:
Cycling more than 1200 km of signposted routes by bike, from Roscoff in Finistère to Hendaye in the Basque Country, quite an experience!"
On the Brittany side, you can soak up the calm of the banks of the Canal de Nantes à Brest which leads to the majestic river Loire. From the Vendée coast to the beaches of Aquitaine, we cross the seaside resorts and other typical villages, without forgetting to taste the delicious local products, including seafood.
This discovery of the Loire Valley is a unique experience.
This discovery of the Atlantic coastline takes place in varied landscapes, through an alternation of towpaths, safe cycle paths and shared roads.
Here we suggest you travel this itinerary in 30 stages, adaptable to your own pace and desires.

title: Through the beautiful Kocher Valley - Gaildorf
short_description: On this moderately difficult hike we follow the Kocher through its valley.
long_description:
Our hike begins at the car park at the hall in Gaildorf. From here we take the footpath up to the cemetery street and then turn left past the hospital in the direction of Kleinaltdorf. We now cross the wooden bridge at the Kocher and turn left to the B19 federal road. After crossing the road at the traffic lights, turn left into the Bahnstrasse and follow it through the village across the railway tracks into the fields. At the end of the village, turn left and then right towards the forest. At the next fork, go straight ahead and continue on the Eselbergweg through the forest. We follow the path straight on and come to the edge of the forest. After a few hundred metres we reach a playground with a shelter (Spöck). Here we can rest and enjoy the wonderful view of Gaildorf, its surroundings and the Kocher valley.
From the playground, we walk along Bühlstra;e into the village of Spöck and continue to „Lange Straße“, which takes us to Ottendorf. At the church we cross the B19 again and walk past an inn to the bottom of the valley at the Kocherbrücke. We continue üvia Raiffeisenstra;e through fields to „Vier Linden“, where we turn right onto the hiking trail „Blaukreuz“ to Großaltdorf and from here üvia the trail „Blaustrich“ to Gaildorf. We return to the starting point of our tour via Eutendorfer Stra&szlig and Schlo&szlig Stra&szlig.

images.caption: Magnificent half-timbering - the castle in Gailsdorf.

title: From Zarrentin along the Schaalsee
short_description: This very beautiful tour takes us through the Schaalsee biosphere reserve. We hike the lime moor and beautiful shore sections.
long_description: From the car park we walk to the Pahlhuus (1), the information point of the Schaalsee Biosphere Reserve. We follow the steps leading down to the left of the entrance and then the signs to the right towards the moor nature trail. This soon leads us to the left into the limestone moor. We walk on plank paths through the wonderful wetland and after a short while we reach the first information board (2). It informs us about the history of the formation of the limestone moor, which goes back to the last ice age. Other boards tell us about the use and the flora and fauna of the moor. Small viewing platforms branch off from the Plankenweg at particularly beautiful places. At the end of the moor nature trail, a nice rest area (3) invites us to take a break. We now turn left onto the asphalt path leading along the fence. We pass the Schaalseeklause on the right and shortly afterwards turn right across the sunbathing lawn along the very beautiful lido (4). Finally, we follow the path directly along the shore. Several refreshment stops invite you to take a break. Soon you will see the Cistercian monastery (5) on the left, which was founded in the 13th century. The monastery had important rights to the Schaalsee, including the sole right to catch eels for a time. Since August 2006, the town of Zarrentin has used the monastery as an official residence, museum and event location. At the next fork, we choose the right path towards the lookout tower (6). This offers us a beautiful view of the Schaalsee. We now follow the circular path to the right and walk around the Kirchensee. When we reach the lookout tower again, we follow the outward path to the lido. There we walk straight ahead in the direction of Pahlhuus. Soon a sign shows us the way to the right in the direction of the car park. Follow this up the stairs to the starting point.

images.caption: The lido invites you to refresh yourself in the Schaalsee during the warm months.
The moor nature trail leads us on planks through the wetland.
In the Pahlhuus we find a modern information exhibition about the Schaalsee Biosphere Reserve.
From a platform we look out over the moor lake.
From the observation tower we have a beautiful view of the Schaalsee.

title: The wine road on the hills of Transylvania
short_description: Discover the balanced aroma of white wines from the vineyards of Transylvania. On the former Via Magna that linked Alba Iulia to Cluj-Napoca in Roman times, but also in the Târnava vineyards, you will find wines that have been appreciated since the Middle Ages!
long_description:
Transylvanian white wines have been known in Europe since the 12th century. They continue to be at the top of their game today with the numerous international medals that various wineries win in international competitions.
And what better way to distinguish them than to try a tasting at one or more local wineries to see the particularities of several ranges and varieties.Although Jidvei wines are probably the best known locally - Jidvei Riesling being the longest-lived local wine brand - in the Alba or Aiud vineyards you will find several small wineries, some family-owned, that will pleasantly surprise you with their own varieties such as Traminer Roz, Kerner or the dessert wine-experiment IceWine (Eiswein).
The Transylvanian wine trail must also have a historical component - these places are dotted with numerous castles or noble mansions, some of which have been restored as exemplary tourist attractions. One can, of course, also include secular sights such as amusement parks, the Turda salt works or an equestrian ride, also near Turda.

title: Morgenkofel 3.073m

title: Lahn Valley Cycle Route from Lollar to Wetzlar
short_description: This medium-difficulty trail leads through a beautiful lake landscape past Gleiberg Castle, Gießen and Bad Heuchelheim to Wetzlar.
long_description: In the wide Lahn valley, the route is fast, the curious climb up to Gleiberg Castle. And you've already reached Giessen, the centre of Central Hesse. You should visit the New Castle and of course the Liebig Museum in the rooms of the former chemical institute. The famous chemist worked there for several years. The valley widens considerably near Heuchelheim. With meadows and an attractive lake landscape. Good for relaxing, and a little barbecue might also be a nice idea. It's another 15 kilometres or so to Wetzlar, and there are a number of garden inns along the way to make the trip easier. And the destination is worth it! Wetzlar Cathedral alone, as it majestically towers over the houses of the historic old town.

title: Couto and Shelves Circuit in Itatiaia Park
short_description: Discover one of the most famous attractions of the Itatiaia National Park, the Prateleiras Mountains, and enjoy a fantastic view from the top of the second highest peak in the state of Rio de Janeiro: the Couto Hill.
long_description:
The Itatiaia National Park, created in 1937, was the first park in Brazil and is open to visitation every day of the year.In the upper part, the entrance is possible from 7:00 am to 2:00 pm and you can stay until 5:00 pm.
This trail offers a privileged view of the Mantiqueira Mountains and the Paraíba Valley, as well as the main attractions of the Park, such as the Agulhas Negras Peak.

images.caption: Posto Marcão no Parque Nacional do Itatiaia, Rio de Janeiro - Brasil
Trilha Morro do Couto no Parque Nacional do Itatiaia, Rio de Janeiro - Brasil

title: Open Air Center Bec-Scie
short_description: Explore the Rivière à Mars and its canyon at the Centre de plein air Bec-Scie: hiking, mountain biking, fat biking, snowshoeing, cross-country skiing, picnic areas, black bear observation, equipment rentals and cottage accommodation.
long_description: At the Centre plein air Bec-Scie, there is something for everyone! Practice your favourite sport in the magnificent landscapes of the Rivière-à-Mars.  Rich in lush nature, come and discover the canyon of the Rivière à Mars, a natural jewel just a stone's throw from the city at the Centre Plein Air Bec-Scie. With more than 120 kilometres of trails, come and practice: hiking, mountain biking, snowshoeing, cross-country skiing or enjoy our picnic areas, equipment rental and shelter accommodation. A host of outdoor activities on one of the most fabulous playgrounds in Saguenay - Lac-Saint-Jean!

images.caption: hiking trail in Québec: Open Air Center Bec-Scie

title: Trip to Zweribach-Wasserfälle
short_description: A relatively short hiking route but also includes an ascent and leads to Zweribach Falls in the south-center of the Black Forest (northeast of the city of Freiburg)
long_description:
The Zweribach Falls are located about 20 kilometers northeast of the city of Freiburg. The maximum height of the waterfalls is 40 meters and access to them is only on foot. The falls are divided into three parts:
The middle part that descends from a height of 3 meters.
An upper part descending from a height of 8 meters.
A lower part descending from a height of 15 meters.

images.caption: The upper part of Zwerbach Falls, 8 meters high
The middle part of Zwerbach Falls, 3 meters high
The lower part of the Zwerbach Falls, a height of 15 meters!
A view from below on the lower part of the Zwerbach Falls, a height of 15 meters!
The lower part of the Zwerbach Falls, a height of 15 meters!

title: Gislingham - Circular Walk 2 Reversed. Its great!
short_description: A 4.7 mile (7.5 Km) circular walk around the village of Gisslingham.
long_description:
The village of Gislingham is in rural mid Suffolk, 9 miles north of Stowmarket. There is a thriving shop, which as well as supplying a wide range of fresh meats, delicatessen, and bakery products provides take-away food and beverages such that you can picnic during your walk; and a village hall where car parking is available.
Gislingham‘s recorded history starts in 910 A.D. when a Norseman, Gisling started a settlement, probably on the site of an existing Saxon village. The Domesday Book described it as a prosperous and populous village with three manors and ten estates; the place names of Rush Green and Jenny’s Farm go back to this time almost 1,000 years ago. From 1150 to 1312 the village was home to the Knights Templar; their Hall was probably at the 15th C. Manor Farm. The parish had a brick-works which employed 11 people, located near the railway line and a fine windmill, built in 1821 on the north side of Mill Street, which operated for over a century.

title: The Danube by bike - Austria
short_description: In Austria, the cycle path along the river is very popular, very well developed and attracts a large number of cyclists every year thanks to its rich environment (culture, history, landscape).
long_description:
<The Danube is the second longest river in Europe. It rises Black Forest Germany, flows eastwards and reaches, after a journey of more than 2850km, Sea Delta region, Romania Ukraine.
This signposted route is particularly suitable for families and children, and without any particular difficulty.
We present the Austrian route, divided into 8 stages (i.e. 395km), from west to east. You cross Austria, from Passau in Germany, to Bratislava in Slovakia, passing through Linz, Melk, Krems and the Austrian capital Vienna. The route takes you through Upper and Lower Austria, their villages, churches, forests, abbeys, castles, vineyards (Wachau) and a rich historical heritage.
.

title: The Véloccitanie
short_description: Take the time to explore new horizons, be seduced by uncharted landscapes, and explore the countryside in complete peace and safety on La Véloccitanie!
long_description:
This recently inaugurated cycle route links the Canal du Midi, the fertile lands of the Lauragais, the varied panoramas of the Haut-Languedoc Regional Nature Park (vineyards, cliffs, forests, rivers, meadows..) and, via the PassaPaïs, the vast wine-growing plains of many of Hérault's famous appellations.
Eventually, you'll be able to cover more than 200 kilometres, from the Seuil de Naurouze to Béziers, discovering a wealth of natural and cultural heritage. It's a unique opportunity to immerse yourself in nature while cycling.
Look out for the simple pleasures to be shared along the way, according to your mood. Véloccitanie offers you a cycling itinerary full of little pleasures!

title: Hiking trail via the Grotto of Saint Magdalene - Saint-Pilon
short_description: A beautiful hike near Plan-D'Aups-Sainte-Baume to get some height in the heart of the Sainte-Baume Regional Natural Park and to reach the Saint-Pilon summit near the Sainte-Madeleine Cave.

images.caption: View of the pilon chapel overlooking the Sainte-Baume

title: Biesbosch walking route (Aakvlaai)
short_description: The Aakvlaai was created around 1999. Before 1999 it was agricultural area while today it has become water sports area.
long_description: In fact, the Aakvlaai is a small Biesbosch. The area lies in the south-eastern part of the Biesbosch. Over the years, small islands have formed in the area. So you can enjoy boating there and enjoy nature.

title: South Tyrol Skyrace - Percorso lungo
short_description: Every year at the end of July during the Südtirol Ultra Skyrace event lots of extreme athletes run on this demanding trailrunning route in South Tyrol. But of course, you can face this challenge also in the rest of the year.
long_description: With 69 kilometres and 3,930 metres of altitude, this is the shortened version of the extreme mountain run Ultra Skyrace. A head for heights and surefootedness are absolute prerequisites for this tour.

title: Thermalfüzér in the footsteps of the greats of Hungarian literature
short_description: Soaking in warm water after a long roll is always a turn-off. This thermal loop connects 13 thermal spas in Partium in a multi-day cycling tour.
long_description: Partium is a real treasure trove for the passing tourist. Starting from Gyula, we follow the thermal springs to the Gutin Mountains, and from there to the salt lakes of the Maramures salt mines. From the eastern part of the Great Plain, we occasionally wander over to the forerunners of the Bihar Forest, visiting the birthplace of János Arany, Ferenc Kölcsey, Endre Ady and Margit Kaffka, among others. Numerous castle churches and cultural heritage sites enrich the cycling experience in Bihor and Satu Mare County. In addition, the route passes through a number of Hungarian villages, one of which once preserved the right hand of King Stephen. After each stage you have the opportunity to rest in a thermal bath. The majority of these thermal baths are suitable for the relief of musculoskeletal complaints. Throughout the tour you can indulge in your favourite hobby of cycling by maintaining your joints.

images.caption: Lépten-nyomon Nagyszalontán 1. rész: szoborpark, nagyszalontai református templom, Kossuth-nóta...
Lépten-nyomon Szatmárnémetiben 1.rész: székesegyház, püspöki palota, Kossuth-kert
Friends on bikes | Oradea - Paleu - Sisterea - Sarbi - Balaia - Osorhei
Lonyai Castle  /  Castelul Lonyai, Mediesu Aurit  / Aranyosmeggyes

title: Walk around the Vallon du Colombier
short_description: A circuit to get some height and take advantage of the beautiful panoramas offered by the Petit Luberon. A beautiful mountain escapade starting from Robion!
long_description:
From the Théâtre de Verdure in Robion, the route starts directly with a steep climb for just over a kilometre, then a succession of false flats or less difficult climbs will take you to the heights.
Don't miss a few stops along the way to appreciate the panoramas that are available to you: the Monts de Vaucluse, the Alpilles, the Mont Ventoux (on a clear day)...
Then, for 1 km, you walk between the Vallon de Peyrot and the Petite Trappe with a dense forest on each side of the path which is not shaded unlike the majority of the route. You then arrive at Le Quillot. From there, you walk on both sides of the Vallon de la Sapine with a second less technical part. You gradually descend before reaching the Vallon du Colombier and its sheepfold located not far from there.
The return journey is via the Vallon de la Brayette to reach the Boulon on arrival. On the way, you will notice the impressive Baude rocks.
A nice loop for the hiker.
A beautiful loop to discover a pretty corner of Provence!

title: Kust till Kustleden - from Bökestad to Lake Immeln
short_description: The fourth stage of the Kust till Kustledens leads from the Bökestad campsite through woodland and the beautiful schonish lake landscape to the Brotorpet campsite on Lake Immeln.
long_description: On this stage we hike through the unique Swedish lake landscape. Along the shore of the Raslången we walk a little way north. Through wooded areas the trail passes between smaller lakes and we finally reach Immeln, one of the largest lakes in Schonen, which is especially popular with canoeists. On the way we can discover the hiding place of a Swedish assassin at Filkesjön, relax on the sandy beach of Immeln or look for fossils.
