Cachoeira do Veados, São José do Barreiro
Parque Nacional da Serra da Bocaina, Brasil

title: Locations of the Netflix series Sex Education: Wye Valley and Forest of Dean
short_description: Since its first broadcast in 2019, screenwriter Laurie Nunn's Netflix original series 'Sex Education' has been a huge success, celebrating a second season in 2020. Discover the filming locations of 'Sex Education' on a scenic walk through the Wye Valley and the Forest of Dean!
long_description:
Anyone familiar with the popular series 'Sex Education' knows of the fantastic landscape it was shot in it. Fascinated by the locations, fans of the series wanted to see where the most iconic scenes surrounding the students Otis (played by Asa Butterfield), Eric, Maeve, Aimee, and Jackson were filmed.
The majority of 'Sex Education' was filmed in Wye Valley in southeast Wales and the Forest of Dean in Gloucestershire in the west of England. 
The scenery is not just literally spoken 'fantastic' but quite the sight in real life - absolutely worth a visit!
Your journey following the trail of the Netflix series starts in Symonds Yat East and takes you to Tintern Abbey. On the way through nature, you will discover numerous places that you've seen on TV:
The Chalet: home of Otis and his mother Jean Milburn in Symonds Yat East
The Redbrock Bridge appears in one episode of season 2
The small village shop Londis in Llandogo, where the characters Ola and Adam work
The Wireworks Bridge in Tintern, where Otis and Eric walk to school.
Since most of the locations for the series are relatively close to each other in England and the southeast of Wales, you can visit them on a little trip. Put on your hiking boot or grab your bike and enjoy nature while walking in the footsteps of your favourite characters.
But one important location is still missing: Moordale High. As the former Caerleon Campus of the University of Wales, Moordale High is about a 40-minute drive from Tintern.
Have fun discovering the places where Otis, Maeve, Eric, Aimee and co hang out in the series!

images.caption: Canoeing on the River Wye, South Wales
View of the holiday home The Chalet
View of Redbrook Bridge over the River Wye
Tintern Abbey in the picturesque Wye Valley

title: Caves stream
short_description: A circular hiking route of short-medium length that passes through the Nahal Maerot Reserve in Mount Carmel
long_description: A circular hiking route that runs along the side of Nahal Maerot as well as in its caves. At the source of the stream in the coastal plain is an archeological-prehistoric site of world importance, which includes four caves: Tanor Cave (Tabon), Camel Cave, Nahal Cave (Al-Wad) and Hagadi Cave (Sakhul). These caves represent a repeated settlement over a period of more than half a million years by the primitive man, the Neanderthal man, the Homo sapiens man and their predecessors.

title: Main-Stromberg-Weg
short_description: The Main-Stromberg Trail leads over a distance of just under 172 km from the skyscrapers of "Mainhattan" to the picturesque vineyards of the Stromberg. We hike along the edge of the Odenwald into the Kraichgau, crossing the border between Hesse and Baden-Württemberg with the Neckar. Scenically, scenic hills, narrow river valleys and extensive fields make for delightful impressions.
long_description:
Stage 1: Frankfurt am Main - Dreieichenhain (15.7 km)
Our route begins in the Frankfurt district of Sachsenhausen and runs steadily uphill in a southerly direction. The "red squares" show us the way through a villa district and the beautiful gardens of the Lerchenberg estate into Frankfurt's city forest. The route continues via the Huguenot town of Neu-Isenburg, Buchschlag and the Seegewann allotment garden colony until we reach the old town of Dreieichenhain.
Stage 2: Dreieichenhain - Ober Ramstadt (25.1 km)
On the second day, we walk from Dreieichenhain through the Mörsbacher Grund to Ober Ramstadt. The picturesque Koberstadt Falltorhaus and the venerable Bernhard Geissler Oak await us on the way to Messel. The second section passes the Einsiedel forester's lodge with the Scheftelheim oak and the Ludwigsteich pond adorned with water lilies, before we head towards Ober Ramstadt with a view.
Section 3: Ober Ramstadt - Neunkirchen (18.6 km)
At the beginning, we climb the Mühlberg at the edge of Ramstadt, overcome a hilltop and reach Hahn-Wembach through a small river valley. Then we keep going uphill in the shade of the trees and soon see Lichtenberg Castle looming above the treetops. Via Suchmannsmühle we continue to Rodau before we reach Lichtenberg. After visiting the castle, the trail climbs steeply up to the ring wall on the Altscheuer, a reminder of the Celtic period. Finally, we hike up and down via Lützelbach to the stage destination Neunkirchen.
Stage 4: Neunkirchen - Fürth im Odenwald (11.4 km)
From the highest village in the Odenwald, we head south into mountainous terrain. The path to the Neunkirchener Höhe takes us past the Gersprenzquelle spring and the striking Seibertstein before we reach the Kaiserturm tower, which offers great views. The subsequent descent takes us to the hilly plain of Winterkasten. Via Litzelröde we then reach the Bismarckwarte near Lindenfels, which captivates with the time-honoured flair of its medieval buildings. Finally, we cover the last few metres through the fields to Fürth. 
Stage 5: Fürth in the Odenwald - Waldmichelbach (14.0 km)
On day 5, we can expect a lot of nature and several climbs. On the way, we enjoy a break in the beautiful Steinbachwiesen recreational area and pass the Lindenstein rock group, which a gravelled path takes us past. The Ireneturm at the highest point of the Tromm once again offers wonderful views. Finally, we leave the forest and follow the art trail lined with sculptures, which leads us along a ridge to the Kreidacher Höhe, where we leave the trail on the left and set up our night's lodging in Waldmichelbach.
Stage 6: Waldmichelbach - Neckarsteinach (23.0 km)
The sixth stage initially runs along the Wolfsloch and along the south side of the Kottenberg before continuing southwards through wooded hills. On the way, we pass the triangular Adlerstein, the Wolfsgrube and the Alte Sühnekreuz. Only towards the end of the day do we leave the mountain ranges and reach Neckarsteinach on a picturesque river bend and end the day in a relaxed way.  
Stage 7: Neckarsteinach - Sinsheim (25.1 km)
On day 7, the royal stage of the Main-Stromberg Trail awaits us: With the Neckar, we also cross the border into Baden-Württemberg and can look forward to a multi-faceted hike from the edge of the Kleiner Odenwald to the plains of Sinsheim. On the way, imposing castles, the historic old town of Dilsberg with its stately lime tree, the beautiful Biddersbach valley and numerous tranquil villages provide a wealth of impressions before we arrive in the half-timbered old town of Sinsheim.  
Stage 8: Sinsheim - Menzingen (23.8 km)
The penultimate part of our route leads in a south-westerly direction from Sinsheim to Menzingen. We hike through the wooded and meadowy hills around Waldangelloch, Eichelberg and Tiefenbach. On the way, we enjoy untouched nature and fantastic panoramas. We can make a worthwhile stopover at the Michaelskapelle chapel and the Kreuzbergsee lake.
Stage 9: Menzingen - Sternenfels (13.8 km)
With the final stage, we take a southeasterly direction and cross the extensive fields on the way to our destination Sternenfels. Through the Eschebach valley we reach the plain of Zaisenhausen, which is imposingly overlooked by the twin towers of its church. We then hike through orchards and small river valleys to Kürnbach, where a historic wine press adorns the side of the path. The Eschelberg is followed by the final ascent to Sternenfels, where we have reached the end of our hike at the foot of the Stromberg.

title: Kust till Kustleden - from Sölvesborg to Lake Grundsjön
short_description: The first stage of the Kust till Kustledens leads from Sölvesborg railway station across the plateau at Horst Ryssberget (155 m) to Lake Grundsjön.
long_description: Our tour follows one of the oldest parts of Skåneleden, which was completed in 1978. We hike north from Sölvesborg - always in the direction of Lake Grundsjön. The landscape is characterised by extensive spruce and beech forests, forest and gravel paths alternate.

title: Hike to Pic de la Sagette
short_description: The hike from Lac de Fabrèges to Pic de la Sagette offers a picturesque route through varied landscapes, with exceptional panoramic views of the Pyrenees and its verdant valleys.
long_description:
This well-marked trail passes through a variety of landscapes, from dense forests to alpine meadows, offering total immersion in the wild beauty of the region.
The trail begins on the shores of Lac de Fabrèges, a peaceful spot surrounded by majestic mountains. From the outset, hikers are greeted by fresh mountain air and birdsong, creating a serene, revitalizing atmosphere. The trail climbs steadily through a forest of fir and beech, where the shade of the trees and the coolness of the undergrowth offer a welcome respite in hot weather. As you climb, the forest lightens and gives way to alpine meadows, dotted with wildflowers in summer, adding a touch of color to the landscape.
The climb continues until you reach the Sagette plateau, where the panorama begins to unfold. The view opens up to a vast expanse of mountains, with snow-capped peaks on the horizon and deep valleys below. It's an ideal place to pause and catch your breath while admiring the grandeur of the Pyrenees. The trail then continues along a ridge, offering spectacular views on both sides. At this point, the climb becomes steeper and requires some stamina, but the reward is well worth it.
The summit of Pic de la Sagette, culminating at around 2,000 meters, offers a 360-degree view of the region. On a clear day, it's possible to see iconic Pyrenean landmarks such as the Pic du Midi d'Ossau. The spectacular panorama invites contemplation and relaxation, offering a moment of deep connection with nature. It's also an ideal opportunity for photographers to immortalize the beauty of the Pyrenean landscape.
For those looking for a gentler experience, it's possible to take the cable car from Fabrèges to the intermediate station of La Sagette, reducing part of the climb. This also allows families and the less experienced to enjoy the views without too much physical effort. However, for experienced hikers, the full ascent remains the most rewarding option, offering a real challenge and total immersion in the mountain environment.
The descent is made along the same path, offering a new perspective on the landscape, often illuminated differently by the changing light of the day. Back at Lac de Fabrèges, a refreshing swim or picnic on its shores can be a pleasant way to round off this adventurous day.

images.caption: Hike to Pic de la Sagette
Hike to Pic de la Sagette
Hike to Pic de la Sagette

title: Alpine Rose Trail - Alpine Hiking in the Unterland
short_description: The trail climbs in a northerly direction towards the picturesque village of Schneisingen. You follow the signpost «Mittel- und Ober-Schneisingen, Koblenz and Bad Zurzach».
long_description:
In the Bowald, you soon come across the alpine roses (flowering season in mid-May), which were carried into the lowlands during the Ice Age and have survived until today. After the alpine roses, walk back to the Wegspinne and westwards through shady woodland to the hamlet of Vogelsang. The trail continues along the meadow slope and later along the edge of the forest to Endingen.


.

title: Bird paradise on the Flachsee
short_description: The hike to the unique nature reserve «Flachsee» begins in Rottenschwil.
long_description: In the 1960s, the melioration of the Reuss plain and the construction of a power plant were planned in this area. The plain would have been drained by a canal system without any consideration for the rich flora and fauna. After years of struggle, an alternative project was developed on the initiative of the then «Aargauischer Bund für Naturschutz» (now Pro Natura), in which the shaping of the flat lake was proposed. After a tough referendum campaign at cantonal level, the people of Aargau narrowly decided in favour of the variant that exists today.

title: On the Eifelsteig from Aachen to Trier
short_description:
The Eifelsteig - that's more than 300 km of varied and natural trails, with a high proportion of earth-covered paths, magnificent views and a multitude of formation changes.
.

title: Family-friendly hike to Alpe Hochried
short_description: A short, family-friendly round tour from Immenstadt with a stop at the Hochriedalpe and descent through the Steigbachtobel.
long_description:
The starting point of the short tour is the car park of the Mittag-Bahn or alternatively at the Immenstadt cemetery. A striking start to the tour is the large scree field at the foot of the Immenstädter Horn. At the end of the 1990s, a large part of the mountain flank slid down into the valley here. After crossing the flood defences of the Steigbachtobel, the trail leads uphill into the forest towards the Mittag mid-station. The trail is also easy to walk with children, as there are no exposed areas or areas where there is a risk of falling.
The small, unimproved hiking trail does not lead too steeply over many steps. There are always beautiful views over the whole of Immenstadt with the Alpsee in the west, the Illertal valley as far as Kempten in the north and the Grünten, the guardian of the Allgäu, in the east. After a relatively short time, you leave the forest again and cross the high pastures of the Alpe directly to the Hochried Alpe, which invites you to take a break. Fortified with coffee and homemade cake, or alternatively hearty bacon and cheese from our own production, you continue to the Steigbachtobel.
The wooden chapel at the entrance to the ravine and the statue of the Virgin Mary, which can be found in a six-metre-high Nagelfluh boulder, invite you to take another rest. The descent starting here directly into the Steigbachtobel partly requires an increased level of surefootedness and attention, especially for small children. An alternative descent is via the gravel path directly next to it, which is also home to the toboggan run in winter. At the end of the Tobelweg, there is a memorial plaque in honour of Kaiser Wilhelm on the occasion of his 100th birthday. When you arrive back at the flood protection structure, the tour is over.

images.caption: Aufstieg zur Alpe Hochried von der Talstation der Mittag-Bergbahn
Wasserfälle und Gumpen im Steigbachtobel laden zur Rast an heißen Tagen ein

title: Fahr Monastery - From Monastery to Monastery
short_description: Beautiful hike along the banks of the Limmat from monastery to monastery.
long_description: From Baden railway station, the path leads through the picturesque old town down to the Limmat. Before the Holzbrücke, the signpost «Kulturweg Baden-Wettingen-Neuenhof» branches off to the right. Follow this sign and after the Holzbrücke at the Wettingen monastery, walk on the left «Limmatuferweg» to Würenlos and change here to the right bank. From now on, follow the signs to «Kloster Fahr». The hike opens up a charming river landscape where idyll and civilisation wounds lie close together and past important cultural and industrial monuments.

title: Lägern - Romantic ridge walk
short_description: Hike to the ridge via the ridge path to the Altlägeren to the Lägern Hochwacht.
long_description:
From the station, the promenade lift takes you down to the Limmat and along the Limmat promenade upstream to the Landvogteischloss. After the underground tour, a steep staircase leads up to Schartenfels Castle.
The more interesting option, but not recommended for children or hikers with dogs, climbs up to the ridge path at the Schartenfels restaurant. This section is quite exposed in parts and dangerous in wet conditions.
The normal route goes around the Schartenfels to the left and turns right after approx. 200 metres. The ascent to the Chaltbrünneli rest area follows and then the steep footpath to the Lägern Burghorn viewpoint. Before the ridge, the trail reunites and a narrow ridge path leads to the Altlägeren ruins and continues to Lägern Hochwacht.

title: Säben Monastery
short_description: From Klausen, this short hike leads up to the famous Säben monastery on well-maintained paths.
long_description:
Säben Monastery was once called the Acropolis of Tyrol and has stood for centuries on a prominent rocky hill above Klausen in the Eisack Valley. The monastery is still inhabited by a few nuns today and is not only a popular hiking destination, but also a place of refuge and tranquillity for many.
Although this tour is more of a walk than a hike, the way to the monastery is very rewarding. You have a view of the lovely town of Chiusa with the Eisack river running through it from above and get to know an impressive testimony of medieval monastic culture.

title: The Genoese fortress - Crimea's top tourist attraction
short_description: The Genoese fortress in Sudak is a unique historical monument. The fortress is situated on a 157-metre high mountain, which is a continuation of Cape Kyz-Kule-Burun («cape of maiden tower»).
long_description:
Architectural ensemble of the Genoese fortress
 .
The Genoese Fortress is located just 2km from the seafront. It is a trademark and one of the main tourist attractions not only in Sudak, but in Crimea as well. The Genoese built a lot of fortifications on the coast of Crimea. There are fortresses of the same name in Feodosiya, Balaklava and many other places. That is why in recent years we can more often hear the name - Sudak fortress.
 . <Today we can see several buildings of the fortress: barbican, Watchtower, Consular castle, sections fortress walls, water reservoir and a few more. The entrance to Sudak Genoese is in main gate. There are information plates at all objects fortress. major preserved belong second half 14th century. They were built by people from northern Italy; — Genoese. You read more about each building on official website fortress.

images.caption: Крым, Судак, Генуэзская крепость, Черное море
Крым. Судак. Генуэзская крепость. Видео 4К. / Crimea. Sudak. Genoese fortress / PC-ONE - Be With You

title: Tüfels Chäller - jungle and playground
short_description: Hike through primeval forest
long_description: From Baden railway station, the route leads via Badstrasse, Stadtturm and Mittlere Gasse to Cordulaplatz. The subway «Glas» brings you to Mellingerstrasse to the Hotel Linde, where you can ücross the street. To the left of the town library, the former Maria Krönung convent, the path leads up to the railway station üvia the Passerelle to the KV Baden-Zurzach business school. A wooden staircase leads into the ascending forest. There is a world to discover that is far away and yet so close to civilisation.

title: Moated Castle - Beaver and Industrial Culture
long_description:
The trail leads you first to the spa district then along the Limmat / Aaruferweg to Turgi and on to the "Wasserschloss". Beavers have set up their territories from the Kappellerhof power station. Their gnawed, spectacular "tree sculptures" repeatedly line the riverside path.
In Vogelsang, at the western end of the bridge, by the car park, cross the wooden footbridge and follow the footpath that leads along the water. At the sewage pumping station, cross the Aare (pipe bridge).

Note(s)
Sights:
The area in the triangle formed by Brugg, Turgi and Klingnau is known as the "Water Castle of Switzerland" (part of the "Auenschutzpark" Aargau project). Shortly after the Gebenstorfer Horn, at Vogelsang, the rivers Aare, Reuss and Limmat flow together. The result is a unique river landscape, extensive floodplain forests with rich flora and fauna.
In Vogelsang, before crossing the Aare bridge, a detour down the Aare (about 300 m) to the Limmatspitz is particularly recommended.
Thanks to its large rivers, north-eastern Aargau grew into an industrial landscape of rare density in the 19th and 20th centuries. Many of these factories and power plant buildings are still standing. The industrial heritage trail Limmat - Wasserschloss was created especially for this purpose. The "Turgi-Vogelsang-Untersiggenthal" section is part of this hike.

Public transport stops:
Baden railway station
Turgi railway station
Bus stop "Dammstrasse" Windisch

title: Moorlands Niederrohrdorf - To moors and swamps
Siggenberg Iflue - Forest hike with a view
short_description: Panoramic hike through vineyards and forests.
long_description:
From Baden railway station, walk via the Kurpark to the Bäderquartier. The Grand Casino Baden and the Kurtheater are located in the park. The park itself is the city's haven of peace with over a hundred-year-old trees.
From the Bäderquartier, the path leads through the vineyards up to the Hertenstein and then on to the «Ebni» with a magnificent view. The path to the desired excursion destinations is well signposted.
The descent from the Iflue to Siggenthal station is something special. It is very steep, but easily passable and marked with the yellow hiking trail signs.

title: Gebenstorfer Horn - High above the moated castle
Heitersberg - A lake in the forest
From Chänzeli to Chänzeli
short_description: Hike in the city of Baden and its surroundings.
long_description: From the station, use the promenade lift down to the Limmat and follow it upwards to the Landvogteischloss. The first steep ascent, with a difference in altitude of 110 metres, leads to the restaurant Schloss Schartenfels. After the descent of 132 metres to Ennetbaden and an ascent of 107 metres, you reach the Hertenstein-Chänzeli through the vineyards, the so-called Goldwand. 100 metres lower down you reach the Bäderquartier before the ascent of 154 metres takes you to the Martinsberg-Chänzeli. After a further descent of 63 metres, you reach the Stein ruins. From there, the descent to the station is another 44 metres.

title: Crossing the Korab Mountains - Stage 5: Grama - Rabsisht
long_description:
Author
Simon Reuter 
Update: March 21, 2022

images.caption: Over the alpine meadows of Grama

title: Between Moossee and Limpach Valley
short_description: It is a pleasant hike with few differences in altitude. It goes over high farmland, forest and through beautiful farm villages.
long_description: From Münchenbuchsee railway station, hike north to the Moospinte golf course, which you cross. Continue on to Äspli where you will be impressed by the biodiversity in the sunken quarry and the distant view of the mountains. After Ballmoos you walk across the field to the mighty farmyards of Zuzwil. Several valuable old granaries can be seen here. Next is Iffwil and the community of loosely grouped individual barns. Then you cross the Mülchibach and follow the Messibach to the destination of Messen.

title: From Schüpfen to Fraubrunnen
short_description: The hike leads mostly along the edge of the forest into the heart of the Fraubrunnenamt.
long_description: The beautiful Bernese farmhouses and the view of the Alps and the Jura are worth seeing. Parts of the route are on asphalt. From Schüpfen you cross the Lyssbach stream and walk along the edge of the forest to the village of Seewil. Through the Tannl;ckewald and along the edge of the Oberholzwald, the trail leads to Hohrain. Via field paths and roads you reach the village of Scheunen, which consists of loosely grouped individual houses. On a long stretch of asphalt you come to Etzelkofen with its rustic farmhouses. Now you cross another forest and hike on the asphalt road to Fraubrunnen.

title: Along the railway line to Bätterkinden
Through the forest from Niederwangen to Laupen
Over four mountains south of Bern
short_description: Over meadows, forest paths, roads past ruins through hamlets and over mountains. A varied tour from Zimmerwald to Köniz.
long_description: From Zimmerwald you head straight uphill on hiking trails and roads, past the observatory, up to the Lisiberg. A hiking trail continues up to the hamlet of Egg. Walk across meadows down to the Witscheren farm. Here you take the field path, which leads partly through the forest, down to the hamlet of Niederulmiz. Then the path climbs again and runs mainly through the forest to the Ulmizberg. From the lookout tower you have a wonderful view. Downhill you hike to the Lolisberg. Cross the Sulgenbach stream and continue on a slope path to the Ägerten ruins. Then you tackle another short climb and make the pilgrimage to the Gurten, Bern's local mountain. On the western summit of the Gurten is the 25-metre-high observation tower. If the view is good, the panorama stretches all the way to France. It's back downhill to the railway station in Köniz.

title: Around Lake Wohlensee
long_description:
Recharge your batteries not far from the hustle and bustle of city life. Beautiful hike around Lake Wohlensee. Around 500 metres of ascent and descent. Always following the lakeside path, you walk around the 13 km long dammed Aare. The tour is also possible in the opposite direction or you can start in Fuchsenried or Oberei.

Note(s)
Good physical condition is an advantage. A few passages require some trisafety, therefore partly T2.

title: From Toffen to Münsingen
long_description: A varied hike from the Gürbe valley into the Aare valley. From Toffen you immediately cross the "Gürbe" to the hamlet of Heitern, at the foot of the Belpberg. Here the climb through the Chramburg forest begins. Past the Chramburg ruins, the trail follows the edge of the forest to Gerzensee where, among other things, the old castle is located. The trail continues to the stately Rütimatt farmhouse, a magnificent group farm with an Art Nouveau residential section. The wide view over the Aare valley into the Emmental hills is also magnificent. You hike slightly downhill to Ochsenmatt and over the Schützefahrbrügg to the other side of the river to Münsingen.

title: Over the Locheberg into the Aare Valley
short_description: Hike from Konolfingen to Oberwichtrach.
long_description: Up to Stalden, the varied hike begins on an asphalt road. Afterwards, the trail leads through the Locheberg forest. On leaving the forest edge, you are surprised by a magnificent mountain panorama. Then follows the farming village of Häutligen. Now you hike through the Wiftrechwald forest where you then follow the path steeply down to Oberwichtrach. From there it is not far to Wichtrach railway station.

title: Through the forest to the Gurnigel
Through the Scherli and Black Water Ditches
short_description: Impressive hike to Schwarzenburg.
long_description: You first start along the railway line, then cross it and soon you get down to Scherligraben. After only 400 m you leave the valley floor again and climb up through the forest to the hamlet of Mittelhauml;usern. Here you can enjoy a wonderful view over the Sensegraben to the Chasseral. This is followed by an adventurous descent to the banks of the Sense. Along the river, certain shallow and deep water spots invite you to swim. Soon you cross the old Schwarzwasserbrück bridge and continue along the river again. After the third crossing, a steep path leads up to the hamlet of Nidig. At Gibelegg you can enjoy a wonderful view. The route to Wahlern becomes a panoramic hike. Then you descend to the village stream and follow the path to the station.

title: To the Ballenbühl viewpoint
short_description: Hike from Worb to Konolfingen with a beautiful panorama of the Alps at the lookout point.
long_description: A pleasant and varied ascent to the Ballenbühl. Two lime trees, visible from afar, provide shade at the wonderful vantage point. The descent to Konolfingen is short but steep.

title: High-altitude tour through the Emmental harrow landscape
Along the Aare between Münsingen and Thun
long_description: This wonderful riverside hike leads along the Aare from Münsingen to Thun. The route runs mostly along beautiful narrow riverside paths and through one of the most beautiful river landscapes in Switzerland. Enjoy the refreshing breeze.

title: Excelsior Lookout Trail and Cachoeira das Almas Waterfall
short_description: The trail to the Mirante do Excelsior, in Tijuca Forest, has an incredible view of the city of Rio de Janeiro. Finish the hike with a waterfall bath at Cachoeira das Almas.
long_description:
The trail is an old road surrounded by dense vegetation, ideal for protection from the strong Rio de Janeiro sun. Most of the trail is flat, with only a few unevennesses. The Mirante do Excelsior é reached after about 1 hour, from where there is a beautiful view of the Tijuca Forest, and the north zone of Rio de Janeiro, where é possible to see the Maracanã, the Guanabara Bay and the Rio Niterói Bridge.Finish the walk with a refreshing bath in the Cachoeira das Almas waterfall and a snack at A Floresta restaurant. On the way back, you can also visit the Fairy Lake.
The Tijuca National Park opens daily from 8am to 5pm and you are only allowed to start the trail until 2pm.

title: To the official residence in Schlosswil
short_description: Easy hike from Biglen to Münsingen.
long_description: This easy hike is an entertaining transition from the Bigetal to the Aaretal. On the way you will come across the "most beautiful official residence in the canton of Bern", Schlosswil Castle with its magnificent pond and castle garden. The trail runs partly on forest roads but also on asphalt stretches.

title: Summit Tour Fräkmüntegg - Pilatus Kulm
short_description:
Diese Tour von der Fräkmüntegg auf den Pilatus ist sehr steil, bietet aber ein kontrastreiches Panorama. Der Weg wird auch Heitertannliweg genannt. 
Translate to English
long_description:
This tour from Fräkmüntegg to Mount Pilatus is very steep, but offers a panorama full of contrasts. The trail is also called the Heitertannliweg. On a narrow, stony path, the trail climbs steeply over the Lauelenegg and the Ober Lauelen past scree slopes. The Klimsen Chapel stands spectacularly close to the precipice. It is worth stopping here for a beautiful view of Lake Lucerne. The trail then zigzags steeply upwards until you reach the summit gallery, which leads from the top station of the Pilatus cable car to the rocky head of Mount Pilatus. On a steep metal staircase, the Chriesiloch is climbed, and after a few metres in altitude, you reach the Kulm.

Note(s)
Back to the valley, either the cable car to Kriens or the rack railway to Alpnachstad will take you.

images.caption: Klimsenkapelle chapel with Pilatus in the background

title: At the foot of Mount Pilatus
short_description:
Bei dieser anspruchsvollen Wanderung gibt's tolle Ausblicke auf den Pilatus und den Vierwaldstättersee.
Translate to English
long_description: There's great views of Mount Pilatus and Lake Lucerne on this challenging hike. The tour starts in Kriens and immediately begins with a long and tough climb to Krienseregg and on to Alp Fräkmünt. The descent from Fräkmünt to Alp Gschwänd and up to the historic Renggpass can be easy on the knees. After a short ascent, the trail then follows back down over the Lopper to Stansstad.

images.caption: Sicht von der Fräkmüntegg zum Bürgenstock.
Zurück geht es nochmal leicht bergauf zur Bergstation Fräkmüntegg vorbei an der Drachenalp und der Bergkapelle Fräkmünt

title: Tréguiez botanical trail
short_description: A walk to and from the botanical trail (the walk is punctuated by educational panels on the fauna and, mainly, the flora of the area);The return point of this very affordable little hike, the beautiful Tréguier mountain, will offer you a superb view of the Sainte-Croix lake and the Val d'Angouire Canyon (a small tributary of the Verdon).
long_description:
From the car park at the top of the village, follow the direction of the Belvédère de Tréguier. The walk starts here.
This short, family-friendly walk offers a beautiful view of the restanques (from the Provençal word "restanco"): dry stone wall terraces planted with olive trees. The cultivation of the olive tree is an important agricultural activity in the region.
.

images.caption: circuit de randonnée - Moustiers-Sainte-Marie: Sentier botanique du Tréguiez
The Brisenhaus awaits in the middle of the tour

title: Along the Aare between Bern and Münsingen
Out of the city under bridges
long_description: Beautiful and leisurely hike along the Aare. The tour starts at the Bärengraben bus stop and then leads immediately along the left side of the river to the Felsenau weir. Here you change to the right side. Continue downstream along the riverbank path towards Tiefenau. Pass the Reichenbach ferry and Bremgarten Castle. You then reach the Felsenaubrücke bridge, then the Seftausteg footbridge, where the water collected at the Felsenau weir is returned to the Aare. On soft ground you hike to Neubrügg, which is the oldest covered wooden bridge in Canton Bern. At Vorderdettige you briefly take the asphalt road. In Underdettige you follow the path along the river bank to the Stägmattsteg, which you cross. The last stretch goes through the forest to the Eymatt bus stop where the bus takes you back to the station. The entire route is characterised by imposing bridges.

title: Tomlishorn Flower Path
short_description: The Flower Trail is one of the most beautiful hiking trails in the Swiss Alps;
long_description: The path is well secured by a railing, so that you can walk with gym and leisure shoes. Steps have been cut into the rock in the steeper parts. Along the trail, flower signs provide information about the flora, including flower colour and time.

title: About the Mannenberg
short_description: The easy circular hike with great views takes you over the Emmental hills and along the Emme.
long_description: The hike starts at Hasle-Rüegsau railway station and begins with an easy but steady ascent üvia the Ötzenberg, Schallenberg, Mannenberg to the Rachisberg. From there it is practically all downhill via Busswil, Wirtenmoos and finally along the Emme back to the starting point. The route is varied and characterised by a sensational view.

title: Dorfwaldweg
long_description:
This very family-friendly, easy circular tour starts at the railway station in Randa. First you hike on the normal road to Ännerna. At the village stream, turn right onto the forest road. Looking towards the Klein Matterhorn, you hike through the forest and across lush meadows. At the chapel the trail rejoins the asphalt road and leads back to the starting point.

Note(s)
Suitable for children from 4 years.

title: Baker’s Pond Hiking Trail
short_description: The hiking trail leads to the pond that is the source of the headwaters of the Wolf River.  There is a graveled, stairway trail to the ridgetop overlooking Baker’s Pond.
long_description: Baker’s Pond Trail is a 1 mile lightly trafficked out and back trail located near Falkner, Mississippi that features a lake and is good for all skill levels. The trail is primarily used for hiking, nature trips, and birding and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.

title: Schwalmquellen Tour - Ulrichstein-Helpershain
short_description:
This beginner's tour takes us to the source of the Schwalm between Köddingen, Meiches and Helpershain.

Note: GPS-guided hiking!
long_description:
The trail begins at the Grundmühle in Helpershain and leads up the Heckenweg, past the former rubble dump and then through mixed beech forest to Köddinger Straße. There it follows a stretch of the road towards Meiches before turning right again into the forest path that leads to the Schwalmquelle. There it follows a stretch of the road in the direction of Meiches, before turning right again into the forest path that leads to the Schwalmquelle spring. At the Schwalmquelle there used to be a pond that was used by the landgraves and great dukes as a foal pool. The forest aisle in which the spring lies is still known today as the foal pen. In earlier times it was also a place of worship.
The trail continues through the Hegwald, the Rhine Weser watershed, in a southerly direction, üe over the road, through the Lohwald to the edge of the forest. Then it goes über the Helges along the edge of the forest and through the hedges back to Helpershain.

images.caption: View of Neu Schauenburg Ruin towards Frenkendo

title: Mirim Tijuca Peak Trail in Tijuca National Park
short_description: This beautiful and easy trail is ideal for those who want to know a little more of the natural wonders of the city of Rio de Janeiro. The trail is light and well signposted, and can be done even with children.
long_description:
The trail to Pico da Tijuca Mirim é easy and perfect to do with family. Located in the beautiful Tijuca Forest, the largest urban forest in the world, the peak is 917m high. From its top, it is possible to get a privileged view of the city of Rio de Janeiro. 
The Tijuca National Park is the most visited conservation unit in Brazil. Although it was created in 1961, the project of reforestation and protection of the region began in 1861, by order of D. Pedro II.
Today the Park has a green area of almost 40 km ², and among its beautiful forests é possible still recognize a little of the history of the place, through the ruins of the coffee farms é that were expropriated to allow the reforestation of the region

Trilha Pico da Tijuca no Parque Nacional da Tijuca, Rio de Janeiro - Brasil

title: Poschiavo - San Romerio - Viano - Brusio
short_description: Varied hike to the Sanctuary of S. Romerio (12th century).
long_description:
Varied hike to the church of pilgrimage S. Romerio (12th century). This day-hike is called the «classic route» of Valposchiavo. From the church San Romerio you have a beautiful view of the lower valley.
From Poschiavo to the fork which is about 70 m above Cologna one can hike to Barghi. From this path one has a splendid view. Piz Lagalb and Corn da Campasc are prominent points in the north. The picture of the western valley's flank with Piz Cancian, Pizzo Scalino and Piz Varuna is broken up by numerous Alpine huts. High above the Lake of Poschiavo you can see Piz Mürasc, Corn dal Solcun and Giümelin. In the south you have a view of the Bergamasc Alps.
From San Romerio a partially steep and stony path leads to the Alpine hut Piaz and down to La Greda. Then a nice trail continues to Alp Predasc. On route 37 you hike across Viano to Brusio. The road between Viano and Brusio is asphalted.

title: Moraine Lake Trail
short_description: A short hike with a slight ascent leads to an indescribable view of the mesmerizing Lake Moraine. Stunning scenery and lots of nimble little squirrels await you within this short walk.
long_description:
The short hiking trail leads from Lake Moraine's parking to the most stunning view of the gorgeous lake and nature surrounding it. The walk is on paved and neat paths, which are slightly challenging but manageable even for less experienced hikers. The viewpoints are easily accessible from the paths.
There are viewpoints at the top, but the view from the lakefront is also amazing and you are closer to the shimmering blue water.

title: Golden Gate Lookout point
short_description: A short hiking trail that leads to a great view of the San Francisco Golden Gate Bridge.
long_description: This easy loop trail leads to one of the most beautiful views of the Golden Gate Bridge. The trail passes by historic buildings that were once used by the military.

images.caption: Beginning of the route leading to the Golden Gate Bridge
The Golden Gate Bridge peaks behind a hill

title: Big Trees Trail
short_description: Easy loop trail that runs through a forest of giant trees in Sequoia National Park.
long_description:
As the name suggests, this hike takes you past numerous giant trees. In the Sequoia National Park, you will find a large concentration of giant sequoias. Some of them are still growing. Some of them have been uprooted despite their enormous size and are now lying on the ground in their entire length.
As this is a relatively short route, it is advisable to combine this hike with the route that leads to the impressive Sunset Rock.
This hike is barrier-free and therefore accessible for wheelchair users and with a stroller.

title: Taft Point
short_description: A short-medium hiking route leading through a forest to a panoramic view point on the Yosemite Valley from where the point of view known as "Taft's Point" emerges
long_description:
This hiking route begins with a level walk in a wooded area, while further down the road there is a relatively short graded descent leading to a wide and panoramic view point overlooking the Yosemite Valley and the El Capitan mountain. The high point of the route is the spiky and high rock point that stands out towards the valley - the Taft point.
The first part of the route is accessible to strollers, but the following section with the descent towards the observation deck is not accessible. In general, it is not particularly recommended to take a walk with very young children to the viewpoints, as it is a wide unfenced area that descends steeply into the valley.
Since this is a one-way route, the estimated walking times as well as the distance shown on this page are for one direction only.

images.caption: Part of the view from the viewpoint
A woman stands on the taft point

title: Sfazù - Sfazù
short_description: This classic hike from Puschlaver leads into the Val da Camp, which is listed in the Federal Inventory of Landscape and Cultural Monuments of National Importance. Pastures, plateaus and lakes characterise this unique hike.
long_description:
The classic hike at Valposchiavo goes to Val da Camp, a valley that is listed in the federal inventory of landscape and cultural monuments of national importance. Pastures, elevated plains and lakes characterize this unique hike.
In Sfazù the hike starts along the road that goes upwards. After the first ascent one comes to Buril. The path climbs gently up to the next settlements Salva, Mottacalva, Lungacqua and Camp. Here the trails branch off towards the lakes Lagh da Saoseo and Lagh da Val Viola. From here one has free sight to Val Mera on the opposite side.
The trail leads downhill across an impressive area of landslide to the enchanted, deep blue lake Saoseo, then it continues gently downhill. Through a mixed coniferous forest with exuberantly growing bilberry bushes and fern one reaches the place of Terzana.
On easy hiking trails along the pastures one comes to the branch to Sfazù and descends to Val da Camp, in order to cross it. On the other side of the river the path goes steep upwards and reaches quite soon the holiday camp of Buril. The last 10 minutes to Sfazù can be done along the street.

Lagh da Saoseo:
The beautiful lake Lagh da Saoseo is situated between hiking trails and forests which are surrounded by an intense scent of moss and resin. Its colours vary between blue, turquoise, dark green and violet. From Alp Campo the lake can be reached within a 10 minute walk.

Note(s)
Signage:
From Sfazù you follow the signs for «Camp». From Camp you follow the signs for «Lagh da Val Viola» until you come to the lake Val Viola. From there you follow the signs for «Lagh da Saoseo». Then you follow the signs for «Rifugio Saoseo SAC - Terzana/Sfazù-Terzana/Pozzulasc-Sfazù-Doss/Sfazù-Sfazù».

Bus:
If you prefer to walk less, you may take the small bus that starts at Sfazù and drives to Lungacqua or Camp (booking compulsory, at least one hour in advance: +41 (0) 81 844 10 42 / +41 (0) 79 599 96 76).

title: 01 - The path "of the viewpoints"
short_description: North of the Gulf of Salò is a route that offers several panoramic views through the forest and then, in an even more open manner, from the relief of the "cross of Salò."
long_description:
The climb to Croce di Salò requires some physical effort, but the effort is amply repaid by the beauty of the landscape and the tranquility of the trail. After leaving the historic center of Salò, the trail begins to climb gradually, passing through residential areas and small gardens. As you move away from the built-up area, the noise of traffic fades, giving way to the sounds of nature.
The first part of the climb features a paved road that winds through olive groves and vineyards. Here, it is possible to make short stops to admire the view of the lake that opens up more and more as you gain altitude. During spring, the fields are in bloom and the air is pervaded by the scent of wildflowers.
Continuing on, the paved road gives way to dirt paths that enter oak and chestnut forests. The terrain becomes more uneven and the gradient increases, making the trail more challenging. It is advisable to take regular breaks to catch your breath and hydrate. Along the trail, you may encounter small streams and natural fountains where you can refresh yourself.
The vegetation is lush and varied, with old trees providing shade and coolness during the summer months. It is possible to spot several species of birds, squirrels and, with a little luck, even some deer. For botany enthusiasts, the trail offers the opportunity to observe a wide variety of plants and flowers typical of the pre-Alpine area.
As you ascend, the trail offers numerous viewpoints from which to admire Lake Garda in all its expanse. These vantage points are ideal for taking photographs and enjoying the view. In some sections, the trail becomes narrower and steeper, requiring attention and surefootedness.
The last section of the climb is the most challenging, with a steep gradient and rocky terrain. However, fatigue is forgotten once you reach the top, where the Croce di Salò stands out against the sky. The view from here is simply spectacular, with the lake stretching as far as the eye can see and the mountains providing the backdrop.

title: Mono Mills & Mono Lake
short_description: A short, flat and easy route in the historic Mono Mills site from which you can have a great view of the beautiful Mono Lake
long_description:
A track is located in the Inyo National Forest in California and is a light and great stopping point for refreshment on the way to Yosemite Park or the ghost town of Bodie . Inside the wooden gazebo that is placed there you can read about the history of the site as well as watch in a unique and wonderful way over the wonderful Mono Lake. Lake Mono is an alkali salt (sodium) lake 21 kilometers long and 15 kilometers wide, its average depth is 17 meters and the deepest point is 48 meters. According to estimates, the lake was formed at least 760,000 years ago, inside the lake there are tuff rocks in varied and interesting shapes that you can observe.
You can have a picnic on the spot, and it is also in principle accessible for strollers.

images.caption: Lake Mono peeks out from behind the trees
Lake Mono peeks out from behind the trees

title: A trip to Grosser Alpsee
short_description: An easy and relatively flat hiking trail next to the Grosser Alpsee in the Allegoi (Upper) region
long_description:
A leisurely hiking route next to the large Alfaza lake, which is considered one of the largest in the Oberallgäu. A host of attractions, activities, cafes, bathing beaches, playgrounds and more await you along the route. The route first circles the lake from south to north and then curves to the left and circles it across its width from east to west. Along the way and the gorgeous view of the Alps, the following attractions await you:
* An information center where you can gather information about the area, buy local delicacies, drink coffee and more.
* Mini golf complex.
* Small playgrounds, a pirate themed playground with a small trampoline, climbing rock, water games, a slide that goes down the hill and more.
* Adventure rope climbing park.
* Option to rent pedal boats.
* Cruising in a large sailboat.
* Vessel rental center and SAP.
* Cafes, ice cream parlors and restaurants.
* A bridge hanging over the water.
* A variety of free public bathing beaches, as well as a paid bathing beach that includes a playground and other facilities.
* Concerts of the local orchestra (on Fridays, during the summer season, free entry).
* Festivals (in summer)
* In winter you can walk on the frozen lake (in the permitted and safe places).
The track is accessible to strollers.
The walking time and distance shown are for one direction, but since most of the attractions are concentrated at the beginning of the route, it is possible to also do only part of the route and still enjoy most of the activities.

images.caption: Fischerman's houses at lake Großer Alpsee
Boat trip at lake Großer Alpsee

title: Sunset Rock
short_description: A relatively easy, short, flat trail leading to a panoramic view of one of the valleys of Sequoia National Park
long_description:
The trail passes through wooded terrain and leads to a huge and impressive rock that offers a wonderful view of one of the surrounding valleys. The path leading to the rock is beautiful and partly runs along a small stream. Arriving at the giant rock, it almost feels like you are on the moon.
This is an easy walk that is especially recommendable during the evening hours - as the name suggests, this is the ideal place to watch the sunset. This walk can be combined with the "Big Trees Trail" next door.
Due to the terrain's nature, this walk is not suitable for prams but suitable for families with older children. The trail is not accessible for wheelchairs.

title: Osterley Park
short_description: Osterley Park is home to one the few remaining Georgian country estates in London.  The spectactular grounds are operated by the National trust in which actvities such as Hiking, walking and cycling can be enjoyed.
long_description:
A short 15-30 minute circular walk covering one of the largest open green spaces in West London.  The walk will lead you through the beautiful parkland, followed by a trip along the Grand Union Canal and then The walk will take you through a mixture of parkland, industrial landscapes, a beautiful section of the Grand Union Canal and then back through residential streets to farmland which takes you up to the Historic attraction of Osterley House. 
The Park is situated in West London, Isleworth and is a short tube line away from central London.

title: A romantic trip to Point Bonita Lighthouse
short_description: A cable tour on a raised promontory in the natural municipal territory of the city of San Francisco leading to the lighthouse known as Point Bonita
long_description:
A great hiking trail surrounded by water on the right and left, with a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge. Through a tunnel cut in the rock you will reach a white bridge that will lead you to the charming Magdal (note that the road to the lighthouse is open to the general public only on Sundays and Mondays for three hours only). Along the road that starts downhill you can see a number of animals including seals resting on a large rock in the water, goats, fowls and birds of various species. A lovely hiking trail a short drive from the city center.
The route is paved and organized and therefore accessible for walking with strollers, but a slight climb on the way back should be taken into account.
Since it is a one-way route, the estimated walking time as well as the distance shown on this page are for one direction only.

title: Ospizio Bernina - Alp Grüm - Poschiavo
short_description: After Lago Bianco, the trail climbs to the fantastic vantage point of Sassal Mason with views of Piz Pal, the heart-shaped Lagh da Pal, Alp Grum and Valposchiavo. The Cavaglia high valley below invites you to linger.
long_description:
After Lago Bianco it goes up to the great viewpoint Sassal Mason with view of Piz Palü, of heart-shaped Lago di Palü, Alp Grüm and Valposchiavo. Below there is the high valley of Cavaglia that invites for a rest.
The trail offers fantastic views of mountains and glaciers, of the deep notch of Valposchiavo and of the Bergamasc Alps in Italy located behind. The railway makes lots of turns in order to conquer the difference in altitude: an impressive sight!
From the high valley of Cavaglia that was used as a real village with school, shop and restaurant for some decades due to the construction of the railway and of the power plant, the descent continues and passes by the numerous Alpine huts which are well kept and surrounded by forests and hedges. Finally you arrive to Poschiavo, the main place of the valley.
It is worthwhile visiting the glacier potholes of Cavaglia that are accessible for the public. The stones that rotated due to the strong currents of the prehistoric glacial water ground the potholes into the rock and formed them to sleek cavities and gaps.

title: Twin Peaks San Francisco
short_description: A short and easy hike to two twin hills located on a mountain overlooking the city of San Francisco
long_description:
This route will take you to several great and unique view points on the city of San Francisco. Near the hills there is a wide promenade from which you can also look out over the city and the famous Golden Gate Bridge. in a great way. A great itinerary for those who want to enjoy an ideal and panoramic view of the city.
The climb up the hills is organized and includes several steps and is therefore not accessible to strollers or wheelchairs, but from the adjacent boardwalk you can also enjoy the view of the city (just from a slightly different angle).

images.caption: נוף פנורמי על סן פרנסיסקו מהגבעה התאומה הראשונה
נוף מאחת הגבעות התאומות על השניה

title: Hiking circuit: tour of the Gruissan lake
short_description: This thematic trail, which circles the lake, is divided into ten explanatory panels to make the public aware of the richness and fragility of the wetlands of the lake in Gruissan.
long_description:
<Depending on the season, you may see pink flamingos and/or cormorants. The tang, vineyards and Massif de la Clape make this place a magical ideal to recharge your batteries.
Easy thematic trail, allowing to cover all the diversity of the ecosystem living in symbiosis with this lagoon space. 10 information panels as well as remarkable viewpoints mark out the route.

title: Trip to Monument Geyser Basin
short_description: A one-way, relatively short hiking route, leading to the geyser known as "Monument" through a great view point on the valley
long_description:
This hiking route begins with a relatively level walk, and as you progress, the road becomes a little steeper until you reach the wonderful view of the valley and further on to the smoking geyser that comes out of the hillside in which it is located.
Due to its nature, the path is not accessible to strollers.
Since it is a one-way route, the distance and walking time shown on this page are for one direction only.

title: FlaemingSkate cycle and skate path (Tour 1)
short_description: A tour in Brandenburg specially adapted to the needs of cyclists and inline skaters. Good asphalt conditions, no cars and flexible division of the stages of varying degrees of difficulty make this tour suitable for families as well as for endurance athletes.
long_description: The FlaemingSkate cycle and skate route (Tour 1) is one of the sporting attractions in the region. The various entrances to the route are clearly recognisable and marked with "Flaemming Skate". Along the way you will find many places of interest, such as various BMX trails, castles, monuments and, of course, the idyllic forests of the region. At just under 100 km, the tour is the longest continuous route of its kind in Europe. There are plenty of accommodation options along the way to suit every budget.

title: Walking along the Amalfi coast: Amalfi - Lone (Il Duoglio Spiagia)
short_description: The towns on the Amalfi Coast are linked by a scenic road, but also by numerous side roads and paths with stairs that can be crossed on foot. This route links Amalfi to Il Duoglio Spiagia, often listed in the top 5 most beautiful beaches on the Amalfi Coast.
long_description:
This route is just one of the possibilities to cross from one resort to another, enjoying the fabulous scenery and (lots of) movement.
The journey starts in Amalfi, either in the bus stop or in the centre of the resort. Climb up to the Gran Hotel Convento di Amalfi, a former 13th-century monastery converted îinto a luxury hotel. Unfortunately, the location can not be visited by those not staying here, but it's worth climbing the stairs for the view.
You'll get off in front of a tunnel that has space for pedestrian crossings; there's also a crossing area on the left side of the tunnel, on the way in. After the tunnel, follow the road up on the right, not the main road. From here on, you can't get lost, even if there are no proper signposts. Just keep it straight.
Besides the wonderful sea views beyond the coastal road, you can admire the local houses, courtyards, and numerous narrow streets with stairs.
The descent to Il Duoglio Spiagia is done in two stages: first, you go down a street with stairs from the side path to the main coastal road. Then you will have to walk about 2-300 metres along the side of the houses until they end (around a bend). On the right, a panorama opens up. On the left, it's a long stretch. Here you should find an access gate - open - and you'll start to descend again, this time towards the beach.

images.caption: Plimbarea îți dezvăluie crâmpeie din viața amalfitanilor

title: On the Schwellbrunn - Schönengrund hill range
short_description: The tour starts in Schwellbrunn, the highest municipality in the canton of Appenzell Ausserrhoden;
long_description: If you are not travelling by public transport, it is best to park your car in Herisau. After just a few minutes you arrive at «Högg» on the first hügelzug and enjoy the magnificent view of the Alpstein with the Säntis as a prominent elevation. The view from the seat with the well-known restaurant reaches as far as Central Switzerland if the view is good. The route follows the hilly terrain, so there are no major ascents or descents to contend with. Via Landscheidi and Arnig, the «Chäseren» again a popular excursion destination is reached. On the last section, the trail leads down to the village of Schönengrund, where the post bus takes you back to Herisau.

title: Olmsted Point
short_description: A short but special route that passes over a huge rock and includes several panoramic views of the split dome as well as Yosemite Valley from the rock as well as from Olmsted Point
long_description:
A hiking route starting near the famous Togga Pass road. This route has a special terrain character due to the fact that it passes almost entirely on top of a huge rock overlooking the Yosemite Valley. The walk on the route starts on a huge rock sitting diagonally on the ground on which you actually descend towards a viewpoint with another viewpoint on the Yosemite Valley known as "Olmsted Point" from which you can see the famous Half Dome Mountain as well as the Tenaya Canyon.
Due to the nature of the terrain, this route is not accessible to wheelchairs or strollers, but it is not too challenging for children.
Since this is a one-way route, the estimated walking time as well as the distance shown on this page are for one direction only.

title: Around Buttermere on 14 July 2022
short_description: A quick walk around Buttermere Lake from the village.
long_description: Mike went to Keswick for his holiday.

title: Beryl Spring
long_description:
Author
Tal Schindele 
Update: October 31, 2019

title: Glacier Point
short_description: A well maintained, short and easy hiking trail that leads to one of the most famous viewpoints in Yosemite Park, known as "Glacier Point".
long_description:
Hiking trail with panoramic views of one of the most beautiful and special valleys in Yosemite Park. From an altitude of 2,200 meters, we enjoy great views of Half Dome, Yosemite Falls and other valley attractions. There are several viewpoints, wildlife and a souvenir shop with a kiosk.
This trail is asphalted and has only minimal inclines, making it suitable for walking with strollers and wheelchairs.

images.caption: On the way to Glacier Point
Raccoon on a rock near Glacier Point
Enjoying the wildlife on our way to Glacier Point
Panormaic view of Yosemite National Park

title: General Sherman Tree Trail
short_description: A relatively short hike in Sequoia National Park, leading through a wooded area to a Sequoia tree known as the "General Sherman Tree," considered the tree with the world's largest trunk volume.
long_description:
This trail takes us from the car park on easy terrain to the General Sherman Tree, a famous giant sequoia in Sequoia National Park. The estimated age of the tree is 1900 to 2500 years. In terms of trunk volume, the tree is considered the largest of its kind in the world. However, the tallest tree in the world still towers over it by more than 30 meters.
The tree was given its name in 1879 by a naturalist who served under General William Sherman in the American Army. Sherman is considered a national hero of the American Civil War.
In 2006, a large branch 30 m long and 2 m in diameter broke off the General Sherman Tree.
The route is easy to walk, but you have to consider the way back, which is uphill on the same route. For people with reduced mobility, there is a car park directly at the General Sherman Tree. Other car parks are a short walk away. The asphalted route is basically suitable for walking with prams, but here, too, the way back and the ascending meters in altitude should be taken into account.

images.caption: The trunk of the General Sherman Tree

title: Gibbon Falls
short_description: A short, flat and easy route on top of a boardwalk with panoramic views of the impressive Gibbon Falls located in the northern part of the Yellowstone Nature Reserve
long_description:
This hiking route passes on top of an asphalt boardwalk that overlooks in a wonderful and unique way the Gibbon Falls flowing from a height of 26 meters. From the boardwalk you can watch the falls from a side angle as well as from an almost frontal angle.
This hiking route is paved and relatively wide and is therefore largely accessible to wheelchairs as well as strollers.

title: Grand View Yellowstone
short_description: An easy and short hiking route that passes over a neat boardwalk known as "The Giant Lookout" and leads to some great viewpoints on the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone from the north
long_description:
A beautiful hiking route that passes on top of a neat boardwalk overlooking the Yellowstone Grand Canyon with its yellowish tint and the wonders of nature that part of it from the north. From this direction you can view the upper and lower Yellowstone Falls behind, as well as the Yellowstone River and more. From this route you can see one of the best views of the lower Yellowstone Falls in the back.
This hiking route is also well accessible for strollers.

title: Appenzell Alpine Path
long_description: The Alpstein is perhaps "the most beautiful mountain range in the world", as the famous geologist Albert Heim (1849-1937) put it. On this tour you will learn that the rather unknown alpine landscape in front of the Alpstein is just as attractive. The tour starts in Urnäsch, the "centre of Appenzell customs", and leads over the Hochalp to Schwägalp. In Urnäsch, a visit to the Appenzell customs museum right on the village square is recommended as a prelude to the hike. Once you arrive at Schwägalp, you have the option of visiting the Alpschau cheese dairy or taking the cable car up to the Säntis. The tour is specially signposted as an official Switzerland Mobil route. Return journey from Schwägalp possible by post bus.

title: Artists' Paint Pots (HE)
short_description: מסלול טיול יחסית קצר וקליל. המסלול מתחיל בהליכה בדרך ישרה ומתחבר למסלול מעגלי. לאורך הדרך חולפים על פני מעיינות חמים צבעוניים בגדלים שונים וכן גייזרים קטנים
long_description:
מסלול הטיול ״דלי הצבע של האמן״ מכונה בשם זה בשל כך שהוא עובר לצד מספר בריכות/ מעיינות חמים בעלי גוונים שונים. רוב המסלול מסודר ועובר על גבי גשרי עץ המאפשרים הליכה וצפיה נוחה על בריכות המים המהפנטות והמיוחדות שבמקום. ישנם חלקים קצרים במסלול הכוללים הליכה על אדמה כמו כן גם מספר מדרגות ועליה קצרה בעלת שיפוע זניח.
חלקו התחתון של המסלול הינו נגיש לעגלות אך חלקו העליון הכולל מספר מעיינות נוספים וכן תצפית, כולל עליה במדרגות ועל כן אינו נגיש לעגלות אך ניתן בכל זאת לטייל וליהנות מחלקו התחתון של המסלול.
מסלול טיול מקסים ומומלץ גם עבור מי שאינו מיטיב לכת.

title: Hundwiler Height
short_description: The Hundwiler Höhe is a popular hiking destination. From the top of the pyramid-shaped elevation, the hiker enjoys a magnificent view from Alpstein to Lake Constance;
long_description:
Just as famous as the mountain is the summit restaurant where various specialities await the hungry hiker.
This tour starts right at the Zürchersmühle railway station, first crossing the Urnäsch and then following a smaller Bächlein in an eastern direction. A large part of the first ascent to the hamlet of Ramsten is in the forest, which is very pleasant, especially in summer. Now the trail follows the hillside to its top. Impressive nagelfluh walls and idyllic alpine pastures dominate the picture. The view across the hilly Appenzellerland is already far-reaching. From Hundwiler Hütte, you can also see the Alpstein with Kronberg and Suntis as prominent points. The descent takes you across open meadows to Gonten. The starting and end points can be reached with the Appenzell cable cars.

title: Hiking above the Kinzig Valley
short_description: From the small town of Schiltach in the Kinzigtal, this tour first takes us across the Schöngrund to the Brechhöhe. The route continues with beautiful views past the Horbenhof farm and via the St. Jacob's Chapel to Wolfach.
long_description: Varied tour from Schiltach to Wolfach

images.caption: Good signposting: Our route to Wolfach is very well signposted.
The view of Schiltach is to the east.
From the Horbenhof we have this impressive view.
The interior of the Chapel of St. James
The goal is almost reached: View of Wolfach

title: Fountain Paint Pots
short_description: A short and easy trip, but rich in a number of colorful hot mineral springs and pools, as well as a number of low but impressive geysers
long_description:
A great circular hiking route due to the thermal springs and the colorful and special thermal/mud pools in its territory as well as due to its active geysers. The most active geysers in this route do not spray to a great height, but they release a lot of smoke and emit water actively and in a form reminiscent of a water fountain, hence the name given to this route. Most of the walk is on the level, on wooden bridges, but there are also a few steps.
Due to the stairs in the place, the route is not fully accessible to strollers and wheelchairs, but the part up to the stairs can definitely be done on both sides. Children who are able to walk a distance of about a kilometer will be able to navigate the route relatively easily even without a stroller.
A great hiking route even for those who are not good at walking and still want to experience natural wonders.

title: Hüreli
long_description: From Davos Stilli you go up via the Steinschlagwald forest to Chaltboden. Continue climbing along the ridge to just below the Hüreli. With a left turn you reach the summit. Enjoy the unique view and continue hiking along the ridge to Pischa to the Mitteltälli station, where the cable car takes you to Davos Dörfji.

title: From the meadows of Seceda to Piz Duleda
short_description: Hike in the heart of the Dolomites from the Seceda meadows to the summit of Piz Duleda, with a small section of equipped trail.
long_description:
This route leads to the discovery of the true heart of the Dolomites, passing through some of the most iconic and well-known views but also discovering new and decidedly less frequented corners and viewpoints.
The landscape here is constantly changing. You start from the green meadows of Seceda at the top station of the Col Raiser gondola and here you begin to climb gently, enjoying the view of the Odle peaks in front and Sassolungo and Sassopiatto behind you. You then walk at the foot of iconic dolomite peaks such as Gran Fermeda, Gran Odla and Sass di Mesdì.
Entering Val dla Roa, the view changes and you ascend within a rock amphitheater to Furcela dla Roa; a short and easy equipped passage now begins (for the less experienced it is advisable to bring a via ferrata kit) that quickly gains altitude to the foot of Piz Duleda.
The climb to the summit is steep but the 360° view from the summit repays any effort. From up here the view sweeps almost infinitely, touching the most famous mountains of the Dolomite area such as Sassolungo and Sassopiatto, Cinque Torri, Sass de Putia, Lagazui, Marmolada and many others. A true spectacle.
The descent from the lace takes place along the same trail but then you choose another path going down some steps and, skirting Rio Cisles, reaching Rifugio Firenze for a refreshing drink.
From here it is a short walk to the Cabinovia.

images.caption: I dolci prati ai piedi delle Odle
Breve tratto attrezzato ai piedi del Piz Duleda
Croce di vetta sul Piz Duleda con vista sulle Odle
Vista dalla cima del Piz Duleda
Sassolungo e Sassopiatto tra i fiori agostani

title: Picturesque circular walk from Veli Lošinj via Mali Lošinj
short_description: This circular walk starts from Veli Lošinj and leads across the island to the west coast of the island. From there, an excellent hiking trail along the coast leads to the harbour and the old town of Mali Lošinj. The small alleys of the town meander back to the east coast of the island from where a path along picturesque bays leads back to Veli Losinj.
long_description: Refreshment stops Corrado, Fortuna and Marina

title: Bellwald - Lenzerheide
long_description:

title: Route of wonder Filzbach
short_description: A varied power-place hike in impressive scenery, leading to a true mountain lake jewel and exciting places around the lake.
long_description: From Filzbach the path leads to the valley station of the Kerenzerberg sports cableways. You can comfortably drive to the mountain station at 1280 m.ü.m. with the Habergschwänd mountain restaurant. The hike begins on a gently sloping hiking trail that leads you across meadows and through the forest to the Talalpsee. We walk around this romantic gem, starting on the mountain side. We follow the wide hiking trail back to the small mountain inn and then back up to the top station of the chairlift or on foot to the valley.

images.caption: Blick auf den Talkessel mit Talalpsee
Der See liegt noch im Schatten
Wie ein Spiegel liegt das Bergsee-Juwel

title: Between resorts on the Amalfi coast: Amalfi - Ravello
short_description: The resorts on the Amalfi coast can be reached not only by the main scenic road, but also by foot, on numerous side roads and paths with stairs. This route is one of the many possibilities to cross from one resort to another, enjoying the fabulous scenery and (lots of) movement.
long_description:
The route starts in Amalfi, right in the Museo della Carta. Many signposts and guidebooks recommend a foray into the Valle delle Ferriere; there are signposts for this, but we wanted to get to a nearby resort.
The route goes uphill for quite a while, up wide or narrow, gentle or steep stairs. For resting, there are stone benches. Just off the main road, the lemon groves of Valle delle Ferriere are almost always in sight. Behind, through the openings of the staircase, you can see the roofs of Amalfi and the Tyrrhenian Sea.
After a few hours, depending on your pace, you reach the quiet little town of Pontone, where you can see the terraced hills between Amalfi and Atrani, with their luxurious villas and panoramic balconies.
The route goes a little way along the road and then back up the stairs. Beautifully painted ceramic signposts guide you to Ravello. After about 30 minutes, you enter the resort, close to the centre. Visit everything you like, then allow yourself plenty of time to get out.
We descended in the evening, under the gardens of the Cimbrone villa, through a slightly wilder, unlit area. The last stretch were just very steep stairs.

title: Mattjisch Horn
short_description: Across snow-covered fields and mountains, the snowshoes take you leisurely to the summit of the Mattjisch Horn.
long_description:
Wonderful snowshoe tour in the midst of the snow-covered mountain world with a fantastic view. From the Fideriser Heubergen, we slowly climb up to the Arflinafurgga, where we reach the Mattjisch Horn via the ridge. Here a great panoramic view of some of the most famous Swiss peaks awaits. The descent is down to the Casanna ski house, from where you can follow the toboggan run to Langwies. Those who prefer to descend by toboggan can hire one from the ski house.

Note(s)
Bus to Fideriser Heuberge: +41 (0)81 332 13 04

.

title: Playgrounds in and around Bad Hindelang
short_description: A beautiful trail for children and adults, which leads to 4 playgrounds and much more.
long_description: This themed trail through Bad Hindelang, Bad Oberdorf and Vorderhindelang is very suitable for small but also big adventurers. The beautiful nature of the Allgäu can be enjoyed to the full and discovered in a playful way. In addition, the walk can be enriched by a miniature golf course, a local museum or numerous restaurants along the way. Finally, this route is a good way to get to know Hindelang;

title: Winter ascent in Piatra Craiului to Ascuțit/ Carol Lehman refuge
short_description: A difficult route in winter conditions, with parts that pose an avalanche risk (a detail specified on the signposts), but with wonderful views if the ridge is clear.
long_description:
Start from Fântâna lui Botorog on the classic route that goes up to Curmătura Cabin. Depending on the number of hikers so far, on the know conditions, and on the temperature, the foliage can sometimes be mixed with ice, as has happened now.
Take a short break for hydration and possibly go to the toilet at Curmătura Cabin. However, a longer stop is not recommended because the route is still long.
The ascent to the ridge and to the Ascuțit Refuge begins as a constant ascent through the forest, crossing several valleys. In dry season, there is rubble on the valleys; in winter, everything is covered in snow.
The difficult ascent begins somewhere in the middle of this segment, when the climb gets very steep (about 38% degree of inclination). The winding path in the summer months becomes almost a straight ascent in the winter, depending on the traces previously made. In the absence of traces, the effort is doubled.
The short segment provided with chains I knew existed somewhere was now completely buried under the snow. Above the valley, we came out in an area of juniper, fir, and rock. Partly scattered snow hid deceptive chunks of ice.
The ridge (and the whole route, by the way) remained shrouded in fog while we rested in the shelter. Somewhere nearby, a few dozen yards away, the Ascuțit Peak was hiding in the clouds.
We descended on the same route, carefully, keeping as much as possible the traces already made and with a longer stop at Cabana Curmătura.

images.caption: Signpost on the road marking avalanche risk
Ascuțit refuge and the Piatra Craiului ridge covered in snow

title: Santo Isidro Waterfall Trail
short_description: A hike to one of the main waterfalls in the highland region of the Serra da Bocaina National Park, in São José do Barreiro, SP.
long_description: This walk coincides with the initial stretch of the famous Trilha do Ouro (or Mambucaba Trail) and begins at the gateway of the Serra da Bocaina National Park. The Santo Izidro Waterfall is one of the highlights of the park and its fall is an impressive 70 meters high, forming a beautiful pool perfect for bathing. The waterfall is located only 1.5 km from the entrance and the trail is well signposted.
