title: Bibbona - Tour of the Macchia della Magona Nature Reserve
short_description: The tour leads through the Macchia della Magona nature reserve. This area is known for its challenging mountain bike tours and its beautiful hiking trails.
long_description: It is pleasant to hike on the paths that have been laid out. The signposting is present in large parts of the nature reserve but should be used with caution. The information boards are unfortunately only written in Italian and some of the locations are incorrectly marked. The route leads on partly unpaved ground over the officially signposted hiking trails 5 and 9. It leads through the pine forests typical of the region above the vineyards with a great view all the way to the Mediterranean Sea.

title: Heerweg / Ox Trail through North Jutland - North Stage
short_description: In the original, the Heerweg / Ox Trail starts in Fredrikshavn, In this version, the first stage starts from the northernmost point of Denmark and goes to Hobro.
long_description:
The Heerweg is a historical route that has served a variety of purposes over the centuries. The military could move quickly from north to south on it, oxen were driven from Viborg to the ox market in Wedel near Hamburg and pilgrims used the route in a northerly direction on their way to Nidaros in Norway and in a southerly direction to Rome.
Today the Heerweg, Hærvejen is a well-developed long-distance cycle route and part of Eurovelo 3.
The first stage starts in Skagen, where the North Sea and Baltic Sea meet. This is the northernmost point in Denmark. To get used to it, you cycle the first 40 km to Fredrikshavn, where the Heerweg officially begins.
For 210 km, the Heerweg continues south past Aalborg, Denmark's fourth largest city, to Hobro at the end of the Mariagerfjord.
With arrival and departure and sights along the way, you can plan a good week for this first stage of the long-distance cycle route Heerweg.

images.caption: Nordjütland ist für Radfahrer sehr abwechslungsreich
Grenen, the northernmost point of Denmark early in the morning

title: A trip to Grawafall
short_description: A relatively short and easy hiking route with a great view in the Stubai Valley (South Tyrol) that reaches several viewpoints on the formidable Grawa Falls
long_description:
This itinerary is one-way and will lead you to a number of viewpoints on the Grawa waterfall, which is considered one of the largest and most impressive in the Tyrol region. It is a waterfall with a 85-meter-wide solid structure, due to its natural structure, the water flows from it in a way that resembles stairs, and this from a height of more than 120 meters!
There you can enjoy a number of observation points on the waterfall, so for example within a few minutes of walking you can reach the first observation point in the form of a wide balcony with luxurious reclining benches from which you can enjoy a special angle observation of the waterfall.
It is recommended to visit the place especially around the month of July, since during this period the flow of water in the waterfall is especially abundant and powerful due to the snow that melts and feeds it. An excursion route recommended for those who love water as well as for those who wish to enjoy a formidable view within a short walking distance.

images.caption: The restaurant in the Garva cabin
A view from above of the parking lot and the restaurant in the Garve cabin
One of the top views of Garva waterfall

title: Näfelserberg
long_description: Those who like long and extensive snow-shoeing tours in a lonely winter landscape will not miss out here. From the Obersee car park to Stafelbrücke and up via Änziunen to Näfelserberg. From there you have a wonderful view over the Glarus mountains. Down to Twing and via Lochegg to Oberurnen.

short_description: Gorgeous mountain tour über the ridge from the Jöchelspitze to the Ramstallspitze

Looking back to Strahlkopf and Nordeck (right)
Looking back at the ridge crossed
View into the snow flank north of Piz Beverin
At the alpine hut of Closiras

title: Circular hike with magnificent panorama near Ofterschwang
short_description: A beautiful circular hike without any notable climbs via the small district of Wielenberg and the Wittelsbacher Höhe near Schweineberg with wonderful panoramic views of the Allgäu mountains.
long_description: The varied tour leads across meadows and through forests and always offers a magnificent view of the Allgäu mountains. It is definitely worth climbing the small hill and vantage point "Wittelsbacher Höhe". The family-friendly circular route can be extended as desired. There are also refreshment stops along the way.

images.caption: Hiking in the Allgäu: circular hike with a magnificent panorama near Ofterschwang

title: Landslide experience
short_description: On this hike with its great views, you will get a good overview of the departure of the great Flims landslide and of the landslide masses and their deposition area.
long_description:
The water systems are at least as exciting: Further down, the Segnesbach is called Flembach. It meanders through meadows and forests and through the Stennatobel. Below Flims village it has found a path between the rock of the Flimserstein and the landslide mass. At point 1245 a water conduit branches off, which once served to irrigate the meadows of Conn. Further down, the Drausbach is called Laaxerbach. It is used to generate electricity. The outflow is also collected from Lag Tiert, the headwaters of a wide karst lake. Lag Prau Pult is connected to Lag Tiert underground. In spring, when the water level of the karst lake is high enough, it is filled. Its outflow is as an overflow into the Pultébach and underground, to feed the Lag Prau Tuleritg and ultimately Lake Cauma.

The hike leads from Foppa through the Uaul Steina with Erika-Föhrenwald on landslide mass to the Segnesbach and to the Maiensäss Muletg. At Ault la Runca, a small sinkhole can be seen between the pioneer-like forest cover. Continue to Runcahöhe, where the bend in the path offers a fantastic view of the erosion forms of the Drausbach. Via Runca Sura we reach the Uaul Runca, the sedimentation area of the landslide with a coarse blocky surface. Lag Prau Pulté can be circumnavigated on a comfortable path. In winter, this lake is completely dry. In sections you meet the Pulté stream until you reach the cantonal road above the campsite. From there it is only a few minutes to the Flims Waldhaus post office.

title: Les Bois - La Ferrière
short_description: This hike offers a wonderful panorama of the Doubs valley.
long_description: It goes from Les Bois to Biaufond and through the gorge of Biaufond to La Ferrière.

title: About the Pont des Anabaptistes
short_description:
Auf dieser Wanderung können wir nicht nur die Weiten des Juras geniessen sondern uns auch bei den verschiedenen Berggasthäusern kulinarisch verwöhnen lassen.
Translate to English
long_description:
On this hike, we can not only enjoy the vastness of the Jura but also indulge in the culinary delights of the various mountain inns. From the Place centrale, we head straight for the Pont des Anabaptistes (Anabaptist Bridge) where various panels give us an insight into its history. Up to la Cuisinière we hike briefly through the forest and across a pasture. From here, follow the signs to Petite Douanne. A short stretch on hard surface follows. Then we walk uphill along a dirt road, over pastures and through forest past Le Pletz to Petite Douanne. We tackle another climb until we reach the Métairie du Milieu de Bienne. Downhill over pastures and through forest we reach Hacki. There is another short ascent to Clédar de Pierrefeu until we are back at the starting point.

Note(s)
Arrival: The best way is by car via Biel-Frinvillier-Les Prés-d'Orvin-Métairie de Prêles to the car park at the Place centrale (central square).

title: Panoramic circular hiking trail
short_description: Scenic hike starts at Courtételle railway station.
long_description: We walk through the forest of Combe-Aléry to the mountain restaurant Chez les Pic. We then follow the path along the edge of the pasture to the Pic forest, then up through some rocky areas to the ridge until we reach the Derrière le Château. We go up a little more until we reach the hut on the Haut du Droit. Now we tackle the descent, past the Futchies mountain restaurant. Through the gorge we return to the starting point.

title: 33.07 St.Moritz - Osp. Bernina, Via Albula/Bernina
long_description:
The hiking trail along the Rhaetian Railway's UNESCO World Heritage route runs as close as possible to the Albula and Bernina line and repeatedly offers enchanting views of a more than 100-year-old synthesis of the arts in a magnificent Alpine landscape.

Through moorland and alpine pastures to the Bernina Pass. Highlight follows highlight. Stazerwald, Pontresina, Morteratsch glacier world, Lago Bianco-Lej Nair watershed and the highest mountains in Graubünden.

Note(s)
Beware: snowfields are possible on high-altitude sections until the summer months.

title: 33.05 Preda - Spinas, Via Albula/Bernina
short_description: The hiking trail along the UNESCO World Heritage route of the Rhätische Bahn runs as close as possible to the Albula and Bernina line and offers enchanting views of a 100-year-old work of art in a magnificent Alpine landscape.

images.caption: Albula Railway Experience Trail © Rhätische Bahn

title: From Bellelay to Tramelan
short_description: Easy hike from Bellelay to Tramelan.
long_description: From Bellelay, a village on the edge of the Franches-Montagnes, you walk towards the moorland of La Sagne. On the other side, at the foot of the steep forest flank of Montbautier, you head towards Les Genevez. The path then climbs gently up to the Prés de la Montagne. We then reach Tramelan. On the entire tour, we hike along artistic dry stone walls several times.

images.caption: Maison de la Tête du Moine.

title: Tramelan - Cortébert
short_description: Hiking trail from Tamelan to Cortébert.
long_description: From Tramelan, the path goes straight uphill. We hike across fields and through dense forest parcels, gaining more and more altitude, until we reach the Bise de Cortébert farm. We then reach the highest point of the tour. A path leads us through the Côte du Droit forest flank down to Courtelary. We then hike along the Suze until we reach our destination, Cortébert.

images.caption: The Combe Grède from the Chasseral

title: Mettembert - Delémont
short_description: Through a wild forest gorge to La Haute de Borne.
long_description: We start in the smallest municipality in the canton of Jura, Mettembert. We first hike down to the stream. Then we follow the stream up into the Combe du Vivier, a rather wild forest gorge. The highest point of the tour is La Haute de Borne, where a long rest is recommended. Afterwards, we follow the path down to Delémont.

title: From Glovelier to St-Ursanne
short_description:
Die Wanderung führt von Govelier hinauf in die Combe du Bé und weiter durch eine wunderschöne Naturwelt.
Translate to English
long_description: From Govelier we hike up to the Combe du Bé where a beautiful natural world awaits us. We gain height on a pleasant incline and hike along the stream for a while. We leave the Combe and continue towards Le Bosnire. Through the forest, it's first a steep descent, then flatter again out onto the open pastureland. We pass the hamlets of Montmelon and continue our hike along the Doubs to St-Ursanne.

title: Bohusleden - Stage 12 - Kaserna to Svarteborg
short_description: The second stage of Bohusleden leads from Kaserna along the rivers Munkedalsälven and Örekilsälven to Svarteborg.
long_description: The landscape of southern Sweden is incredibly rich in rivers and lakes. On this stage we experience nature at its best. We walk along two rivers and small ponds that provide a habitat for many beavers and salmon. Then the trail leads through easy terrain in the Harska nature reserve, past prehistoric stone circles and burial sites.

images.caption: View over a southern Swedish lake

title: At the Etang de la Gruère
In the heart of the Franches-Montagnes
short_description: Leisurely circular hike on the Jurah henweg. Across meadows, fields and through forests on the Freiberg Plain;
long_description: Our hike begins in Le Noirmont. We go up through the village. Once at the top, you take the Jurassic path and pass the Saigne aux Femmes farm. Continue straight on into the area of Sous les Craux. The path continues through an unspoilt landscape - the home of the Freiberger horses. After an up and down, you reach the Chez Chailat farm. On a well-marked path, past the hamlet of Le Boéchet, across meadows and fields, you hike back to the starting point.

images.caption: Some cow pastures have to be crossed
Mostly the tour leads without big ups and downs over wide nature paths.
There are plenty of rest areas along the tour

title: Over Mont Soleil to Les Breuleux
short_description: Hike from St. Imier to Les Breuleux. Ascent in St. Imier by train.
long_description: We start our tour at St-Imier station and walk towards the valley station of the funicular railway. With the cable car we climb the first few metres up to Mont-Soleil. This is where our actual hike begins. Past the solar power station we hike uphill to the highest point of the tour. After that, it's all downhill across pastures and through forests to Les Breuleux.

title: Les Bois - Le Noirmont
short_description: Hike on the ridge from Les Bois to Le Noimont
long_description: This pleasant hike takes us from Le Bois towards Sur la Croix. We walk through woodland, along the edge of the forest and over open hills. At Les Barrières we walk along dry stone walls and enjoy the view again and again until we reach our destination Le Noirmont.

title: Rando de la pointe de Congrigoux à Saint Marc sur Mer
short_description:
Belle randonnée aller-retour sur le chemin côtier des douaniers, pour tous niveaux, avec une vue magnifique sur la mer, les pêcheries, les criques et les plages.
Translate to English
long_description:
Le parcours suit le tracé du GR34. Il se fait facilement en famille et permet d’avoir une belle vue sur la mer en longeant la côte. Ce chemin est beau en toute saison, offrant une variété de paysages et d’ambiances lumineuses sur la mer. Il ravira notamment les photographes. Les nombreuses plages et criques traversées invitent à faire de belles pauses pour une baignade ou un pique-nique.
Il y a de nombreuses possibilités de parking au départ à proximité de la Pointe de Congrigoux dont un parking avec bornes de recharge pour voiture électrique juste en face du bar La Caravelle situé au 21 Av. du Littoral à Pornichet.
À cet endroit, il y a aussi une petite boulangerie, une pharmacie et même une petite supérette “Le Relais des Mousquetaires” située au 24 Av. de Villes Babin, Pornichet. C’est très pratique si on veut y acheter de quoi faire un pique-nique.
L’arrivée se fait à la célèbre plage de M. Hulot à Saint Marc sur Mer où il y a de nombreuses possibilités de restauration.
Translate to English

title: From Delémont to the Col des Rangiers
short_description: A beautiful and technically easy but physically demanding tour in the hilly Jura mountains from Deléacute Mont to the Col des Rangiers in the tranquil town of St. Ursanne.
long_description: We start right away with the biggest part of the climb and hike from Delémont towards La Haute Borne. After that, it's practically straight ahead on mainly hard surface. We leave the road and hike first up, then down to the Col des Rangiers. Via La Caquerelle and Le Malrang we reach St-Ursanne.

title: Small round trip
short_description: A panoramic round trip from a moorland lake to a hamlet and over the Cerneux Belin ridge;
long_description: A pleasant little round trip with hardly noticeable ascents and descents. We start in Les Cerlatez and walk to the farm La Petite Theurre. Shortly along the moorland lake Etang de la Gruère, we reach the hamlet of La Theurre. Our walk continues to a slight ridge near Cerneux Belin where we can enjoy a beautiful view of the village of Les Cerlatez, which is also our destination.

title: Round trip over the Col des Rangiers

images.caption: Bahnlinie Chemin de fer du Jura.

title: Jura Trail: Delémont - Moutier
short_description: Hike from Delémont to Moutier.
long_description: For this hike you need a lot of stamina and endurance. A beautiful tour with great panoramas and a historic trail. It takes us from Delémont üvia Mont Raimeux to Moutier.

images.caption: View of the Alps from Raimeux de Grandval

title: Climbing Trail in the Chapada dos Veadeiros
short_description: The Saltos Trail is one of the most stunning routes in the Chapada dos Veadeiros National Park.
long_description: This trail runs along the banks of Preto River and presents adventurers with impressive waterfalls of up to 120 meters high. The trail starts at the Tourist Service Centre, near the entrance to the Chapada dos Veadeiros National Park, in Alto Paraíacute;so de Goiás, but precisely on the outskirts of the village of São Jorge. The trail is well signposted with yellow arrows and it is not necessary to hire a guide. The number of visitors on the Trail is restricted, so start early and avoid holidays and weekends. Remember to bring cash, as access to all of PARNA's trails costs R$ 18 per person.

images.caption: Trilha dos Saltos na Chapada dos Veadeiros, Goiás - Brasil
Trilha dos Saltos na Chapada dos Veadeiros, Goiás - Brasil
Parque Nacional da Chapada dos Veadeiros, Goiás - Brasil
Salto de 120m na Chapada dos Veadeiros, Goiás - Brasil
Trilha dos Saltos na Chapada dos Veadeiros, Goiás - Brasil
Salto de 80m na Chapada dos Veadeiros, Goiás - Brasil
Trilha dos Saltos na Chapada dos Veadeiros, Goiás - Brasil
Trilha dos Saltos na Chapada dos Veadeiros, Goiás - Brasil
Corredeiras na Chapada dos Veadeiros, Goiás - Brasil

title: Jura Trail: Sonceboz - Biel
short_description:
Eine schöne Tour entlang der Suze.
Translate to English

title: Hiking up to the Rumer Alm - Starting in the village of Rum
short_description: This relaxing Rout leads along beautiful forest paths to the Rumer Alm and offers a breathtaking view over the Intaal and the city of Innsbruck.
long_description:
The hike to the Rumer Alm is an absolutely recommended destination in snow-free months. In about an hour you have left the hustle and bustle of the city behind and can enjoy the view over the Intal and Innsbruck with delicious Tyrolean food.
Our tour starts in the village of Rum and leads at the beginning through a branched deciduous forest. After half an hour we reach the wide main forest path, which takes us to the Rumer Alm after another 30 minutes. Be sure to order one of the Tyrolean specialties here, such as Kaspress Knödel, and then enjoy the sun from the hill with a full belly!
On the way back you can walk on forest paths as well as on the main path back down to the parking lot.

images.caption: Wanderung zur Rumer Alm - Start in Rum

title: The Mont Girod
short_description: It is a varied round in the heart of the Faltenjura.
long_description: We start at the station in Moutier. Initially, the trail runs along the road, then branches off onto the hiking trail. We climb up to the farm of Petit Champoz. Then we follow the path up through the forest to the viewpoint «Point de vue» on Mont Girod. A fantastic view of Moutier awaits us. We descend to the Joux fork and follow the path westwards across pastures of the Pâturage de Mont Girod. Passing the Mont Girod farm, we reach Lac Vert via steps and pastures. Through the forest and up some steps, we follow a forest path that descends steeply until we reach the entrance of the gorge. The impressive gorge path through the Gorges de Court leads through a tunnel and over footbridges. Soon we are back at our destination in Moutier.

title: From Schwarzenburg via Guggershorn to Zollhaus
Eggelsberg glacier rim trail
short_description: A landscape formed by the glacier and stones that come from the Hohe Tauern. A voyage of discovery üover the national border around Eggelsberg.
long_description: It is hard to believe that the Salzach glacier almost filled the Salzburg basin to the summit of the Gaisberg and was a good two hundred metres thick at the height of the Bavarian border town of Tittmoning. The end moraines that characterise the landscape around Eggelsberg were also deposited by the Salzach glacier at the height of the last ice age. The hike along the Gletscherrandweg (Glacier Edge Trail) is a very special experience and describes a circuit through a landscape with a diverse wealth of forms and shows the traces left behind by the thrust of the outgoing glacier.

images.caption: Some erratic blocks were transported from the Hohe Tauern mountains to the Innviertel region

title: Along the Blackwater and the Sense
long_description:
From Schwarzenburg you first go down towards Grasburg. A stairway takes you up to the outer castle and on to the main castle. A metal ladder leads up about 700 m into the Hohenstaufen Imperial Castle and then down onto a path that is not marked on the map. Again you descend steeply via stairs. After the rock gate, take the better path southwards around the castle rock and up to the picnic area. It goes down on a narrow path to the Harrissteg. Cross the bridge and descend to the stony bank. Now you ford the Sense for about 1.5 km until you reach the bridge of Ruchmühle on the left bank. Cross the bridge and keep left. Now you "water-walk" again for about 2 km. On the right bank you meet a path that leads to the confluence with the Schwarzwasser, where you pass under the suspension bridge. You wade through the water for the last time to save yourself the long diversions to the bridge in the Schwarzwasser ditch. Then it's along the right bank of the Sense on the hiking trail past the buffalo rock to Thörishaus.

Note(s)
Recommended in summer and in good weather conditions as you wade through the river bed. There may be closures in the Sensegraben during the bird nesting season.

title: Choleren Gorge
long_description:
The starting and end points are Thun. First the trail leads along the Aare to Hünibach on Lake Thun. Then you leave the lakeshore and follow the Hünibach up through the picturesque Choleren Gorge with its waterfalls. The first destination is then the Rabenflue with its beautiful viewpoint. The trail now descends somewhat more steeply to Jakobshübeli and back to the destination of Thun.

Note(s)
Partially T2 spots

title: View of the Ravenna Bridge (Ravennabrücke)
short_description: A short and easy hiking route that leads within a few minutes' walk to an impressive view point on the Rowan railway bridge near the Rowan gorge in the Black Forest (High)
long_description:
This hiking route includes a short and relatively moderate ascent that leads to a panoramic view point on the Raven railway bridge as well as the valley and the surrounding mountains. The relatively short walk on this route will lead you to a high point and a good view of the area. It is possible to combine the walk on this route as an addition to the walk with Ravon Channel .
This route is not shaded and due to its nature it is not suitable for walking with strollers, but due to its length even young children can manage to walk it on foot.
** Due to the fact that the route is linear, the walking time as well as the distance shown are for one direction only.

images.caption: From here the ascent to the observation deck begins

title: In the Chasseral Nature Park
short_description: A popular hike in the Chasseral Nature Park.
long_description: From the Hotel Chasseral, we follow the ridge in a southerly direction. We hike gently up and down through rocky terrain, then descend somewhat more steeply down a pasture to the Métairie de l'Ile. From here we hike down the alpine path and then rejoin the Jura ridge path and follow it to the alpine farm of Chuffort. Then we leave the ridge path and hike in the direction of Clémensin. Pass the striking house with bell tower and turn right onto the field path. At the next fork, take the left-hand path and you will reach the entrance to Combe Biosse. There is a steep ascent through the stony gorge, then a moderate climb along the ditch through pastures back to the starting point.

title: Saignelégier
short_description:
Konditionell fordernde, aber aussichtsreiche Tour auf dem Jura-Höhenweg, mit Sicht auf die beschauliche Felskette Sommêtres. 
Translate to English
long_description:
In Saignelégier beginnt die Wanderung dem gelb-rot markierten Jura-Höhenweg entlang bis zum Bahnhof von Muriaux. Weiter geht es stetig hinauf bis zum Aussichtspunkt Rochers des Sommêtres. Danach verlässt man den Höhenweg und steigt steil hinab durch Wald parallel zum Grat von Sommêtres. Bis zur idyllisch gelegenen ehemaligen Mühle Le Theusseret, folgt nochmals ein kräftiger Steilabstieg. Auf einem flachen Weg immer dem Lauf des Wassers folgend, gelangt man nun nach Goumois. Hier steigt der Weg nochmals an, bis es dann über Weiden wieder zurück nach Saignelégier geht.

Translate to English

images.caption: Der Felskamm Les Sommêtres. Ein Paradies für Kletterer und eine Augenweide für jeden Wanderer
In Luftiger Höhe - Sicht auf den Doubs
Schöne Wasserläufe in der Nähe des Restaurants Le Theusseret
Wild und majestätisch. Der Fluss Doubs

title: Gorge of the Tabeillon
short_description: Hike through the romantic gorge of the Tabeillon
long_description: We start in Saulcy and follow the road briefly, but then take the footpath. Through fields and meadows we reach the Sur les Roches farm. Then we descend to La Combe. We continue along the railway tracks through the romantic gorge of the Tabeillon. Past the Etang de Bollement, we follow the path along the stream to Combe Tabeillon. Here we cross the stream and hike steeply uphill back to the starting point.

title: Between Switzerland and France
short_description:
Schöne abwechslungsreiche Rundwanderung am Grenzfluss Doubs entlang. Die Tour startet und endet in der Schweiz, in Biaufond. Die Wanderung verläuft aber grösstenteils in Frankreich.
Translate to English
long_description:
Beautiful, varied circular hike along the border river Doubs. The tour starts and ends in Switzerland, in Biaufond. However, most of the hike is in France. First we follow the narrow path along the river bank to the Barrage du Refrain dam. Passing the power station, we come to the start of the via ferrata and the so-called "death ladders". We quickly gain height on the zigzag path in the forest and then climb the steep cliffs of the Doubs via two long iron ladders. A dreamlike view awaits us. Behind the clearing of Les Côtes, we hike on a wide forest path to the high plateau. We reach the road that leads us to the car park of La Cendrée. We follow the unmarked tracks that lead us to the Belvédère Sur les Roches, a magnificent viewpoint. We then continue along the path to Fournet. There is a short stretch on the road to Blancheroche and then we take the hiking trail to La Rasse, down to the Doubs. Along the riverbank we'll return to Switzerland.

Note(s)
In wet conditions, the ladders can be slippery.
Take your identity card with you.

title: Round trip in the Ajoie region
short_description: Panoramic, leisurely circular tour along the Doubs. From the Goths of Réclère üover the border into France along the banks of the Doubs back into Switzerland.
long_description: We start at the caves of Réclère. Following the road, we cross the border and descend through the forest to the French town of Vaufrey on the banks of the Doubs. As far as the village of Glère, we hike along the marked east bank path. Then there is an ascent via the hamlets of Vernois and Le Fol. We return to Switzerland and reach the Faux d'Enson lookout tower. At the top, we enjoy a beautiful panorama. Through the forest we follow the path back to the caves of Réclère.

title: Golden Sands of Issyk Kul, Ferris Wheel 72 m - Bosteri
short_description: Sandy beaches, a rollercoaster, the country's tallest 72m high «Devil's Wheel» a boat station, camels, delicious traditional food – all this is about Bosteri, the village resort at Issyk Kul.

images.caption: Bosteri is the most popular beach in Issyk Kul
Lake Issyk Kul - the pearl of Kyrgyzstan
A traditional form of entertainment on the sands of Issyk Kul
Issyk-Kul beach against the background of the Kungei Alatau ridge

title: त्रिंगलवाड़ी किला ट्रैक
short_description: नाशिक ज़िले के इगत पुरी शहर से कुछ दूर स्थित त्रिंगलवा़ी किला 10वी शताब्दी का एक प्रा चीन किला है जो हाईकिंग और ट्रैकिंग के लिए बेहद लोकप्रिय है ।
long_description:
त्रिंगलवाड़ी किला नासिक जिले के इगतपुरी तालुक में त्रिंगलवाड़ी गांव से करीब तीन किलोमीटर दूर स्थित है। यह किला इस इलाके में मौजूद कई किलों में से एक है, जो थाल घाट से गुजरने वाले प्राचीन 'कोंकण-नासिक व्यापार मार्ग' की रक्षा के लिए बनाया गया था।
त्रिंगलवाड़ी किले की ट्रेल आसान और सरल है इसलिए यह ट्रैक सभी के लिए बढ़िया है। किले में जाने वाली सीढ़ियाँ थोड़ी खड़ी चढाई वाली हैं। ट्रेल से हर समय किला दिखाई देता है इसलिए रास्ते साइनपोस्ट की कोई ज़रूरत ही नहीं पड़ती है। ट्रेल पर एक छोटा तालाब भी है। किले से शानदार सहयाद्रि पर्वत श्रृंखला, इगतपुरी शहर, और भव्य कलसुबाई चोटी के पैनोरामिक दृश्य दिखाई देते है।
किले पर कैंपिंग, तम्बू लगाने और रात गुजरने की अनुमति है, हालांकि आसपास कोई रेस्तरां या दुकानें नहीं हैं, इसलिए सलाह दी जाती है कि अगर रात बिताने की योजना हो तो आते समय इगतपुरी से ही सारा जरूरी सामान ले कर आएं।

images.caption: त्रिंगालडी किले का पैनोरमिक दृश्य, इगतपुरी, नासिक जिला, महाराष्ट्र, भारत।
त्रिंगलवाड़ी किले की ट्रेल के करीब मौजूद एक खूबसूरत तालाब, इगतपुरी, नासिक जिला, महाराष्ट्र, भारत।
नासिक जिले के इगतपुरी शहर के त्रिंगलवाड़ी किले के रास्ते में जैन गुफाएँ, महाराष्ट्र, भारत।
इगतपुरी शहर में त्रिंगलवाड़ी किले की सुन्दर हरीभरी ट्रेल, नासिक जिला, महाराष्ट्र, भारत।
त्रिंगलवाड़ी ट्रेल पर एक छोटा मंदिर और उसके पीछे हाइकर्स, इगतपुरी, नासिक जिला, महाराष्ट्र, भारत।
त्रिंगलवाड़ी किले के कोंकण दरवाजा, इगतपुरी शहर, नासिक जिला, महाराष्ट्र, भारत।
भारत में पदयात्रा मार्ग: त्रिंगलवाड़ी किला ट्रैक

title: From the Passion Play location Erl to the Kranzhorn
short_description: We enjoy a varied mountain tour to a magnificent panoramic peak. On the way, you can enjoy a leisurely stop at the Kranzhorn refuge. The view stretches from the Schliersee mountains over the Chimgau Alps and the Lower Inn Valley far into the Zillertal Alps.
long_description:
Passion plays have existed in Tyrol since the Middle Ages. In Erl they have been performed since 1613, today every 6 years. Between 1957 and 1959 a new Passion Playhouse was built because the old one had burnt down. Because of the good acoustics, the Tyrolean Festival has also been held there for some years.
  The Kranzhorn refuge is about 15 minutes' walk below the summit. Hikers are well and abundantly provided with food and drinks there. There is a small playground for children and rabbits can be seen in a cage. The mountain pasture also offers overnight accommodation. However, registration is required here.
The Buchenau is a romantic old mountain pasture that we pass on the way down. Here you could think that time has stood still. This mood is further enhanced by the stone enclosures of the willows.

images.caption: View from the Granzhorn to the Zahmen and Wilder Kaiser.
View from the forest road towards Kranzhorn.

title: A trip to the Ponte Tibetano Carasc
short_description: A pleasant one-way hiking route leading to a large and impressive suspension bridge in the province/canton of Ticino in Switzerland
long_description:
This hiking route passes through a wooded area and reaches its peak at a long suspension bridge which you can cross with fun and enjoy a gorgeous and panoramic view towards the wooded valley over which the bridge passes. Also, on both sides of the bridge there are historical points of interest that you can admire. On the other side of the bridge there is a fountain with water that can be filled in bottles.
The route itself offers relatively favorable terrain conditions, but nevertheless due to the nature of the route and its width, it is in principle not suitable for walking with strollers.
Walking on the bridge is free, that is, it does not involve any payment.

Signage through the guide to the suspension bridge

title: Hierapolis Ancient City Walking
short_description: Alternative walking route in the ancient city of Hierapolis, right next to Denizli's beautiful Pamukkale Travertines
long_description:
The ancient city of Hierapolis, along with Pamukkale Travertines of Denizli, is a historical location that is often wondered and visited a lot. Every year thousands of local and foreign tourists come here to discover the natural and historical beauty of the region.
This short walking route offers an alternative route within the UNESCO World Heritage Site of Hierapolis. Starting from the car park, the route first allows you to experience the magnificent view of the Hierapolis Theatre. Afterwards, you go up to the Agora and continue on the route from the side where the Hierapolis Museum is located. This route, which can be an alternative for those who want to visit the ancient city, ends at the car park again. 
This natural, historical and cultural böltürel bölge is one of the must-visit places in Denizli together with Pamukkale Travertines.

title: Royal Road
short_description: An excellent playground to prepare for races (10km, half and marathon)
long_description:
This course in the forest is mainly on road. Very popular at weekends with people from the Ile-de-France looking for greenery, it allows you to work on your splits with some nice straight lines that serve as a reference point. The course runs along the A13 motorway between Saint Nom la Bret and Feucherolles. Most of the course is flat. However, after passing under the motorway, you come across a section that offers a few levels that allow you to work on your heart rate.
Please note that the course is very easy to ride.
>
The entire course is closed to motorised vehicles. To enjoy the peace and quiet and to avoid the crowds, choose the morning between 7 and 9 am, especially on weekends.

title: Easy walk on Dealul Melcilor (Snails Hill) on an autumn day
short_description: Though many people avoid Dealul Melcilor (Snails Hill) in Brașov because of garbage heaps or dogs, with a little luck, the place offers beautiful panoramas, walking possibilities, and an MTB pump track.
long_description:
A walk on this hill and in the forest at the top is just the right stretching dose you might need on an afternoon. The ascent is easy, there are many paths, and the convenient location between the city center and the Răcădău neighborhood makes it accessible from several directions. In addition, Dealul Melcilor can be climbed by children and is perfect for a walk with the dog.
We started from the Răcădău neighborhood, at the foot of the hill, near one of the water tanks. After admiring the city center and the Tâmpa peak, we continued on the path that walks on the edge of the former stone quarry. The process of natural regeneration is very visible.
Another group of water tanks appeared in front of us, but we took a path to the left quickly arriving at the pump track on the plateau. Here, MTB enthusiasts sometimes come for training. Now, however, it seemed that the route has been abandoned. We descended easily right at the back of the Civic neighborhood, near some barbecue places frequented by noisy teenagers.
Considering the testimonies on the internet, I was probably lucky on this walk - instead of dogs and garbage, I came across lots of autumn flowers, romantic paths full of leaves, and a lot of tranquility. Dealul Melcilor can turn out as a pleasant surprise, despite its troubled history.

title: Loop to the Mazamet footbridge via Hautpoul and Labrespy
short_description: A lovely loop that follows forest paths through chestnut trees, over the factory road and the Arnette valley, before reaching the beautiful medieval village of Hautpoul and of course crossing the void on the now famous Mazamet footbridge.

title: Seekofelhütte
short_description: Hike from the Pederühütte to the Seekofelhütte
long_description: Beautiful hike in the Fanes-Sennes-Prags Nature Park from the Pederühütte hut near San Vigilio di Marebbe to the Seekofelhütte hut.  The Seekofelhütte hut offers a fabulous view of the Fanes-Sennes-Prags area.

title: Circuit hike to Amfiteatrul Transilvania hotel& restaurant
short_description: The route follows one of the eco-tourist routes marked by an NGO in the Bran-Moieciu area and offers not only panoramic views but also a very human perspective of the places.
long_description:
The Bran-Moieciu area is recognized locally and widely promoted internationally as one of the most picturesque in Romania. In order to discover it in depth, you have to explore more than just the places close to the main road.
The route to the Amfiteatrul Transilvania (Transilvania Amphitheater) takes you to a local landmark for weekend tourism. Fortunately, you only reach it toward the end.  The rest of the route carries you through the truly idyllic landscape above the village of Moieciu, dominated by traditional households, haystacks, and summer cottages, and maybe even facilitates your meeting with a herd of sheep.
You cross Poiana Andolia, with large meadows that are very important for the area's ecosystem. At the end of a deciduous forest, the view opens towards the Piatra Craiului Mountains.
After a short descent into the Grădiștei Gorges, follows a sustained climb that takes you back to the peaceful landscape of the Transylvanian mountain villages.
Catch your breath and enjoy the view at the Transilvania Amphitheater, but keep in mind that reservations are required for the restaurant.

title: Mine Road Hike
short_description: A short hike up an old mining road in scenic red rock and forested terrain. This hike is relatively unknown, never crowded and offers the opportunity to continue for a longer hike.

title: Zugspitze - Germany's number one mountain! The Alps of Bavaria.
short_description: Zugspitze is not only the highest mountain in Germany, it is also the most popular. It only takes a day to climb it, half a day to run up it, and the ascent by cable car takes 4 minutes.
long_description:
There are many trails leading to the Zugspitze from various countries: Austria and Germany. Our hike starts at the famous ski resort in southern Germany, Garmisch-Partenkirchen.
.
Classic route through the Reinthal valley. The longest trail, but also the safest.

There is the Münchner Haus (2959m) at the top. Of course also lifts, a café, a restaurant and plenty of surrounding lookouts in mesmerising different shades of views.

title: Nagatoro Iwadatami round-the-clock course
short_description: A hiking course to enjoy the gentle flow of Nagatoro, the surrounding nature, the rocky cliffs in the area, which is also known as the birthplace of Japanese geology, and the steam locomotives of the Chichibu Railway.
long_description:
The Nagatoro area is made up of crystalline schist, which was formed by volcanic ejecta, mud and sand deposited on the seabed and taken deep underground with the plate around 80 million years ago and subjected to enormous pressure. The rock terrace is 80 m wide from east to west and 500 m long from north to south, and is a fluvial terrace formed by the erosion of the Ara River, which eroded the rock crystal schist, which is easily peeled off like a thin pie crust. The rocks have been broken up by fault movement, leaving the bedrock bare. The rock wall on the opposite bank, which remained uneroded, has become red due to oxidation caused by the iron in the black schist seeping through, and is known as the Chichibu Red Wall, after the Red Wall carved by the Yangtze River in China.
The Nagatoro rock pavement spreads out immediately after Nagatoro Station. The course continues north from there along Kita Sakura Dori (North Cherry Blossom Street). This street becomes a tunnel of cherry blossoms in spring. The Kinseki Water Pipe Bridge next to the auto campsite offers a panoramic view of the Nagatoro river. After crossing the bridge, walk south along the river into Nagatoro Shizen no michi, a path lined with trees. Continue along the road and turn onto Shimotano-dori Street, where you will see the Nagatoro Line Rafting A course boat boarding area. Cross the bridge and enter the footpath over the rock pavement from Sakura-minami-dori. Nagatoro stream can be seen on the right and after passing through the Moonstone Maple Park, you will come out in front of Nagatoro Station.

title: Limes Hiking Trail Westerwald
short_description: The approximately 70 km long Limes hiking trail from Rheinbrohl through the Westerwald to Bad Ems traces the footsteps of the Romans along reconstructed Limes watchtowers, forts, fortifications, ditches and ruins of Roman baths

images.caption: The Kurhaus Bad Ems is located directly on the Lahn and the casino is right next to it.

title: Walking route Lunteren
short_description: During this walking route, you will walk past the centre of the Netherlands. This walking route takes about 2.5 hours.
long_description: First of all, you walk through the old Luntersche neighbourhood forest. This forest is centuries old and is well maintained. When you continue the route you will pass a museum with information on local history. This used to be a place where thieves were hanged. You also walk past the centre of the Netherlands during this route. A large stone marks this point. You will encounter all of the above while walking through a beautiful forest.

images.caption: The stone indicating the centre of the Netherlands
The stone indicating the centre of the Netherlands

title: Marins Peak Trail
short_description: As one of the most classic mountain trails in Brazil, the Pico dos Marins Trail offers an unforgettable adventure amidst the unique beauty of the Mantiqueira mountain range.
long_description:
As one of the classic routes in Brazilian mountaineering and a must for all who enjoy a good hike and adventure, the Marins Peak Trail is approximately six kilometres long and begins after 1,555 metres at base camp. Pico do Marins é the second highest peak in the state of São Paulo with 2422 meters of height and is á wedged in the Serra da Mantiqueira, right on the border between São Paulo and Minas Gerais, in the Paraíba Valley.
It is recommended that the adventure begins early in the morning with a 4-hour climb through the remnants of the high-altitude Atlantic Forest, passing by the Morro do Careca and the curious Pedra Equilibrada (Balanced Stone). During the climb, the landscape changes and the rocks become more and more visible. The walk é difficult, but  the resume of the summit  é a wonderful view of 360 degrees amid the clouds. The best time to climb é in autumn and winter, so we avoid the summer storms and the cooler air also helps during trekking.

title: Adventure Bus: From Gunzesried over the Bärenkopf
short_description: Wonderful, moderately difficult hike from Gunzesried üvia the Bärenkopf to Gunzesried Säge. Either as a sporty half-day tour, or a full day with a relaxed alpine stop.
long_description:
Start point of the tour: Gunzesried
Arrival times for pilot ride 1 of the Gunzesried adventure bus: 09:01 am & 11:17 am
End point of the tour: Gunzesried Säge
Departure times for pilot trip 1 of the Gunzesried Säge adventure bus: 12:43 & 15:30
  Note: This tour was developed for the pilot test within the project "Flexible Adventure Bus for Sustainable Leisure Transport (FEB-NAFV)". It is therefore tailored to the timetable and stops of the adventure bus, which is currently not yet öffentlich verkehrenden. If you are interested in participating in a future pilot project in general, please contact us via research@outdooractive.com.

images.caption: View from the Bärenkopf to the Steineberg.

title: Crossing Petrópolis - Teresópolis: Day 1
short_description: The crossing between the two mountain cities of Petrópolis and Teresópolis in Rio de Janeiro is one of the most famous in Brazil and is also considered one of the most beautiful;
long_description:
Included in the National Park of Serra dos Órgãos - PARNASO - the recommended duration of the Traverse é of 3 days, so that you can take greater advantage of its stunning landscapes. There is a total distance of 30 kilometres between the two sites, reaching an altitude of 2,275 metres.
The first day of the Traverse begins at the headquarters of the Park in Petrópolis and goes to the Açu Shelter, place for the first overnight stay. The walk is relatively short, approximately 8 kilometres, but due to the large altitude variation (1,145) it is the most difficult and demanding part of the walk.

title: Walk in the heart of Broceliande
short_description: A short one hour walk in the heart of the mythical Brocéliande forest, starting from Paimpont. A magical site to discover on a morning walk with the children.
long_description: The forest of Brocéliande: it is in this magnificent forest, between moors and lakes, that the legend of King Arthur takes its source. The only vocation of this place is to watch over a marvellous world populated by the fairy Viviane, Merlin the enchanter or the knight Lancelot.

images.caption: View of the pond and the Abbey of Paimpont
Grotto of Our Lady and the Judaicael Cross
Hiking in the Brocéliande forest in Ille-et-Vilaine

The Breton sausage biscuits at the end of the walk

title: Hiking trail: Notre Dame des Auzils Chapel
short_description: Built in 1080, the Chapel of Notre Dame des Auzils is, by its location and its history, one of the most surprising and solemn religious buildings in the Languedoc-Roussillon region;
long_description:
A MAGICAL AND OUT OF TIME PLACE
Facing the sea and serving as a bittersweet, this chapel has become over time the "property" of the fishermen of Gruissan. Inside, 73 ex-votos offered by the fishermen of Gruissan who came to thank the chapel for having saved them during great storms, show their attachment to this chapel.
It is a magical and timeless place with a plunging view of the Mediterranean, an exceptional place like nowhere else.
<Every Monday of the month, Chapel Notre Dame des Auzils opens its doors for a mass.

title: Trail to Lagoinha do Leste in Floripa
short_description: This trail will take you to one of the most beautiful places in Florianópolis, the deserted Lagoinha do Leste beach. Be amazed by its turquoise blue waters that blend perfectly with the green of the Atlantic Forest.
long_description: A Praia da Lagoinha do Leste é considered a wild beach, meaning that it has no infrastructure, which provides a more authentic contact with nature. Access is only possible by boat or on trails, as suggested here. Take the opportunity to walk along the beach, the lagoon and enjoy the place. The trail also passes by the beautiful natural viewpoint of Pico da Coroa. With impressive rock formations on its top, the peak attracts many visitors who face its steep climb to have one of the most beautiful views of Floripa.

images.caption: Trilha Praia da Lagoinha do Leste em Florianópolis, Santa Catarina - Brasil

Pico da Coroa em Florianópolis, Santa Catarina - Brasil

Praia da Lagoinha do Leste em Florianópolis, Santa Catarina - Brasil

title: Over the Buchenberg in the Sulzbach Hills
short_description: The scenically very varied hike takes us along small Bächen, through quiet forests and through pretty villages. The highlight is the easily accessible rocky path on the Buchenberg.
long_description:
The Sulzbacher Bergland is an enchanting landscape of hills. The small villages are nestled in meadows and fields between the wooded hills. In the woods there are numerous secluded hiking trails that invite you to take a stroll.
The Oedmühle is located in the Oed district of Weigendorf. It was first mentioned in a document in 1368. At times it served as a flour mill, linseed mill, grass loop and paint mill. In more recent times, the mill was also used as a sawmill and bronze hammer. Here, the saying " Soch, wos d' moanst, niat dass s moana, du moanast aa wos däi song" is painted on the asphalt in white letters.
Above the valley, between the Bäumen, lies the Luginsland Hiking Home of the BSW Foundation. 
The Buchenberg between Erkelsdorf and Ermhof initially appears to be a simple hill covered with beech forest. After a short climb, however, you reach the rock formations in the upper area. On the north side there are almost vertical rock faces that invite you to climb. The flat areas above the walls invite you to take an extended break.

images.caption: Saying on the asphalt at the Oedmühle.
At the edge of the forest near Ernhüll.
Across the fields between Ermhof and Neukirchen.
Between the rocks on the Buchenberg.

title: Crossing the Korab Mountains (5 Days)
short_description: Crossing the wild Korab Mountains, the Western Balkan's highest mountain massiv, from north to south on rarely used paths and age-old trails.
long_description: This trail partly follows the recently established High Scardus Trail, but offers a different starting point near the city of Kukes. This allows you to stay within Albania at all times. The hike itself requires fitness and good orientation skills, since the path is usually not marked and sometimes even disappears under the grass. Hillwalking skills and the ability to read a GPS are a must. If you do go, however, you will experience one of the wildest and most impressive landscapes in all of the Balkans - including a hike to the top of Mount Korab, Albania's highest peak.

images.caption: Over the alpine meadows of Grama
View from Mount Korab summit ridge
Sharri Mountains on the Albania-Kosovo border

title: Lake Lauvitel
short_description: A must if you are visiting Grenoble. The lake is reached by a pleasant walk through the Parc des Ecrins.
long_description:
The largest lake in the massif des Écrins is also an integral natural reserve at the bottom of the valley (totally untouched by human presence).
And don't forget that you are in the Parc National des Eacute;crins: don't leave the paths, don't pick flowers, don't swim, respect these gifts of nature!

images.caption: At the edge of the Lauvitel lake

title: Ultratrack Supramonte Seaside - BSS
short_description: Short route of the Ultratrack Supramonte Seaside, an outdoor event in the breathtaking landscape of the Supramonte of Baunei on the beautiful island of Sardinia.
long_description: Run on the paths of local shepherds and on old mule tracks overlooking the cliffs and discover one of the very few wilderness left in Europe.

title: From Mitzpe Goren to the Montfort fortress
short_description: A hiking route that starts at the Montfort observatory, passes through Nahal Kaziv and reaches the ruins of the Montfort fortress and back the same way.
long_description: A route that starts at a high point, goes down to Nahal Kasiv in the valley and goes up to the Montfort fortress. The road is rich in seasonal vegetation and trees. Large parts of the road are shaded and therefore comfortable and suitable for walking even on hot days. On the way you can watch the cows roaming freely in the area. The road is covered with soil and stones and occasionally requires walking on rocks.

images.caption: On the hiking trail you can discover free-roaming cows
On the way you can discover free-roaming cows

title: Ås til Åsleden - S Hultarp to Maglebjär
short_description: The sixth stage of the Ås til Åsledens goes from S Hultarp to Maglebjär.
long_description: Today's stage leads through a loose forest landscape, which is repeatedly interrupted by open fields. We pass the remains of small volcanoes to the small village of Haller, where we can visit an early sacrificial spring and the old pilgrimage chapel. At Vaxsjön Lake we can make a detour to the bird park.

title: Hike to Rainbow Falls
short_description: The Rainbow Falls, located in Nongriat village of Meghalaya, is a beautiful waterfall that can be reached by trekking from Tyrna village. The hiking route also includes several magnificent living root bridges.
long_description:
मेघालय के ईस्ट खासी हिल ज़िले के छोटे से तिरना गाँव से शुरू होने वाला यह ट्रैक रेनबो झरने पर जा कर ख़तम होता है। ट्रैक की शुरुआत नोंग्रियट गाँव में बने पार्किंग स्थल से होती है। यहाँ पर कुछ छोटी मोटी दुकानें और लोकल गाइड मिलते हैं। ट्रैक की शुरुआत में नीचे उतरने के लिए 3500 सीढ़ियां हैं !! करीब 1 किलोमीटर तक सीढ़ियों से उतरने के बाद एक छोटी पगडण्डी और पानी की धरा आती है जिस पर एक झूला पुल बना है। पुल पार करके 400 मीटर जाने पर दूसरा झूला पल आता है जो पहले वाले से ज्यादा मजबूत है। पुल पार करते ही नोंग्रियट गाँव की सीमा शुरू हो जाती है हालाँकि अभी यह सुपारी के पेड़ों वाला जंगल ही है। जंगल ख़त्म होने के बाद एक एक लिविंग रुट पुल आता है लेकिन यह प्रसिद्ध डबल डेकर लिविंग पुल नहीं है। इस पुल को पार करने पर गाँव के घर, खेत, और लोग दिखने लगते हैं। गाँव बहुत ही साफ़ और सुंदर है। इसमें कुछ बढ़िया होमस्टे हैं जो हाइकर्स के बीच बहुत प्रसिद्ध हैं।
गाँव के रेस्ट हाउस के बिल्कुल सामने एक डबल डेकर लिविंग रुट पुल भी है। कई सारे टूरिस्ट यहाँ नदी में मस्ती करते देखे जा सकते हैं। गेस्ट हाउस के करीब से ट्रेल मार्ग पर बहुत आगे जाने पर रेनबो झरना आता है। आधे घंटे तक चलने के बाद एक और झूला पल और उसके एकदम बाद एक और लिविंग रुट पुल आता है। यहाँ से ट्रेल गायब सी हो जाती है इसलिए GPX फाइल को नेविगेशन उपकरण या स्मार्टफोन में लोड करके रखें। करीब 1 किलोमीटर तक चलने के बाद रेनबो झरना आ जाता है।
यह ट्रैक बहुत ही मजेदार और सुन्दर है। पूरे ट्रैक मार्ग में झूला पुल, लिविंग रूट पुल, सुपारी के जंगल, कटहल के जंगल, पानी की ठंडी धारायें, सीढ़ियों, चिड़ियाँ, और तितलियों की भरमार हैं। हरियाली से भरा यह ट्रैक उत्तरपूर्व भारत का एक बेहद शानदार ट्रैक है।

images.caption: मेघालय के नोंग्रियट गाँव के पास रेनबो फॉल्स झरने का विहंगम दृश्य, भारत।
तिरना और नोंगरियात के लिविंग रुट पुल का ट्रेल मार्ग।मेघालय, भारत
नोंग्रियट गांव में प्रवेश करने से ठीक पहले झूला पुल, चेरापूंजी जिला, मेघालय, भारत।
सोहरा जिले के नोंग्रियट गांव में डबल डेकर लिविंग रूट पुल, मेघालय, भारत।
नोंग्रियट गांव के लिविंग रूट पुल के नीचे ठंडा सुन्दर प्राकृतिक तालाब, चेरापूंजी, मेघालय, भारत।
नोंग्रियट गांव का रेनबो झरना एक आकर्षक हाईकिंग स्थल है, मेघालय, भारत।

title: Dia 5 na Trilha Bohusleden
short_description:
No quinto dia, terminamos a etapa 6 e fizemos parte da etapa 7. A trilha começa na inda área ao redor do lago Gäddevatten, passa pelo castelo Bohus Fästning e termina na beira de outro belo lago, Romesjön.
Translate to English
long_description:
Para começar o dia, voltamos para a trilha principal e vamos aos poucos nos afastando da linda área ao redor do lago Gäddevatten. Depois de 5km do início da trilha é possível para num grande supermercado para abastecer os suprimentos na cidade de Bohus, que dá nome à trilha. Daqui, cruzamos uma longa ponte e já conseguimos ver de longe o bonito castelo Bohus Fästning. A área ao redor do castelo é um lugar perfeito para um piquenique.
Continuando, passamos por um vilarejo - Gamla Staden - e depois por um lago - Swarte Mosse - onde possui banheiros, uma lanchonete e uma grande área para caminhada e recreação.  Também tem um abrigo na beira do lago.  A nossa trilha segue até chegar em outro lago, Romesjön, onde acampamos para passar a noite.
Translate to English

title: Emerald Coast Trail
short_description: Coastal trail between the Porcos Bay and Praia do Cachorro, passing by eight beautiful beaches on the Mar de Dentro, which form some of the most idyllic sceneries of Fernando de Noronha.
long_description:
The trail can be started at the Porcos Bay or at Praia do Cachorro. However, many prefer to take the táxi to the Baía dos Porcos to start the trail and finish on Praia do Cachorro, which is in the Vila dos Remédios, where many are staying.Although it has no signposting and some stretches are confusing, the Emerald Coast can be done either independently or accompanied by a guide hired from tourism agencies in the Vila dos Remédios.
After the Bay of Pigs, one arrives at Cacimba do Padre and continues along the shore, passing by Bode Beach, where one must cross a cliff to reach the Americano Beach, great for a break and a swim. Then, after a stretch of stones, you arrive at à Boldró beach and, just ahead, also after another very stony stretch, you reach the Conceiç&atilde beach. At the end, you walk along Praia do Meio until you reach Praia do Cachorro.

title: On the Pic du Midi de Bigorre
short_description:
Relatively short tour on mainly good (gravel) paths from the famous Col du Tourmalet to the 2876-metre Pic du Midi de Bigorre with its observatory and transmitter.
In good weather, the panorama stretches from the main ridge of the Pyrenees in the south to the Massif Central in the north, in bad weather to the outstretched hand.

images.caption: The cable car would have been more comfortable...
Du col du Tourmalet au Pic du Midi

title: From Kempten to Dietmannsried
short_description: On this varied hike we get to know the city centre of Kempten and the industry in and around Ursulasried. We then hike along the Iller towards Dietmannsried.
long_description:
The beginnings of Kempten can be traced back to the Roman times. At that time the town was called Cambodunum. Evidence of this can be found in the Archeological Park. Kempten is divided into two original parts. The Catolic monastery of the Benedictines with the St. Lawrence Basilica extended northwest of the residence. Today's old town with the Protestant St. Mang Church formed the second historical part of Kempten.
Many companies have settled in Ursulasried, which particularly appreciate the proximity to the city of Kempten and the A7 motorway. A little later, the Illersteilufer offers a harsh contrast through the again typically rural landscape. Along the west side of the Iller, factories appear again and again, but they are not perceived as disturbing because of the vegetation along the banks.

images.caption: Cemetery of the Catholic Church Chapel Foundation.

title: Dia 4 on Trilha Bohusleden
short_description: On this fourth day of the trail, we did the rest of stage 5 and part of stage 6. We stayed overnight in a shelter near the Gäddevatten lake, situated in the beautiful Vättlefjälls nature reserve.
long_description:
It was at the start and end of the trail that we passed the most beautiful places this day.
The Vättlefjälls nature reserve is a recreation area full of wilderness, with numerous lakes where you can bathe, canoe and fish.
Around the Gäddevatten lake, there are several shelters to be used for overnight stays. As there were already people in the first shelters, we chose to stay in the one marked on the map and which is a few metres from the main trail. Around the shelter we collected dry branches to make a fire at night, as there was no wood available here like in other shelters.

title: St. Mary Church, Debden to Widdington Circular Walk
short_description: A circular route from Saint Mary Church, through Widdington village.
long_description:
A circular route from Saint Mary Church, through Debdam village and west into Rowney Wood.  Over fields, through woods and along quite country lanes.
The walk uses a small section of the Harcomlow Way near the start which is 227 km / 141 mile figure-of-eight way over Cambrideshire, Essex and Hertfordshire.
The radar tower of nearby former RAF Debden can be seen on the horizon along the walk.  The George Formby film "It's in the Air" was shot there.
Halfway through the walk you pass through the pleasant village of Widdington (or Widituna as it was called in the Doomsday Book of 1086) which has a pub for refreshments.

title: Caves and Ruins Circuit in Tijuca Forest
short_description: Light and easy trail to get to know a little more of the natural and historical beauty of Tijuca National Park.
long_description:
The Tijuca Forest é the largest urban forest in the world and is á located in the heart of the city of Rio de Janeiro. Its reforestation process began in the second half of the 19th century, by order of Dom Pedro I.
The Caves Circuit é a trail of the Tijuca National Park suitable for all ages, as it has a low degree of difficulty and é well signposted. Visit the main caves of the park, such as Paulo and Virginia, Belmiro, Bernardo de Oliveira and Morcegos, the second largest gneiss cave in Brazil with more than 20 meters high. Then, immerse yourself in Brazilian history by visiting the ruins of old coffee farms.

title: Hike to the 7 Coloured Earth in Chamarel, Mauritius
short_description: The tour takes you past sugar cane fields, coffee plantations and the Chamarel waterfall to the 7-colour earth, one of the main attractions of Mauritius.
long_description:
The 2.3km long hiking trail is very flat and therefore suitable for everyone. Unfortunately, the natural spectacle is privately owned, so we have to pay a small entrance fee at the car park.

The first highlight of our hike is the Chamarel waterfall. There, the small rivers St Denis and Viande Salée plunge 100m into the depths. Opposite is a viewing platform from which we have a very good view of the waterfall. At the gorge we recognise two different lava layers, dating from about 1.7 to 3.5 and 8 to 10 million years ago respectively. The cascade is particularly spectacular during the cyclone season (December to April). During this time, the two rivers carry many times more water.

We can also experience the waterfall up close. To do so, we have to leave our path already before the viewing platform at a right-hand bend. The small path then leads directly to the river and the gorge.

After we have taken enough photos of the waterfall, we get back on the trail. It leads us directly to our second big highlight, the 7-coloured earth or also called coloured earth.

There the earth shimmers in seven different colours, from red to blue to green. This is the result of the complete washing out of basalts and chemical reactions of metals with water. A short tour allows us to see the earth from all sides. But the earth is not the only experience. Right next to it are several exotic plants and an enclosure with giant turtles.

After a refreshment in the restaurant, we head back. Perhaps we will enjoy the view of the Cascade Chamarel, as the waterfall is also called, or stop at the sugar cane fields to talk briefly with the friendly workers, provided we understand French, which is the official language of Mauritius.

title: Through the Ravensburger Spieleland
short_description: This tour takes us through the Ravensburger Spieleland. We pass most of the attractions of the adventure park and experience, among other things, a ride on the summer toboggan run, alpine rafting and many other attractions for young and old.
long_description: This tour takes us once through the Ravensburger Spieleland - an amusement park with over 100 different attractions that is just right for kids and the young at heart

title: Parida Waterfall Trail
short_description: Located in the Serra da Canastra, the Cachoeira da Parida has exuberant natural beauty, mineral springs, natural pools of transparent water and much more.
long_description:
The Cachoeria da Parida is located in the Serra da Canastra National Park. From a small cânion embedded in the rocks sprout two waterfalls that form a large pool of deep and crystalline waters. The waters from this waterfall flow down the rocks and form a second waterfall, further down, that falls into a second pool, also deep and with green waters, called the Poço do Macaco.
The trail, well marked and easy to see, begins by heading south from the dirt road, up the Chapada mountain range.After a light climb, you quickly reach the plateau, where there is a bifurcation. After a moderate descent, you reach the bed of the Ribeiririnha da Parida. Return by the same trail and continue east, descending through a stretch of pasture until you find the main trail. Then continue right for a few more metres until you reach Poço do Macaco. To access the Parida waterfall é need to swim across the pool and climb its small fall.

images.caption: Cachoeira da Parida, Serra da Canastra, Minas Gerais
Cachoeira da Parida, Serra da Canastra, Minas Gerais

title: Geyser Lake (Altai)
short_description: The tiny geyser lake near the village of Aktash is famous for its unique and ineffable colours. This natural beauty of the lake is ensured by its thermal springs.
long_description: The unique Geyser Lake is rented by a local tourist resort, which is obviously why it is so intensely popular with tourists. The lake itself is up to 30 metres in diameter and only 2 metres deep and is fed by thermal waters. Clay with unusual, heavenly colours is ejected from the ground at the bottom of the lake, and the lake delights with its turquoise colours. The water is so transparent that any swimming pool would envy it. The colour – it takes your breath away! A view from above shows some blue-purple, greenish circles that are formed by thermal springs coming out from this very special part of the Altai Mountains. The place is quite accessible. Everyone who pass Chuysky trakt is free to go to the lake in 10 minutes and take a rest from the road getting a cultural pleasure. Everyone who wants to enjoy the land is free to go to the adjacent mountain and visit another nice lake – Squeaking Lake, and tell what others don't know, namely how to get there and why it is "creaking".

title: Doi Suthep Monk Trail
short_description: This hike is a great intermediate hike into the Thai jungle with an amazing temple as a reward for reaching the top!
long_description: Great hike for all ages. Can be slippery when wet. Pack lots of water and try to stay out of the sun on hot days.

title: Circular trail from Schönwald through the Weißenbach Valley
short_description: Comfortable winter walk through the beautiful Weißenbachtal valley near Schönwald
long_description:
Through the forest and across snow-covered meadows, this short hike leads through the wintry Weißenbachtal valley. From the centre of Schönwald, we hike mostly on asphalt roads in one loop to the Rössle ski lift and back again.
Beautiful views of the lovely Weißenbach valley included!

title: From Oslo to the North Cape past Trollstigen
short_description: This breathtaking motorized tour leads us from the Norwegian capital to the famous North Cape on the Norwegian island of Magerøya. It takes you to the stunning city of Trondheim, stops at the Geiranger Fjord, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, until we finally arrive at one of Norway’s greatest spots: the North Cape.
long_description:
For decades, the North Cape has been attracting visitors from all over the world. It is often wrongly referred as the northernmost point of Europe, which is actually Cape Nordkinn.  
Nonetheless it is still a fascinating sightsseing point which is worth a trip. And you don’t even need to get a flight for visiting the North Cape. Thanks to its well-developed national and international street network, you want have trouble to get to Scandinavia by car or trailer.
On the way you will get to see many of the spectacular fjord landscapes Norway has to offer. The stunning surroundings give you a sense of the former glaciers’ massive force. Besides the classic sightseeing spots such as Tromsø and Trondheim you can also visit Trollstigen, a steep serpentine road which belongs to the “National Tourist Route” and spans over 100 km from Geiranger to Romsdal valley in the north of Norway.

title: Bohusleden - Stage 4 - Angered to Fontin
short_description: The fourth stage of the Bohusleden trail leads from Angered via the villages of Bohus and Kunglv to the Fontin nature reserve.
long_description: From Angered the trail leads to the river Lärjeån, which is rich in salmon and trout, then we walk uphill to Reannebergen and onto the plateau Vättlefjäll, which is formed by a variety of valley incisions. Soon we reach Bohus, a small village where a bridge crosses the river Göta Älv to Kungälv. On the island of Fästningsholmen in the middle of the river we can visit the ruins of the centuries-old Bohus Fortress before walking along the outskirts of Kungälv to the Fontin nature reserve.

title: Wandelroute Sallandse Heuvelrug
short_description:
Deze route is 18 kilometer en duurt ongeveer 5 uur. Het is een lange maar prachtige wandeling. 
Translate to English
long_description:
De Sallandse Heuvelrug is een van de vele nationale parken in Nederland. Dit natuurgebied is ontstaan door de laatste ijstijd. De Heuvelrug bestaat uit verschillende heuvels die het gebied laten leven. Tijdens de wandelroute zul je voor over en langs de heide wandelen. Ook wandel je door een prachtig bos. 
Translate to English

title: Farmers' Path Kressbronn
short_description: Beautiful walk with magnificent Lake Constance panorama
long_description: The Farmers' Trail is a beautiful, small circular path that offers magnificent views over Lake Constance. It winds through various fruit fields and offers numerous information boards and play opportunities. There is also a great playground and several picnic areas. Perfectly suited for children, the entire trail is also suitable for bicycles / prams.

title: Mastbos walking route
short_description: This walking route is 11.5 kilometres and takes about 3 hours.
long_description: The Mastbos is a beautiful forest to the south of Breda. There used to be plenty of hunting in the forest. The forest was also used for the production of ship masts. During the walk, you walk past little fens, deciduous trees and pine trees.

images.caption: Bouvigne Castle on the edge of the Mastbos

title: From Sonthofen via Sonnen- and Heidelbeerkopf to Langenwang
short_description: First we experience the town of Sonthofen with its pedestrian zone and the ecological park. During the ascent to Sonthofer- and Altstädter Hof and while crossing the several peaks at Sonnen- and Heidelbeerkopf, we enjoy numerous breathtaking views into the Illertal, to the Hörnergruppe and Nagelfluhkette, into the Hindelanger mountains and into the Kleinwalsertal with the striking Ifen and the Gottesacker plateau.
long_description: This mountain tour is extremely well suited for training for long and strenuous day or multi-day tours. At the beginning it is very flat. The path then climbs more and more until you reach the Altstädt farm. On the ascent to the summits, narrow paths await you, which require surefootedness. Because of the far-reaching views, a head for heights is also a prerequisite. From the last peak there is a long, breathtaking descent via Falken-Alpe, Rubi-Hütte and Gai&szlig-Alpe to Rubi. There are several places to stop for refreshments directly along the route. Even for experienced mountaineers, the very varied route is never boring.

images.caption: City of Sonthofen from the Sonthofer Hof.
On the way to the mountains.

title: Dia 2 at Trilha Bohusleden
short_description: On this second day we combine the first, second and part of the third stage. É a long day of walking, but with beautiful landscapes and a shelter at the top of Getryggen to spend the night.
long_description:
The good thing about the Bohusleden trail é that you do not need to do exactly each stage in a day, because é possible to combine them according to your physical fitness and how long you &eecirc; will want to stop to rest, relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery of this region of Sweden. 
There is a shelter that is approximately 20km from the starting point, where it is also possible to stay overnight, but I recommend doing those 30km and ending your day at the Gött Läge and have a spectacular view over the city of Göteborg and the sea, as well as a beautiful sunset.
This second day é quite long, but offers a wide variety of beautiful scenery, such as forests, meadows and fields, beautiful lakes and Gunnebo Castle.The difficulty suggested é in relation to this great distance covered. What is not lacking on this day are beautiful places to take breaks, regain energy and enjoy the beautiful nature of Sweden.

title: Trail to the Morro do Macaco in Bombinhas
short_description: This é the most beautiful trail in the city of Bombinhas, in Santa Catarina. The path goes through 3 viewpoints, with different ângles and spectacular views of the region.
long_description:
This is a very famous trail and one of the highlights of the region, because the panoramic views from the top of the Morro do Macaco are simply stunning.
At the end of Canto Grande beach, on the Mar de Dentro in Bombinhas, there is a sign indicating the start of the trail, near large stones. The trail is approximately 2.2 kilometres long (round-trip) and is part of the Morro do Macaco Municipal Park. The whole route is signposted and there are resting points.
