title: Hike to Devkund Waterfall
short_description: Devkund Falls is a popular destination for hiking and picnicking for families, hikers, nature lovers, and casual tourists.
long_description:
देवकुंड जलप्रपात महाराष्ट्र राज्य के रायगढ़ जिले के मनगाँव तालुक के पटणुस/भीरा गाँव में स्थित है। ऐसी मान्यता है की यह महाराष्ट्र की प्रसिद्ध कुण्डलिका नदी का उद्गम श्रोत्र है।
वैसे तो यह पूरे साल भर एक लोकप्रिय हाइकिंग मार्ग और पर्यटन स्थल है, लेकिन मानसून के दौरान इसमें पर्यटकों की आवाजाही बहुत बढ़ जाती है।
यह ट्रैकिंग मार्ग करीब साढ़े चार किलोमीटर लम्बा और अपेक्षाकृत आसान है। रास्ता हरा-भरा और अच्छी तरह से साइन पोस्टेड है। गाँव में ट्रेल की शुरुआत में एक पंजीकरण डेस्क है जहाँ पर हर यात्री को सुरक्षा कारणों से रजिस्टर करना जरूरी है। एक स्थानीय गाइड लेना भी आवश्यक है। 
ट्रैक मार्ग में पानी की धाराएँ और खेतों हैं से होकर गुजरता है। लगभग आधे घंटे बाद भीरा झील आती है। यहाँ से आगे जाने पर अगले 45 मिनट में दो छोटी पानी की धाराओं को पार करना पड़ता है। इसके करीब 20 मिनट बाद एक छोटी पहाड़ी पर चढ़ना पड़ता है। पहाड़ी की चढ़ाई करने के बाद एक खुली जगह पर पहुंचते हैं। यहाँ पर स्नैक्स, जूस, और पानी बेचने वाले छोटे स्टॉल हैं। आप यहां रुक कर आराम और नाश्ता कर सकते हैं।
इसके बाद करीब एक किलोमीटर की ट्रैकिंग करने के बाद झरने तक पहुंचा जा सकता है। देवकुंड झरना बहुत ही सुंदर है।  यह करीब 80 फ़ीट की ऊंचाई से झील में गिरता है। इस एक दिवसीय ट्रैक का आनंद अपने दोस्तों और परिवार के साथ ज़रूर लेना चाहिए।

images.caption: महाराष्ट्र में पदयात्रा मार्ग: पटणुस/भीरा गाँव - देवकुंड जलप्रपात ट्रैक

title: Starting the Bohusleden Trail
short_description: Start of the trip to start the Bohusleden Trail in the western part of Sweden. Hike to the first overnight shelter.
long_description:
We used the first day of our trip to arrive in Sweden. We flew to Copenhagen airport and then took the train to Malmö, the third largest city in Sweden. We bought food at the Coop supermarket in the train station itself and went to the Naturkompaniet shop to buy gas and the trail map, which we found very useful to have, to better plan where we would sleep each night.
From Malmö we took the train to Anneberg, connecting in Kungsbacka. From the Anneberg train station we could already see the markings for the Bohusleden trail, which are always well marked, and we headed to the first shelter for the night. <nbsp;< p>
As soon as we left the train station in Anneberg, we went to the first shelter for the night. <nbsp;< p>
As soon as we left the road, it was possible to fill the canteens with ápotable water. The place is marked on the map. At the beginning/end of each stage, there is an information board, with the map and some other useful information.

images.caption: Abrigo Wind shelter Blåvättnerna na Trilha Bohusleden, Suécia
Abrigo Wind shelter Blåvättnerna na Trilha Bohusleden, Suécia

title: The witness hills of the Tapolca basin
short_description: A tour around the witness hills and sights of the Tapolca Basin. Either in one breath or in several parts.
long_description: Basically, it's a challenging hike with a great experience. There is a wealth of natural and historical attractions waiting for you if you accept the challenge. The Tapolca basin can be admired from various peaks, an experience that is enhanced by the altitude difference already left behind.  For those who are prepared hikers, this is the perfect challenge for a day, and if you prefer to take it slower and enjoy the local wines, the loop is just as enjoyable in its details. In addition to the excellent wines of Badacsony, you can also delve into history at Szigliget Castle or the ruins of Csobánc. An interesting fact about the basin is that in the 1960s, they wanted to create an artificial bay all the way to Tapolca.

images.caption: #Összetartozás100folk – Tördemic HÖ. Néptáncegyüttes és Császár Dominik dudás

title: Walking route Oisterwijk
short_description: The Oisterwijkse bossen en vennen is a beautiful nature reserve that was created during the last ice age.
long_description: The wind blew the sand into small hills. The holes where the sand had once lain filled up with water, creating infinite fens. It is interesting to know that this nature reserve was almost gone, because someone wanted to build a villa park there. Fortunately, the Society for the Preservation of Natural Monuments bought up the land and since then nature has had even more of a chance to be true nature;

title: तुराहल्ली जंगल साइकिल टूर
short_description: थुराहल्ली जिसे तुराहल्ली के नाम से भी जाना जाता है कर्णाटकी की राजधानी बेंगलुरु से लग भग 20 किमी दूर स्थित एक संरक्षित घना जंगल है। यह बाइकर्स और साइकिलिस्ट का एक बेहद पसंदीदा स्थान है।
long_description:
तुराहल्ली या थुराहल्ली वन बेंगलुरु शहर से लगभग 20 किमी दूर स्थित संरक्षित जंगल हैं जो की हालिया समय में बहुत तेज़ी से साइकिल चालकों की पसंदीदा जगह बन है। तुराहल्ली वन ट्रेल लगभग 6 किलोमीटर लंबा लूप ट्रेल है जिसका मतलब यह है कि यह ट्रेल अंत में घूमफिर कर शुरुआती बिंदु पर वापस आ जाता है।
यह ट्रेल साफ़ और अच्छे रखरखाव वाला साइकिल मार्ग है जो दोनों तरफ पेड़ों से घिरा हुआ है। यह हरे भरे जंगल से होकर गुजरती है। ट्रेल में एक पहाड़ी की चोटी पर एक छोटा शनि मंदिर भी है।
पर्वतारोहण पसंद करने वाले लोगो के बीच में यह जंगल एक बोल्डरिंग स्थल के रूप में भी लोकप्रियता हासिल कर रहा है। जंगल में मौजूद कुछ विशाल ऑउटक्रॉप्स और बोल्डर के ऊपर से बैंगलोर शहर का पैनारोमिक नज़ारा भी दिखता है।
बेंगलुरू शहर का बचा हुआ एकमात्र जंगल होने के कारण तुराहल्ली जंगल की शहर नगरपालिका बोर्ड और पर्यावरण प्रेमियों द्वारा अच्छी तरह से देखभाल की जाती है जो इस जंगल के संरक्षण और बेहतरी के लिए प्रतिबद्ध हैं।

images.caption: बैंगलोर के पास स्थित तुराहल्ली संरक्षित वन के अंदर एक साइकिलिंग ट्रेल, कर्नाटक, भारत
तुराहल्ली जंगल के अंदर मौजूद शिलाखंड पर बैठा एक पर्वतारोही, बैंगलोर, कर्नाटक, भारत।
तुराहल्ली जंगल के अंदर एक साइकिलिंग का आनंद लेता हुआ एक साइकिल चालक, बैंगलोर, कर्नाटक, भारत।
तुराहल्ली जंगल ट्रेल पर मौजूद झील और मंदिर, बैंगलोर, कर्नाटक, भारत।
बैंगलोर के तुराहल्ली आरक्षित वन में शनि देवता मंदिर के निकट एक एक चट्टान पर खड़ी साइकिल, कर्नाटक, भारत।
भारत में पदयात्रा मार्ग: तुराहल्ली जंगल साइकिल टूर

title: Bocaina Mountains and Posses Waterfall - Gold Trail
short_description: Initial stretch of the Gold Trail that runs from the entrance of the Serra da Bocaína National Park to the beautiful Posses Waterfall
long_description: The Gold Trail in the Serra da Bocaina National Park, é one of the most traditional mountain walks in Brazil. Situated between Rio de Janeiro and São Paulo, this walk é long and challenging, but at the same time not so demanding.  The route é done in 3 days and starts at the entrance of the Bocaina National Park and follows through the preserved Atlantic Forest of the Serra da Bocaina and Mar, until é Mambucaba, in Angra dos Reis. It takes about 6 hours of walking a day and there are several natural and cultural attractions. <The initial stretch of the Gold Trail begins at reception desk Park and continues for a little less than 1km until reaching Mambucaba River. Then you arrive Santo Isidro waterfall, perfect bathing resting on small white sandy beaches. A later reach Posses Waterfall, which has an incredible natural pool with crystal clear water mirror.

images.caption: Santo Isidro Waterfall, São José do Barreiro
Parque Nacional da Serra da Bocaína, São José do Barreiro

title: Snowshoe hike from Sankt Andreasberg to Oderhaus
short_description: This snowshoe hike takes you from Sankt Andreasberg to Oderhaus, just 8 km through the snow-covered Harz National Park.
long_description: The starting point of today's snowshoe hike in Sankt Andreasberg is famous for the Samson mine: one of the most important mining monuments in Europe. From 1521 to 1910, mainly silver ores were mined here. Today, the former mine is part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site. The starting point at the Kurhaus can also be reached by bus. From here we first hike up to the Jordan hill, past the Friends of Nature House. Then the path follows the Lochchaussee through the wintry landscape. The Rinderstall forest inn offers the opportunity to stop for a bite to eat. Before we reach our destination in Oderhaus, we pass the wildlife observation station in the Oder valley.

images.caption: Blick auf den winterlichen Nationalpark Harz

title: Walk along the shoreline on the Promenade Lungomare
short_description: The best way to get to know Opatija is to walk along the Franz-Joseph I promenade and be enchanted on one side by the beauty of the sea and on the other by the grand architecture of the buildings.
long_description:
The promenade, renamed in 1996 after Emperor Franz Josef I as a token of appreciation for the Habsburg heritage and the value it created for tourism, invites us for a relaxing stroll along the coast. It connects the riverside towns, from Volosko, Ičići, Ikala to Lovran.
  The promenade is well laid out, along it we find benches where we can sit to read a book or catch our breath and admire the beauty of the sea. The walk alternates between shady and sunny areas, so the walk is enjoyable at any time of the day.
Lungomare also passes numerous coves that invite us to swim. Even if the shore is rocky, the inlets are usually well laid out.

images.caption: One of the many bays we pass on Lungomare
Small picturesque beaches along the Lungomare
Small picturesque beaches along the Lungomare

title: Mulder Cycle Path - Freiberger Mulde
short_description: An easy to medium-difficulty tour with easy climbs that can be completed in one or several days at a length of 106 km.
long_description: This tour is one of two "feeder tours" to the Mulderadweg  - United Mulde. On this tour, we follow Europe s fastest river from the border to the Czech Republic on side roads, cycle paths, forest and field paths.

images.caption: Cyclists on the Mulder cycle path

title: Trekking to Harihar Fort in Nashik District
short_description: Harihar or Harshgarh is an ancient, important hill fort in the Nashik district of Maharashtra. Although now it is only a dilapidated remnant, still attracts many visitors and trekkers every year.
long_description:
Harihar Fort, also known as Harshgarh Fort, is a historical site located in the Nashik district of Maharashtra. Situated at an altitude of 3676 feet above sea level in the Trimbakeshwar range, this magnificent fort is built on a rectangular shaped hill and is world famous for its steep steps and overhangs.
Steeped at an angle of more than 70 degrees, these 117 stairs are not for the faint of heart. It is in poor condition at many places and hence holes have been made in it to make it easier for people to hold on while climbing. At many places, the stairs are so narrow that only one person can climb at a time. After reaching the main entrance, the path takes a left turn and one has to climb a spiral staircase once again, which is similar to the previous one. are even more curved than The climb finally ends at a narrow entrance.
There is a small pond under a small temple of Lord Hanuman and Lord Shiva on the plateau. The water of this pond is drinkable. Most of the fort is in dilapidated condition. For outdoor enthusiasts it is possible to stay inside Harihar Fort as well as have accommodation in local villages.

images.caption: पश्चिमी घाट (सह्याद्रि) में पदयात्रा मार्ग: नाशिक जिले के हरिहर किले तक ट्रेकिंग
हरिहर किले के साथ साथ नाशिक क्षेत्र की प्रमुख क्षेत्रीय चोटियों का परिदृश्य। महाराष्ट्र, भारत

नाशिक ज़िले में स्थित हरिहर किले का विहंगम दृश्य। महाराष्ट्र, भारत
हरिहर किले की प्रसिद्ध खड़ी चढाई वाली सीढ़ियां। महाराष्ट्र, भारत
हरिहर किले के अंतिम चरण की असुरक्षित खुली सीढ़ियां। महाराष्ट्र, भारत
View of the stairs without railing at Harihar Fort. Maharashtra, India

title: Dolomites high trail 9
short_description: The route of the Dolomites High-Altitude Trail No. 9, unlike most other Dolomites High-Altitude Trails, runs as a transversal from west to east across the ridges of the Dolomites, most of which rise from south to north.
long_description: The long-distance hiking trail, which is rather easy to follow compared to other Dolomite high-altitude trails, begins in South Tyrol's provincial capital of Bolzano and ends in the small town of Santo Stefano. We cross both South Tyrol and part of the province of Belluno. Most of the route is extremely well developed and also relatively busy. Since there are many support points, the stages of the tour are relatively short and are also suitable for hikers with less good physical condition. A few secured climbs have to be overcome, including the Strada degli Alpini, which has climbing passages of difficulty level I. Like all high-altitude trails through the Dolomites, the route is particularly beautiful in terms of scenery, with impressive views of numerous peaks beckoning! The route is usually completed within 12 to 14 days.

images.caption: The Grasleiten Hut in the Schlern-Rosengarten Nature Park
View of the Sassolungo Group from the Friedrich August Trail
Friedrich August Hut in front of the Sella Group
A relic from the 1st World War
On the Kaiserjäger Trail at Lagazuoi
Former officers' quarters in the middle of the rock face of Lagazuoi

title: Dia 3 on Trilha Bohusleden
short_description: The third day on the Bohusleden trail in Sweden continued to exceed expectations with its many forests and beautiful lakes.
long_description:
Leaving the Gött Läge we walked a lot on several paths that are still part of the surroundings of Gothenburg and are very well looked after. We met several local people, playing sports.
On this day, at the end of the journey to the shelter, we stopped in the little village of Jonsered. There we found a small shop and managed to buy the essentials for our supplies. Soon after, the trail passes by an old brick factory and a beautiful lake.
The shelter is in a place famous for being used at weekends by the Swedes, with little houses that can be rented. Here you have 2 shelters to spend the night and also enough space to pitch tents. The place also has toilets, drinking water and electricity to charge mobile phones.
On this day we finished stage 3 and 4, and did the beginning of stage 5 (official stages of the trail) to the shelter Torpet Freden.

images.caption: Torpet FredenTorpet Freden in Jonsered, Sweden

title: From Morteratsch to the Boval Hut (2496 m)
short_description: First stage of the Piz Morteratsch traverse: from Morteratsch to the Boval Hut
long_description:
The Bernina Group is the highest mountain group in the Eastern Alps. The highest peak in the region - Piz Bernina - at 4048 m is also the only four-thousand-metre peak in the Eastern Alps. The Piz Morteratsch (3751 m) is also in the Bernina Group. It is not the most demanding and highest mountain in the area, but due to its central location it offers a fantastic view of the surrounding mountain peaks, including the well-known Biancograt, the northern ridge of Piz Bernina.  
The tour described here is the traverse of Piz Morteratsch from east to west. On the first stage of the tour, we hike from Morteratsch along the Morteratsch glacier along narrow paths and rocky trails. At first, the trail leads us through the forest; below us on the left flows the Morteratsch River, which rises from the glacier of the same name. But soon we emerge from the forest and a view of a gigantic mountain backdrop opens up before us: Piz Palü (3900 m), Bellavista (3922 m), the striking Bianco ridge of Piz Bernina (4048 m) and Piz Morteratsch (3751 m) soon come into our field of vision. We reach the Boval Hut via this scenically varied and beautiful trail.
This stage is the shorter and easier of the two, but it impresses with its impressive scenery and can also serve as a day tour for less experienced mountaineers.

images.caption: Blick durch den Wald auf den Morteratschgletscher und die Bellavista
Blick auf den Morteratschgletscher, links die Bellavista, rechts der  Piz Bernina mit Biancograt
Piz Palü, Bellavista, Piz Bernina und Piz Morteratsch
Die rot-weiße Markierung führt von Morteratsch zur Bovalhütte

title: Brasov Marathon, the cross-country route
short_description: This is the route of the Cross Country race of the Brașov Marathon, which reached its 10th edition in 2022. The route is a classic one, and follows the well known Serpentine Trail to the Tâmpa summit, then descends to the Tâmpa saddle, respectively to Răcădău and returns to the city bypassing the mountain.
long_description:
The maximum altitude is reached, of course, at the Tâmpa peak, and the only power point is installed at the Tâmpa saddle.
This stage of the competition is open to both adults and children, who can participate with parental consent.
The maximum time allowed to complete the route is 4 hours.
On the day of the competition, the route is marked in addition to the mountain markers; however, there are no orientation problems during training.

images.caption: The Schei Gate from the street of the same name

title: Aeugsten via Rotärd to Filzbach
short_description: From Bärenboden, the mountain station of the Aeugsten cable car, the tour starts via Aeugstenhütte steeply up to Alp Begligen.
long_description:
The massive Schilt looms on the left. The trail continues along the lonely, long and strenuous Rotärd route, where the Mürtschenstock finally appears. The red ground around Rotärd is equally fascinating.

The descent via Mürtschenfurggel is arduous and requires full attention, as the trail is quite sparsely marked. Passing the Spaneggsee and Talaplsee lakes, you reach the Talalpsee restaurant. After a reinforcement, you continue along a gorge slot, the Chammerboden, to your destination Filzbach.

title: Bärenboden - Äugsten - Bi den Seelenen
short_description: This beautiful circular walk starts above Ennenda at the mountain station of the Aeugsten cable car.
long_description:
At the mountain inn Äugsten, turn right via Chrummböden to «Bi den Seelen». You reach the first lake of a whole group of lakes on a plateau. Gradually you come across the next little lake until you finally have a view of the entire lake landscape from above.
The Rückweg leaves üuft via Ober Fessis and Achseli to the starting point Bärenboden.

images.caption: The train takes you up comfortably

title: Holzflue circular route
short_description: The Holzflue circular trail leads through the World Heritage area of the Tectonic Arena Sardona and is characterised by pristine nature and the view of Glarus and the grey rock face of the Schilt.
long_description:
Binoculars are a useful companion for observing seagulls and stone boulders.
The tour starts from the mountain station of the Aeugsten cable car at Bärenboden with a fantastic panoramic view. A short steep climb to the Aeugstenhütte mountain inn takes you via Alp Begligen and Holzflue back to the mountain station.

title: From Fuschl via the Wildmoos to Lake Eibensee
short_description: Leisurely and family-friendly hike through the densely wooded region in the Salzkammergut around the idyllically situated Eibensee lake with a possible detour to the nearby Marienköpfl.
long_description: In the area between Fuschlsee and Wolfgangsee, the romantic Eibensee invites you to a varied hike. It is one of the most charming but lesser-known bodies of water in the western Salzkammergut. The ascent along the Eibensee stream already creates a relaxed atmosphere, which reaches its first climax in the Wildmoos nature reserve, as the moor is a particularly idyllic spot. From the nearby Marienköpfl, there is a magnificent view of the lake and the surrounding area. Lake Eiben, which is rich in fish, is nestled between steep slopes that keep the wind out. The water level is thus often not clouded by the slightest wave and lies crystal clear in front of us. In summer, numerous plants, some of them rare, can be found along the path, and in the beginning of winter, the first white heads of snow lilies can be observed, already preparing a foretaste of the next spring. The mountain lake also invites you to swim and rest on hot days.

images.caption: Lake Eiben, cool tip for hot days
On the path through the Wildmoos

title: Walk on the heights of the Bastidonne
short_description: Take this route to discover the Saint-Julien hill located near one of the typical villages of the South Luberon. Beautiful views are on the agenda!
long_description:
Accessible to all, this route starts in La Bastidonne, a village that owes its name to the fortress erected in the 13th century on Saint-Julien hill.
After taking the small streets and paths of the village, you will walk along the more or less narrow paths of this promontory (449 m) with magnificent landscapes. Vineyards, garrigues, pine forests... a condensed version of Provence before your eyes! It will be easy to contemplate the Durance hills, the Sainte-Victoire Mountain, the Mourre Nègre and even the Prealps of Digne-les-Bains on a clear day.
.
Once you reach the level of the Saint-Julien chapel, a break is in order. Admire the view, splendid!
The end of the walk follows the same route as the outward journey.

images.caption: randonnée - Vaucluse: Balade sur les hauteurs de la Bastidonne
View from the Chapel of St. Julien
View from the Chapel of St. Julien
Signposting of hiking trails in the Vaucluse
Sunset on the heights of the Bastidonne

title: Schilt from Fronalp Ski Hut
short_description: Description: Varied route in quite alpine surroundings despite the modest altitude. Often used as a fashionable tour with a summit that offers a view of the entire Glarnerland.
long_description:
Starting point for snowshoers: Skihütte Fronalp/Unter Stafel (1330 m) GL: SBB via Ziegelbrücke to Mollis, then ski bus or car to Skihütte Fronalp, (Tel. 079 693 49 49). Attention: The road is steep, winding and often requires winter equipment.
Skiing starting point: Mittler Stafel (1584 m): Access as above to Ochsenberg, then ski lift to Mittler Stafel.
From Fronalp ski hut on access road in 10 minutes to Naturfreundehaus Fronalp. Then take the easy winter hiking trail/ski slope up to Mittler Stafel (ski lift terminus). From Mittler Stafel in a southerly direction through a small plateau, then steeply up over bushes into a hollow that leads into the passage between Färistock and Heustöckli. Then ünde over open terrain southeast up to the foot of the Siwellen (P. 2226), below which is crossed in steep terrain (about 30 degrees) to the west. Now to the northeast ridge of the Schilt and on this to the summit. Descent on the same route.
Highlights: Deep view from the summit, spaghetti snack at the Naturfreundehaus Fronalp.

title: Maple Trail
short_description: On the Maple Trail we hike in a western and eastern loop around the resort of Bad Iburg. A unique nature experience awaits us in the hilly landscape of the Osnabrücker Land: beautiful forests, wide views as well as castles and palaces line the "Wanderbares Deutschland" ("Walkable Germany") award trail.
long_description:
The start and finish of both loops is the spa town of Bad Iburg, where we can take a look at the clock museum, the former Scheventorf moated castle and Iburg Castle with its historic knights' hall and castle museum. Numerous maple species, wooded hillsides and beautiful vantage points make this lovely hiking trail a memorable experience.
West route (35 km)
Stage 1: Bad Iburg - Hagen am Teutoburger Wald (14 km)
The western route takes you through the mountainous landscape of the southern Osnabrück region around the Borgberg to the pottery village of Hagen am Teutoburger Wald.
Stage 2: Hagen am Teutoburger Wald - Bad Iburg (21 km)
We start at the Poggenbach stream and follow it towards Baumannsknollen. South of Georgs-Marienhütte we hike up to the Lammersbrink, with the Varus tower, and then along the Sunderbach stream for some time through the beautiful forest. Behind the Hermannsturm on the Dörenberg, a wide curve over the Musenberg and the Limberg awaits us before we return to Bad Iburg.
East route (60 km)
Stage 3: Bad Iburg - Wellingholzhausen (19 km)
Today we hike strictly east through the Teutoburg Forest to Wellingholzhausen.
Stage 4: Wellingholzhausen - Bad Rothenfelde (21 km)
At the very beginning of the day, we climb up the Beutling, whose springs on the south-western slope provide refreshment. Now we hike in the graceful landscape of Borgloher Schweiz around the village of Hilter, which we recognise from afar by the church of St. John the Baptist. We cross the Sudberg and soon arrive in the spa town of Bad Rothenfelde. A visit to the local history museum or the graduation works (so-called "open-air inhalatories") concludes the day.  
Stage 5: Bad Rothenfelde - Bad Iburg (20 km)
The last large wooded section of the Ahornweg is around the Kleiner Berg and takes us to Bad Laer, also an old spa. Here we walk through the spa park with the Glockensee and see the "Griese Toarn", an early Romanesque fortified tower and landmark of the town. Passing Westerwiede and Ostenfelde, the trail then leads back to Bad Iburg through a wide landscape of fields and meadows.

title: Hörnliweg
short_description: From Schwarzsee üvia the Hörnliweg to the Hörlihütte and back.
long_description:
The trail leads to Zermatt's historical and current hotspot, the Hörnlihütte at the foot of the Matterhorn. Anyone who is in Zermatt should have done this tour at least once. The first ascent of the Matterhorn started here on 14 July 1865. Of the seven alpinists, only three returned to the village of Zermatt, including the Briton Edward Whymper.

At the Hörnlihütte you are so close to the Matterhorn that you can almost feel it, touch it, experience it. It towers mightily above the hut. With binoculars, you can watch the alpinists climbing at the crack of dawn with their headlamps.

images.caption: Hotel Schwarzsee - View towards Trockener Steg

title: Wisshornweg
short_description: This very attractive circular hiking trail is considered a real insider tip.

title: Winter hiking through the Groppertal
short_description: The hike leads from Unterkirnach past wildly idyllic Black Forest farms into the Groppertal valley.
long_description: We start our tour at the mill square at the Kirnachmühle. The mill, built in 1843, originates from Todtmoos, but was rebuilt from 1995 to 1997 in the village centre of Unterkirnach to keep the tradition of milling alive. We cross the Talstraße and walk east on the Stadthofweg until we meet the Schuhmacherhäusleweg. We hike to Hinterwasenhof and decide to take the right path at the next fork. We are now on the Kohlwaldweg, which leads us through the wonderfully snow-covered forest. Soon afterwards we reach the Salvestweg, which leads us downhill into the Groppertal. We pass Gropperhof with its chapel along the way. Via the Groppertal hillside path, we reach a level crossing, which we cross. We continue along the railway tracks and pass the Gasthof Forelle. Brown ironstone was probably mined in the Groppertal between 1803 and 1815. Today there are still some tunnels in the granite rock that indicate this. We cross the tracks again and walk uphill on the left hand side along the Mooslochweg. We pass a few farmsteads along the way. After a short stretch of forest, we reach the Breitbrunnen inn. On the Breitbrunnenweg, we continue in the direction of Unterkirnach and meet our starting route again shortly before the Hinterwasenhof.

images.caption: Winter Hike in the Black Forest: Winter Hiking through the Groppertal Valley

title: Winter hiking on Birkendorf's heights
short_description: The circular hike takes us across the Schlüchttal valley and a sunny plateau to the Bühl vantage point.
long_description: From Haus des Gastes, we follow the country road for about 500 m in the direction of Grafenhausen, passing the parish church St. Margaretha. At the Sonnenhof, we turn left into the Hohlgasse. Past the last houses of Birkendorf, the path leads us through a small, snow-covered forest down into the Schlüchttal. We follow the lovely course of the Schlücht for a short distance before keeping to the right at the next junction and walking uphill through the winter forest. We cross the country road and meet the Traufweg about 50 m further on. This leads us along the edge of the forest onto a snow-covered plateau. We continue straight on and pass individual farmsteads before climbing to the Birkendorfer Bühl at over 800 m. This is the highest point around the forest. This point is the highest elevation around Birkendorf and, weather permitting, rewards us with a magnificent view over the Black Forest village all the way to the Swiss Alps. After a short breather and enjoying the panorama, we now hike south in a wide arc downhill again to Birkendorf. Shortly before the first houses, we meet Bühlstraße and turn right there. We follow Bühlstraße for about 300 m until we turn left into the country road, which leads us back to the starting point.

images.caption: Winterwanderung im Schwarzwald: Winterwandern auf Birkendorfs Höhen
View from the Matt to the Sunnehörnligrat

title: Tguma from Dultschegnas via Prau da l'Alp

images.caption: View from the summit into the Surselva

title: Täschalp - Kinhütte
long_description:
This challenging hike runs from Täschalp via the Europaweg trail to the Kinhütte hut - it climbs more than 1'000 m. Beautiful and proudly growing edelweiss can be found along the way and the view of the Mattertal is overwhelming. However, one should not get too distracted, concentration is required. At the Kinhütte, formerly used as a starting point for alpine mountain tours, it has become quieter since the changes in terrain in recent decades. This makes it the ideal destination for nature lovers seeking tranquillity. The same path leads back to the starting point.

Note(s)
You can get to Täschalp by taxi or by bike.

title: Randa - Kinhütte
long_description:
This hike starts in Randa and leads into an area where many things are called "wild" and "wildi", such as Wildikin or Wildibach. In keeping with the name, you can look forward to a wild and beautiful, yet challenging hike to the Kinhütte.
It is located off the beaten track and therefore offers a lot of peace and tranquillity. You have a magnificent view over the valley.
The path there is steep, difficult and demanding. It is recommended for experienced mountain hikers and requires concentration and stamina.

title: Way of Silence
short_description: As the name of the tour suggests, the «Path of Silence» is a dream for those seeking tranquillity.
long_description:
From the Gornergrat, follow the trail down through a quiet, forgotten valley, through the rather unknown hinterland of the Gornergrat. Past the Gornergratsee lake and the Kellensee lake, you cross the stubbly alpine grass meadows. In the lower part of the Ritzigrat, the path is interspersed with stones and rocks. At a worthwhile stop at Grünsee, you can cool off from the exertions of the tour with a swim before the hike continues via Mosjesee to Sunnegga.
It is worth looking out for game and interesting alpine flora with edelweiss.

.

title: Spronser Lake District
short_description: Finnish atmosphere in the high alpine area: the lake mosaic in the Texel Group
long_description:
Mountain lakes as far as the eye can see! Experienced and sure-footed hikers can go on a unique mountain lake "safari" near Merano.
The Sprons lakes form the largest high-alpine lake plateau in South Tyrol - a unique mountain landscape.

images.caption: In front of the alp Oberkaser

title: Swiss Topwalk
short_description: The hike starts at the Riffelalp and leads through the forest.
long_description:
Quite quickly, the path turns into a wonderful panoramic trail, whose panorama accompanies the hikers all the way to their destination. Past the Riffelberg, the highlight of the tour is the reflection of the Matterhorn in the Riffelsee. From the Gornergrat, the railway takes you back to the valley.
The trail is also used as a running training route. It is part of the Zermatt Marathon, which takes place regularly in July.

title: From Burgkunstadt to the Great Kordigast
short_description: We enjoy a panoramic tour up the local mountain of Wei;main and Altenkunstadt.
long_description: If we arrive by train, we can also start the tour at Burgkunstadt station. On our hike we walk through forests and villages around Altenkunstadt. The special highlight is the panoramic view from the large Kordigast;

title: Alp Flix explorer course
short_description: Experiential explorer course super suitable for the whole family.
long_description: This tour is ideal for children between the ages of 7 and 12. On the round tour around the lakes on Alp Flix, you can explore the biodiversity. With an explorer's kit available at the region's information points, children can build a water wheel, suck in spiders and observe them in the beaker magnifier, as well as record everything in a diary. Pure walking time 1 hour, with the experiments approx. 3 hours.

images.caption: The yurts of Cotti Agricultura on Alp Flix

title: Via Romantica
long_description: On this spectacular hike, you cross the gullies, scree slopes and avalanche trains that descend from Muchetta to Landwasser. This tour starts not far from the Wiesen viaduct and leads up to Jenisberg, a Walser settlement that is inhabited all year round. Past the Greifenstein ruins you reach Filisur.

title: Val Faller - Oasis of Silence
short_description: On this tour, the striking Piz Arblatsch is hiked around.
long_description:
The trail leads past the former Walser settlement of Tga up to the highest point, Fuorcla Curtegns. From here the trail descends steadily via Alp Curtegns to Savognin.
To Radons and Tga there are hiking buses.

title: Ruhr Heights Trail
short_description: The Ruhr Heights Trail follows the course of the Ruhr from its source near Winterberg to where it flows into the Rhine in Duisburg. For the most part, we do not hike directly along the banks, but on the ridges on both sides of the river from the Rothaargebirge mountains to the Lower Rhine in the Ruhr region.
long_description: The headwaters of the Ruhr are a little north of Winterberg at the Ruhrkopf - this is where we start our eventful hike. Until we reach Olsberg, we walk steadily downhill and more or less directly along the banks of the Ruhr. Now, however, we turn west and climb the first heights in the south of the Arnsberg Forest. Past the Hennetal Dam, behind Meschede, we cross the Ruhr twice and reach Arnsberg, with the castle of the same name, through the beautiful deciduous forest. The next section of the trail to Bergheim is characterised by several small communities. The route continues through the Luerwald forest, which is criss-crossed by numerous rivers and streams, to Menden in the Sauerland region. From Sümmern via Kalthof and Ergsts, the landscape changes as the forest is increasingly interrupted by wide fields and meadows. We continue our hike and are surprised to see a completely different side of the Ruhr region here: instead of huge industrial plants, historical sights and wooded paths await us. They lead us past Westhofen, Lake Hengstey and Herdecke, and then to Lake Harkort near Wetter - both lakes were created by damming the Ruhr. In Witten we change to the southern side of the river and then pass Hattingen. A wide curve in a northerly direction then leads us to Essen and Lake Baldeney, the largest of the six Ruhr reservoirs. We continue to follow the winding course of the Ruhr and walk from Essen-Werder via Essen-Kettwig to Oemberg, a district of Mülheim an der Ruhr. We enjoy the fact that we avoid the large conurbations and instead walk in scenic surroundings. We can also count the Duisburg city forest among these, which accompanies us to the port area of Duisburg. Along the harbour basin we finally reach the mouth of the Ruhr into the Rhine and have thus reached the end of the Ruhr Heights Trail.

title: Val Meltger suspension bridge
short_description: This tour leads to the 12-metre-long bridge that connects the Val Meltger;

title: Brienz / Brinzauls Cultural Trail
long_description: The Brienz Cultural Trail offers many significant cultural assets, such as the ruins of Belfort Castle, the Calixtus Parish Church or the "Paunt da la dieschma" stone bridge. The tour is marked with signposts.

title: Seven Steps Trail
short_description: Built by slaves in colonial Brazil, the 7 Steps Trail begins in the midst of araucaria trees and continues through the dense Atlantic Forest until it reaches the beautiful waterfalls in Paraty.
long_description:
The Seven Steps Trail, also known as the Coffee Trail (Caminho do Café), begins in the midst of the araucárias and follows through the dense Atlantic Forest to the waterfalls in Paraty.This path was built in stone by slaves to transport the coffee produced in the Vale do Paraíba in the colonial Brazil in the nineteenth century. We can observe the cobblestones and the retaining walls made of stones, which form the steps, giving the trail its name.
Because it is in closed forest, the trail is very technical, with many paths, stones and steps. This makes the difficulty level of the trail even higher. On the way are found several watercourses and waterfalls. At the end of the trail is worth visiting the waterfall of the seven falls, beautiful and designed in the Atlantic Forest. At this place é found an infrastructure of toilets, kiosks, natural pool and snack.

images.caption: Cachoeira das Sete Quedas, Paraty, Rio de Janeiro
Pedra da Marcela, Paraty, Rio de Janeiro
Pedra da Marcela, Paraty, Rio de Janeiro

title: Bergün Wood Path
short_description: Simple circular trail on the theme of wood.
long_description: The circular trail, which is suitable for prams, focuses on the theme of wood. At nine posts you can, for example, smell stone pine wood or learn how to make a phone call with a tree. There is a fireplace in Crestota.

title: Prateleiras Mountains and Pedra Assentada trail in Itatiaia Park
short_description: Lovely walk to get to know and sight some of the most famous attractions of Itatiaia National Park.
long_description:
The trail starts from the side of the Rebouças Shelter and goes up to the base of the Shelves. The path é easy and signposted, however ém a little uneven and with some ups and downs. During the trail you will see one of the most famous attractions of the Park: the imposing Pico das Agulhas Negras (Black Needles Peak). Also on the way there is a short trail to the Cachoeira das Flores (Flowers Waterfall), which is worth visiting after the walk.
It is approximately 2 kilometers to the base of the Shelves. The climb to the top is suitable for people with experience in mountaineering, because in some parts é required the use of rope and safety equipment. Then follow towards the base of Pedra Assentada, passing by the stones of the Tartargua and Maçã and some of the most beautiful landscapes of the Planalto do Itatiaia.

short_description: Panoramic round tour to the highest peak of the Plessur Alps.

title: From Röthenbach station to Lindenberg to the Waldsee lake
short_description: Great skating trail on the former railway line Lindenberg - Röthenbach - Weiler.
long_description: Only pedestrians and cyclists are on the road here, so you usually have enough space for extensive cruising :-) At the finishing point of the tour, you can integrate another round (on foot) around the Waldsee, including the possibility to swim.

images.caption: Shortly after the station, in the direction of Lindenberg
On the former railway line, the route climbs slightly towards Lindenberg.
Spring Awakening on the Cycle Path

On the opposite bank you can see the modern Waldseebad.
There are also beautiful views over the lake in winter (here from the terrace of the open-air swimming pool).
Inline skating route in the Allgäu: from Röthenbach station to Lindenberg to the Waldsee lake
The trees around the lake glow in autumn colours.

title: Ås til Åsleden - Maglebjär to Bjeveröd
short_description: The seventh stage of the s til Åsledens goes from Maglebjär to Bjeveröd
long_description: On this section, spruce forests alternate with open fields. Along the way we keep finding piles of stones, some of which are ruins, but some of which were collected during the reclamation of the land and piled up here. The highlight of the tour is the sacred spring Onsvalakällan northöst of Höör. Then we reach the recreation area of Fulltofta, where our campsite is located.

title: Two castles Neuschwanstein and Hohenschwangau & two lakes Schwansee and Alpsee
short_description: The two peerless castles of Neuschwanstein and Hohenschwangau must be seen at least once in your life. The south of Bavaria impresses not only with the fabulous castles of King Louis, but also with the stunning mountain range of the Alps.
long_description:
Neuschwanstein Castle is probably one of those sights that Germany can flaunt in front of other countries. The castle has not been involved in any trouble at any time. This castle is standing on a splinter in such a way that it seems like it has always been there and will always be there. It is so fabulous and stunning that you can sit near it until late at night and not want to go home. It is beautiful and diverse at any time of the year, and with snow it dazzles with its beauty and immerses you in some mystery. We must admit that the castle is lonely, and inside it is said to be gloomy. But thanks to the daily flow of tourists, the castle finds the strength to create a fairy tale, on the background of which you can endlessly take pictures.
Walk through beautiful places, look for the fairy tale, open your soul, and share your photos.

images.caption: The front façade of the legendary castle
Lake Schwansee under a white blanket (skaters in despondency)
Glaciated Alpsee Lake in Alpine light
Don't you recognise me? I'm Ludovic, the most romantic king of Bavaria, I used to walk here too.
Lake Alpsee at sunset of the day
In fact, here it is Hohenschwangau Castle of the fairy-tale King Louis, where he spent his childhood.
The hunting lodge of the royal nobility
Hohenschwangau Castle and the neighbourhood where the fairy-tale King Louis walked.
A brook signals the proximity of Neuschwanstein Castle
And here comes Neuschwanstein Castle, the most mysterious and romantic of them all
The snow adds to the fairytale-like feel of Louis Castle
There's only one window with a light on.
The lonely and unique Neuschwanstein Castle
It's probably the most beautiful thing the creator ever imagined.
Hohenschwangau Castle and a nice warm winter evening
When you go home, you always want to take one last look back at Neuschwanstein

title: From the Chamanna Cluozza via the Murtersattel

images.caption: Murtersattel seen from Alp la Schera
Last rest before the poisonous counter-climb to P3
Airy bridge over the Lai da Ova Spin

title: From Zernez to the Chamanna Cluozza
short_description: Here the National Park Centre offers the opportunity to learn everything there is to know about the Swiss National Park.
long_description: We start the hike in Zernez, the gateway to the Swiss National Park. From Zernez we cross the river Spöl on a covered wooden bridge. We climb first over old field terraces and then steadily up through a sparse larch forest. Various vantage points give us a deep view into the Cluozza gorge, a view of the Quattervals massif or back to Zernez. After crossing the National Park border, we soon go downhill into the wild Cluozza valley, with a bit of luck we will see chamois and deer. Shortly after the stream we reach the Chamanna Cluozza park hut. Here we can spend the night in an idyllic setting.

images.caption: The ridge towards the Murtaröl offers a wonderful view of the Val Cluozza and the Murtersattel.

title: Easy hike above the Danube gorges (Ciucarul Mare peak)
short_description: The hiking trail that leads to the panoramic points above the Danube gorges is recommended to anyone visiting the area and looking for a relaxing walk. The hike offers some unique panoramas.
long_description:
The climb on Ciucărul Mare peak is worth totally approximately 20, 30 minutes of steep hike at the beginning of the climb. The rest of the walk is relaxing, on a marked path, in a deciduous forest.
The viewpoints above the gorges are the main reason why tourists come here. Fortunately, there are several such places along the route, accessible to one person at a time. Somewhere at the base of these rocky cliffs, on the Romanian side, is the entrance boat-only entrace to the Ponicova cave.
Although some tourists are only satisfied with the climb to the first viewpoint, it is worth doing the whole circuit. All the more so as the route practically surrounds the plateau. Just above the Dubova gulf, the landscape is even more spectacular, opening to the Mehedinți Mountains.

title: Alp la Schera
short_description: Hike for the whole family through beautiful forests in the Swiss National Park.
long_description: The starting point of this easy hike, which is also suitable for children, is Punt la Drossa on the Ofenpass road. Here you will find a post bus stop, the P4 car park and the entrance to the Munt la Schera tunnel, which leads to Livigno in Italy. We start hiking and climb steadily up through impressive, Canadian-looking forests. Numerous forest anthills can be seen. At the top of Alp la Schera we marvel at the view of Lago di Livigno with its mighty dam wall. The mountain alpine flora is extremely varied, but we are even more delighted to see marmots and, if we are lucky, even circling bearded vultures. We take the same way back, an option would have been the descent to Il Fuorn.

images.caption: Alpine pasture of the former Alp La Schera

title: Margun Grimmels
short_description: This is an easy hike through typical Erika mountain forest.
long_description: We start at Vallun Chafuol on the Ofenpass road (post bus stop and car park) and walk leisurely down to Margun Grimmels. At the picnic area we can take a break and admire the marmots playing. The view of the Lai da Ova Spin reservoir is impressive; it is connected to the larger Lago di Livigno reservoir as an equalising reservoir. We continue hiking, cross the Ofenpass road and reach our starting point through impressive forests with impressive browsing of spruce trees.

images.caption: There is also a lot to marvel at there
Always in close contact with the Lai da Ova Spin

title: Murtaröl circular hike
short_description: This wonderful circular hike takes us into a less frequently visited part of the Swiss National Park.
long_description: We start in Zernez, we will visit the National Park Centre another time, as we have a few metres to climb. We climb through a beautiful forest to the Bellavista hut. A little later we reach the tree line and the landscape becomes alpine. Via the north ridge we reach the Murtar and are rewarded with beautiful views towards the Upper Engadine and Piz Linard. Now we descend towards the west, initially with beautiful views into the Val Tantermozza. We see chamois and with luck even snow grouse, edelweiss grow along the path. We descend through the forest back to Zernez.

title: Kareri Lake Trek
short_description: Kareri Lake Trek is a one-day alpine trek located in the Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh that attracts hikers from all over the world. Situated at almost 3000 meters (9800 ft), Kareri lake is a shallow freshwater glacial lake formed by the melting snow of the Dhauladhar Mountains.
long_description:
The Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh is home to Kareri Lake. It is a tranquil high-altitude sweet water lake that may be accessed from Kareri Village by hiking. The lake is quite shallow and its water is pristine and transparent. The excess water of the lake drains into a cold stream called the Niyund Dhara which also serves as a trekking marker because it leads directly to the lake. The best time to visit this track is in the spring, especially if you want to observe the wildlife and the vegetation.
The one-way hiking route to this tranquil lake is 7 kilometres long (15 kilometres two-way) and usually takes 4 hours to reach from the base camp (8 hours when back and forth). Most hikers usually opt to spend the night at its quiet shores and return back the next day.
Novice hikers can also complete this hike in two phases to enjoy the full beauty of the landscapes: (1) from Kareri Khas Village to Reoti Village Base Camp & (2) from Reoti Village Base Camp to Kareri Lake.
The initial section of the trail is made up of pine, deodar, and oak forests, while its final section is made up of grassy alpine meadows interspersed with stony grounds. On the route, there are a few campgrounds where one can camp. Along the trail's course is a settlement of native Gaddi shepherds who have their own distinctive cultures. The hiking route is predominately flat with some inclining slopes. This trekking route is usually categorised as easy to moderate and can be covered in one day.
The Kareri Lake trek also acts as a base camp for the Minkiani Pass in the Dhauladhar Mountains and is a fun little hiking route suitable for hikers of all age groups.

images.caption: Kareri Lake trek in Himachal Pradesh, India.
Gera village bus stop is the last public transport point on the Dharamshala-Kareri Lake Trek.
Kareri Forest Resthouse which is the start point of Kareri lake trek in Himachal Pradesh, India.
The starting point of the Dharamshala-Kareri Lake trek in Himachal Pradesh, India.
Kareri Khas village area as seen from the trail, Himachal Pradesh, India
Part of Kareri village as seen from the trail. Himachal Pradesh, India.
A midway bridge on Dharamshala-Kareri lake trek route in Himachal Pradesh, India.
Trekkers with pony and other fellow hikers on the Kareri lake route in Himachal Pradesh, India.
Tents and hikers on the banks of Kareri Lake in Kangra district, Himachal Pradesh, India.
Kareri Lake trek in Himachal Pradesh, India.

title: Through the lonely Spöl Valley
short_description: The Spöl is the most important river in the Swiss National Park. On this seldom-travelled hike, we travel between the two reservoirs Lai da Ova Spin and Lago di Livigno.
long_description: We start our hike at Vallun Chafuol on the Ofenpass road. After the first descent, we cross the Spöl for the first time at Plan Praspöl. Now we hike through a secluded spruce and larch forest with splendid individual trees just above the river. After crossing to the other side of the valley, we climb up to Charbunera. The name Charbunera refers to a former cheese factory, from which the Ofenpass also takes its name. Now we descend again to Punt la Drossa, and the post bus takes us back to Vallun Chafuol.

images.caption: If it weren't for this bridge...

title: Jog around Milton Country Park
short_description: Jog around Milton Country Park. Approximately 2 miles taking around 30 minutes to complete

title: Hiking route Ameland
short_description: This route takes you along the uninhabited part of Ameland.
long_description: You will see beautiful nature on this tour.

title: Hiking from sea to mountain and back again
short_description: On this route we flee from the hot midday sun and take shelter in the forest, walking along the Carmen Sylva promenade, and then, in the evening, we go down to Lungomare.

images.caption: Mala Fortica / Stânca Reginei Elisabeta, punct de belvedere
Aranjament floral în parcul Angiolina în fața vilei cu același nume

title: From S-charl to Mot Tavrü
short_description: We start our hike at the Museum Schmelzra at the little village of S-charl;
long_description: This museum gives us a clear understanding of both the Bären and the mining history of the Val S-charl. After this information, we hike into the Val Tavr. With a constant ascent we approach the alp Tavrü with its traditional alpine use. From here we take the steeper path up to the ridge, which also forms the border to the Swiss National Park. Along the ridge it is only a short stretch to the summit of Mot Tavrü. The magnificent panorama inspires us and we see deer below us in the Val Foraz. We descend mostly on the same path, with a short, not quite so steep additional loop to Alp Tavrü.

title: Il Fuorn - Fuorcla Val dal Botsch - S-charl
From Selva Gardena to the Regensburg Hut
short_description: Easy and scenically impressive hike through the fantastic mountain world of Val Gardena
long_description: Starting from Selva Gardena, this beautiful hike leads through the picture-book landscape of Val Gardena with its rustic huts and green alpine meadows, past some mountain lakes and accompanied by a magnificent Alpine panorama. The destination of the tour is the Regensburger Hütte, where a stop with regional specialities awaits us. If you would like to extend the hike a little further, you can continue to the nearby Cislesalmen.

title: Trip around Rasna
short_description: This is tour for experienced and untouched tourists too. Get to know the interesting surroundings around the camp, especially for families and school trips.
long_description: This is tour for experienced and untouched tourists too. Get to know the interesting surroundings around the camp, especially for families and school trips. The runoff includes exits to several rocky peaks, in case of good weather and dry land, you can also climb the rocks, it is a beautiful sight to the surroundings. Flight is planted as a pulse, to sit down and rest. Rocks are a very interesting geological area, and the ravine has created the deciduous shapes, and the rocks look like mounds.

title: Crap Puter: panoramic view of the Lower Engadine
long_description:
The hike goes via Fontana Sura to the entrance of Val Zuort. Through the dense forest from Godplan we reach Resgia Plavna in half an hour. At the dwarf playground at the old sawmill, the tour crosses the Aua da Plavna stream. The subsequent ascent leads to Alp Laisch, which is open to the public in summer and offers guided tours of the alpine cheese dairy. A steep, shady climb through the Vals Arsas forest follows. At the fork, follow the path to the left in the direction of Motta Jüda and make a detour to Crap Puter.
From now on, the path descends in several hairpin bends to the Aua da Sampuoir stream. From the bridge, we follow the course of the valley to the connecting road between Sur-En and Ardez. Crossing the Inn, the trail leads directly to the Ardez railway station.

title: Road trip - Visiting the kulas in Oltenia
short_description: The route connecting the kulas or fortified mansions in Oltenia is one of the most picturesque and full of history routes that can be taken in this region. Besides, visiting the kulas in Oltenia is never just about visiting some houses, but also about scenic landscapes, natural monuments, and local folklore.
long_description:
In the counties of Vâlcea and Gorj you'll find most of the still-standing kulas (as many are now in ruin). Some of them can only be visited on the outside, others have been organized as museums.
Such a road trip is important to understand Oltenia's troubled history, but also to listen to stories about local thieves, outlaws, and revolutionaries full of nationalist ideals. Almost invariably, the route is related to the course that Tudor Vladimirescu took while preparing for the 1821 Revolution.
At the same time, visiting the kulas is about the lifestyle that local boyars used to have in this part of the country. Their elegance and refinement were constantly intertwined with their strong connection to their estates and with the permanent threat of Turkish invasions. This elegance is not only unique in Romania but it is also a different one compared to the baroque or neoclassical constructions ordered by the petty nobility around Bucharest or Iasi in the same period.
As presented here, this is a circular road trip, starting and returning in Râmnicu Vâlcea. The northern part passes through the sub-mountain Oltenia micro-region - a picturesque area overlooked by tourist guides, but full of surprises for a traveler eager to admire a variety of tourist attractions: here you will find some of the largest and most beautiful caves in Romania, wild gorges and canyons, monasteries, traditional villages. As always, a classic day of visiting can be combined with an active day, with a hiking or mountain biking route on the mountain valleys or maybe even towards higher peaks.
The route also reaches Târgu Jiu, where you must stop to admire the sculptural ensemble of Constantin Brâncuși. We do not recommend you to stopover in the city, but nearby, in Cartiu, for an extra charm.
The second part of the route passes through an area slightly poorer in tourist attractions; but the end makes up for it - you get to the heart of the Oltenia vineyards, where you can enjoy traditional wines.
For sure, taking this road trip with children is always a good idea. In addition to the fact that many accommodation options - in addition to those included here - provide a playground or the possibility of renting bicycles, the landscape will fascinate the kids, especially in the sub-mountainous part.
Visiting the kulas in Oltenia is a good vacation idea for any season. The museums along the way or the tourist attractions in the Polovragi area are accessible even in winter, wine tastings are welcome at any time - that's why there's no ideal season to take this route. However, keep in mind that some attractions are more crowded in the summer.

images.caption: The Gate of Kiss, Constantin Brâncuși
Casa Cartianu gueshouse in Cartiu, near Târgu Jiu

title: Bear theme trail "senda da l'uors" near S-charl
Muot la Sella: panoramic view Lower Engadine
long_description:
From Ardez railway station with its Engadine houses, this varied tour starts in the direction of Sur En down to the Inn bridge and continues over a few hairpin bends up the forest road in the direction of Alp Sursass / Muot la Sella. The forest road now turns into a hiking trail and climbs metre by metre through varied forest sections until the tree line is reached. The rather steep, not clearly visible path up to Muot la Sella is marked on stones. At the summit we enjoy the magnificent view over the Lower Engadine with the villages of Lavin, Guarda, Ardez, Ftan, Scuol and Sent.
The descent is initially via the same path until shortly after Alp Sursass, when you turn left, cross the picturesque village of Sur En, and then return to Ardez via the River Inn.

title: BIG FIVE Wildlife Watching Safari
short_description: On the BIG FIVE wildlife safari in the Kals am Großglockner region we go stalking with spotting scopes and binoculars and discover unique nature.
long_description: The BIG FIVE wildlife safari offers a unique panorama, wildlife and botanical features at over 2,000 metres. The „BIG FIVE“ are the „big five“ of the Hohe Tauern National Park (ibex, chamois, marmot, golden eagle and bearded vulture). With a ranger at your side, the hike turns into an interesting and educational discovery tour around the Großglockner.

title: Val Mingèr - Sur il Foss - Val Plavna
Short hike around Lu Palau/Palau
short_description: A charming, easy hike near Palau in Northern Sardinia, offering scenic views of rugged landscapes, Mediterranean vegetation, and picturesque coastal panoramas. The trail is not accessible to individuals with limited mobility due to uneven terrain.
long_description: This easy hiking trail near Palau, Sardinia, takes you through the unique granite rock formations, aromatic Mediterranean shrubs, and scenic viewpoints overlooking the coast. Perfect for a relaxed outing, the route offers opportunities for photography and enjoying the tranquil Sardinian countryside. However, the trail includes uneven ground and narrow paths, making it unsuitable for individuals with limited abilities. Proper footwear and basic hiking essentials are recommended.

title: Cerro Alfaro (Desierto de Tabernas)
short_description: Uno de los paisajes naturales más impresionantes que podemos encontrar en Almería es el Parque Natural del Desierto de Taberna.
long_description: ¡Uno de los raros desiertos de la Península Ibérica y de hecho de toda Europa! Entre las Sierras de los Filabres y Alhamilla, el árido paisaje de la vega almeriense te sorprenderá. Varios cañones, cañones y bulevares crean un paisaje completamente único en nuestro país. Tanto es así que estamos hablando de una escena de película real. El desierto de Taberna es famoso por ser el lugar de rodaje de muchas producciones de Hollywood. Por supuesto, este parque natural tiene muchas atracciones y varias rutas de senderismo para explorar la zona. En este caso hablaremos de la ruta del Cerro de Alfaro.

title: The Linden Tree from Linn
short_description: The attraction of this hike is the 700 to 800 year old lime tree of Linn.
long_description: It has a trunk circumference of 11 metres and is one of the most impressive natural monuments in Switzerland. The tour starts in Brugg, leads through the picturesque old town, past the hamlet of Vierlinden and through the Widacherwald to the lime tree. After enjoying the view and admiring the tree, the trail continues up to the Linnerberg. Resting benches and a fireplace invite you to take a break. First down to Kilholz and then up again along the Hard saddle to Staffelegg, from where you can easily catch the bus to Aarau or Frick.

title: Gisliflue - beautiful vantage point in Aargau
long_description: This varied hike offers many interesting insights into the surroundings of the first Jura chain. Right at the beginning of the tour, the image of the cement factory and the associated limestone quarries dominates. Once you have passed these, the ascent begins through the beautiful beech forest steeply up to the Gisliflue. You are rewarded with a wonderful panoramic view. The descent is via Gatter to Staffelegg.

title: Pleasure hiking route Jungholz
short_description: This Jungholzer hiking/walking route offers families and couples a unique and romantic view of the idyll of Jungholz. The incredible nature, but also the culture of this destination will leave a lasting impression. The view, but also the minimum level of difficulty, play an important role!
long_description: A wonderful short and easy tour with a great view of the local mountain and the Allgaeu Alps, starting from the free and spacious car park in the Langenschwand district. The trail starts right in front of the Waldhorn Hotel (about 300 meters from the parking lot) and ends above the village in a 3.5 kilometer long and optimally developed hiking trail. After around 700 meters you land at the Jungholz treading pool with a refreshing drinking water fountain to enjoy the wonderful view of the Sorgschrofen local mountain. A few hundred meters further there is a letter (part of the letter path in Jungholz) which aims directly at the church of the village and emphasizes the idyll of the place. After further sights, such as faces carved in tree trunks, you end up at the most impressive place of this tour. The artificial snow-making lake with a wonderful and romantic view of the far-reaching Allgäu Alps is a relaxation point to dream about. The further tour ends in the village with a special church, which is very old-fashioned but very well cared for. The then signposted forest path with its pure nature reflects this excursion. Back at the Langenschwander car park, the Kamelstüble restaurant and cafe offers a calm and relaxed end to the short trip, where small but fine delicacies and drinks can also be purchased.

images.caption: Letter O (Buchstabenweg Jungholz) in the direction of the village centre

title: Front Glärnisch
short_description: This tour offers a dream view of the Klöntal, the Linthtal and Glarus, which you can enjoy after an unusual climb.
long_description: Hinter Saggberg can be reached by a leisurely half-hour walk through the forest from the Rhodannenberg post bus stop. Following the course of the stream, the path leads to the Gleiter, which offers the most varied part of the hike. Thanks to wire ropes, the exposed parts are easy to walk on. In the Glärnischplanggen, however, the tour becomes difficult due to the steep slopes and debris. The view of the summit rewards the efforts.

title: From Lichtenfels to the Staffelberg
short_description: We enjoy a scenic hike up the Staffelberg, one of the most important peaks in Franconia. We learn more about the geology of the mountain from numerous information boards.
long_description: After being captivated by the historic charm of the old town of Lichtenfels, we have to make do with a rather monotonous section of the trail until behind the last houses of the town. We hike up to the Hoher Rangen. Behind it we make a detour to the Vierzehnheiligen Basilica. Via the Spitzberg we reach the Staffelberg. After a rest on the summit, we descend to Bad Staffelstein.

images.caption: Baskets in the old town of Lichtenfels
Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary Lichtenfels
No view at the Hohe Rangen
Ceiling painting in the Basilica of Vierzehnheiligen
On the way to the Staffelberg

title: Chamerstock
short_description: The exclusive location between Urnerboden and the Tödimassiv, as well as the «lift» of the Fisetengratbahn make the Chamerstock a popular hiking destination in the region.
long_description:
Following the marked mountain path, always along the ridge, you reach the highest point before an easy descent leads to the summit. Follow the same path back to the starting point.
You can enjoy a magnificent view of the imposing rock wall from the Ortstock üvia the Jegerstöcke to the Glatten at the Klausenpass and of the mighty ice fractures of the Bifertenfirn at the Tödi.

images.caption: Hiking in the face of death
Comfortably with the cable car to the starting point
But it also works like this...

title: 20 minutes jogging through the Schönbuch
short_description: Short jogging route from Dettenhausen station, through the forest, to Weil im Schönbuch and back.
long_description: Ideal for anyone who wants to clear their head after a long day at work: A five-kilometre short jogging route. Starting from the train station in Dettenhausen, through the Schönbuch nature reserve, past the local shooting club, the Weiler adventure golf and the tennis hall. After a short stretch along the road, the route then follows the Schaich back to the Dettenhausen railway station. Especially suitable for those who like to remain unseen while exercising and appreciate the beauty of the forest

title: From Aarau to Frick via the Strihen
Three focal points at one stroke
Jura - High trail between Staffelegg and Barmelweid
Salhöhe - Aarau
short_description: Scenic hike from Salhöhe to Aarau.
long_description: At the start of this hike, the Salh bus stop, you can enjoy a beautiful view of the hilly Jura landscape with the Schinberg, the two strands and the ridge of the Wasserflue. The tour first leads downhill, then up to Ramsflue, where you can also enjoy the view. Via Egg, the route descends steeply to Brunnenberg and Alpenzeiger. The third magnificent vantage point opens up a view of the cantonal capital and the Alps. A panorama board explains the mountain peaks to be seen. From here, the path leads down to the city, along the Aare and finally to the station.

title: Birmenstorf - Mellingen
short_description: Easy hike along the Reuss.

title: Anwil BL - Schupfart
short_description: The tour starts in Anwil with its picturesque village fountain and pretty farmhouses and heads in a northerly direction. The path goes through the forest towards Limperg and Frick.
long_description: A narrow path leads through the woods of the Tiersteinberg, a nature reserve, via Fazedelle to Fricktal-Schupfart Airport. Here you can experience flight operations at first hand. A short way back along the same path, follow the signpost to the left to the destination of Schupfart, from where you can take the bus back to the starting point.

title: Tour with viewpoint "Golului" hill
short_description: A short tour into the countryside, with beautiful panoramas of Reșița and its surroundings.

title: Two in one stroke (Rautispitz and Wiggis)
short_description: The mighty cliffs of the Rautispitz and the Wiggis already stand out at the entrance to the Linthal.
long_description: But the rugged front offers a beautiful and gently rounded landscape from behind. This classic tour of the Glarus region also starts here. From the beautifully situated Obersee, you first walk along its shore until the path turns left towards Geisskappel and continues up to the Rautispitz. The path to the Wiggis should only be taken in dry weather conditions, as the path there is narrow and slippery (T3-T4 in this area). Via the Rautialp and the Grapplistafel, follow the trail back to the starting point.

images.caption: Ski home - probably not any more today...

title: Alpine hike from Hirzer mountain station Klammeben to the peak Pfandlspitz
short_description: This tour leads from Hirzer mountain station Klammeben via the Hirzer hut to Pfandlspitz and on the way back via Mahdalm and Reseggeralm to the mountain station.
long_description:
The valley station of the Hirzer cable car is in Saltaus (490m) in the Passeier Valley. Take the cable car via the Prenn middle station (1,404 m) to the Klammeben mountain station (1,980 m). Here the tour begins!
From Klammeben you can reach the Hirzer hut via paths and gravel paths. From there it goes up to the Pfandlspitz (2538m), from where you have a great view of the Passeier Valley. The tour leads through alpine terrain and includes rocky sections and secured trails. On the way back you pass the Mahdalm and the Reseggeralm before you reach Klammeben.

title: High alp
long_description: This very popular tour is very busy at the weekend. The ascent from Schwägalp is therefore correspondingly more pleasant and interesting. The first part of the route is clearly marked as a snowshoe hiking trail. It leads over Chräzerenpass to the vantage point at Spicher. From here it goes along the steep flank to Älpli and further along the Ostrippe up to Hochalp. Along the winter hiking trail via Färenstetten, the route leads down to Urnäsch Schwantelen.

title: Sidelhorn
long_description: The tour starts in Oberwald and first follows the alpine road until you reach the forest road towards Grimsel. From here you climb up to the Nassbode, cutting the bends. You can also follow the tracked route. From Nassbode, the trail leads north-west through hollows and a small saddle, later over the SW ridge up to the Sidelhorn, where you have an overwhelming view.

title: Brudelhorn
long_description: This dream tour offers an overwhelming view and is therefore very popular with both snowshoe hikers and ski tourers. From the small bridge next to the railway station, cross the cross-country ski trail in the direction of Mossmattebächi. Now it is important not to cross too early to the left into the forest, so that you meet the path to Unner Flesche. From here the forest thins out and you take a large right-hand bend up to Altstafel. Over hollows and crests, the trail leads in open terrain via Brau over the ridge to the summit.

title: Hiking to the top of Gurghiu Mountains - Saca Mare (1776m)
short_description: The hike up to Saca Mare (1776m), the highest peak in the Gurghiu Mountains, starts near the Aluniș Ski Slope, just outside the Sovata resort. Ideally, you do this route by foot, but there are many who go up with off-road vehicles from Bucin Pass.
long_description:
The route described here is a circuit. It starts from the Sovata stone quarry, about 2 kilometers upstream from the barrier at Valea Sebeșului, which provides access to the quarry road.
The first part of the route is marked with a red dot, and crosses paths with a blue strip pathway about 15 minutes before reaching the peak; the second part descends on this blue stripe path.
The path marked with the red dot is less frequented, sometimes more difficult to guess, with less visible signs in some places, with a fresher and sometimes more surprising nature. Also, while on this section, there are higher chances of meeting a bear.
Shortly after entering the blue stripe route, you get to the Saca Refuge and to an observatory. 10 minutes later, you reach the peak. From the plateau where the Saca Mare peak is located, in clear conditions, you can spot not only the surrounding mountains (Giurgeu, Harghita, Hășmaș) but even Rodnei or Piatra Craiului Mountains. Perfect visibility is usually achieved in winter when there's no atmospheric pressure.
Descending on the blue stripe path, you have more chances to meet other hikers, and the path is broader and more visible. In fact, more than half of this route is on a forest road.

images.caption: Lots of junipers on the Saca Mare plateau

title: My King's Forest trail running circuit 1, Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk
short_description: If you're looking for trail running routes in the Bury St Edmunds area, the quiet surroundings of King's Forest provide plenty of solid options. This is my go-to one when I feel like stretching my legs.
long_description:
Like its larger neighbour (I'm looking at you, Thetford), the great thing about King's Forest is the extensive network of paths and trails that runs through it, which means that you can walk or jog distances that suit your personal fitness level and plans.  The woods are also very peaceful and the further you get from the car parking areas, the fewer people you're likely to encounter. 
As someone who prefers to run longer distances, the thing I like about this particular route is that it blends forest with stretches of open countryside and in doing so, creates a run that is quite actually varied and interesting (relatively speaking).
If you want to mix things up, the route is equally doable in reverse. It's also suitable throughout the year. You can even hike the route if you're not into running. 
Check out my other route nearby:  My King's Forest trail running circuit 2, Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk

images.caption: The latter stages that skirt along the edges of the forest
A gorgeous old house in West Stow
The noticeboard in the car park
Dogs aren't allowed in the area on the other side of the Brandon road

title: An interesting walk around the Dubrovica estate
short_description: The charming Dubrovitsy estate to the south of Moscow and west of Podolsk has been boasting of its beauty and sophistication for centuries. But there is no museum in it, much less an entrance.
long_description:
The charming Dubrovitsy estate to the south of Moscow and west of Podolsk has been boasting of its beauty and delicacy for centuries. But it no longer has a museum and entry is forbidden.
Our walking route around the estate will at least give us some insight into the outside of the estate and its park area. There is a linden grove in the park, and rumour has it that Peter the Great planted the first linden trees. The 17th century manor house first belonged to Boyar Morozov. Then the Golitsyns took a liking to it, who never parted with the manor for centuries. However, Catherine II found out about some machinations of her Golitsyn and gave the manor to her new favourite - Potemkin. The tsarina knew a lot about gifts. After Potemkin the estate passed to Count Dmitriev-Morozov. During the Soviet times the estate finally began to serve the people and the land on which it is situated. The Institute of cattle breeding and civil registry office was established in the manor. The beautiful place is now set aside for weddings, and it lifts the spirits of newlyweds.
The main attraction in Dubrovica – is the Church of the Sign of the Blessed Virgin Mary. It was built in baroque style and at first it was so unusual that people resisted its consecration.
But our route awaits us in the parkland, which is free of charge.

images.caption: Dubrovitsy manor house with Church of the Sign
Church of the Sign of the Blessed Virgin Mary in Dubrovitsy
Church of the Sign of the Blessed Virgin Mary in Dubrovitsy
The main house of the Dubrovitsy estate

title: Nature Experience Trail - Lautertal
short_description:
An interesting tour for children and adults alike.

Note: GPS-guided hiking!
long_description:
We start at the holiday home and walk towards the south until we reach the district road towards Eichelhain. After crossing the road, walk past the sports field to the next windbreak.
Follow this and you will come to a bench with a good view over the district of Engelrod. Continue on to the windbreak that separates the markings, with a wonderful distant view as far as the Rhön.
Downhill to Eichelhain and then steeply uphill again. A long, sloping straight road leads to the district road to Lanzenhain, which we follow for a few metres
and reach the „Karl-August-Vieregge-Anlage“ (named after a former district administrator of the old district of Lauterbach, a special supporter of nature conservation). The nature trail begins here. You can now walk along it or continue to Eichenrod to the children's playground with a rest area.
In Eichenrod you have the option of stopping at the Bloß inn. From there we walk to the Hopfmannsfeld gallows. Here a display board informs about its origin. In addition, there are bars and tables for a rest. From here we walk along paths without steep inclines, past the Engelröm cemetery and back to the holiday home.

title: Hike along the Achensee
short_description: This tour impresses with the scenic beauty around the elongated Achensee. For the way back we choose the ferry across the lake.
long_description:
With an area of approx. 6.8 square kilometres, Lake Achensee is the largest lake in Tyrol. Its main part forms the border between the Karwendel and Rofan mountains. Because of its elongated shape, it is often compared to a fjord. We hike along the lower flanks of the steep rock faces that tower up on its banks.
On the first section of the hike along the Achensee to the Gaisalm, we are offered many bathing opportunities. Up to the Alm, the path is very easy to walk. In the second part, the Gaisalmsteig, it becomes steeper and more exposed. Here, mountain pines alternate with bushes and pines, and in between we pass some scree fields.
At about the halfway point of the tour, we reach the Gaisalm, a managed hut. It is the only alpine pasture with a boat connection and can only be reached on foot or via the lake. Along the lake we experience the vegetation typical of the Karwendel: bushes, alpine meadows, extensive stands of mountain pines, pine forests and scree areas. On the north shore we finally come to the landing stage of the Achensee shipping company. We use a ferry for the way back and can thus admire the blue shining lake in all its beauty.

images.caption: Bay in front of the Gaisalm.
Behind the Gaisalm, the path becomes steeper and more exposed.

title: The Simmental House Trail
short_description: The Simmentaler Hausweg leads past beautiful old farmhouses through the strongly rural Simmental valley.
long_description: Through the village, the trail goes up to Tal and on to Oberberg. The hike continues gently up and down via the hamlets of Eschlen and Balzenberg to Nidflue. Past the former Weissenburgbad, which housed prominent guests for years, but finally burned down in 1974, the trail continues to Brüel to the beautifully renovated Vennerhaus. In the direction of Oberwil, you should let your gaze wander to the right in the direction of the striking rocks. Thousands of bones and stone tools have been found in the three caves there. These can be visited. Finally, in Adlemsried, you hike downhill to your destination Boltigen.

images.caption: Historical sights at the former Weissenburgbad.

title: Lenzerheide - Crest ota - Lenzerheide
short_description: Schöner Spaziergang durch die Siedlung an der Rothorn-Seite in Lenzerheide

images.caption: Winter hike in Albula: Lenzerheide - Crest ota - Lenzerheide
View of the Valletta del Güglia
